commit_message:
Re-factored rpc serializer

This patch cleans up the current rpc
implementation by moving the seralizer
back to the rpc module, this is more in
line with other projects; such as Nova.

- Moved _init_serializer back into rpc.
- Added back unit-tests for profiler.

Change-Id: Ia148b2d3bc352e96e7633f7af82ecd26b5f35e35

commit_message:
Stop ironic services in unupgraded controllers

This change makes ironic services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgraded controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: Iedddb02c4a27195d0f89bc4b9dfb12ffba054ae5
(cherry picked from commit 099badda3caa6304416b35c826d972866097a26b)
(cherry picked from commit e3b75f1dbf3cedaab2c07988d7c3249ad9021e4f)

commit_message:
Add reno for change Ic3c555226a220efd9b0f27edffccf6c4c95c2747

Change Ic3c555226a220efd9b0f27edffccf6c4c95c2747 introduced some
validation for the 'openstack server group create --policy' command.
Call this out in the release notes.

Change-Id: I7e00851a03470364db00f0f114fc724b0f686b72
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit bb15b29190dfe77ea0218a01edc1f4886993b177)

[{'created': '2021-02-19 21:33:25.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Implement FlexGroup pool

Adds the support for FlexGroup pool using the NFS storage mode.

The FlexGroup pool has a different view of aggregate capabilites,
changing them by a list of elements, instead of an element. They
are: `netapp_aggregate`, `netapp_raid_type`, `netapp_disk_type`
and `netapp_hybrid_aggregate`. The `netapp_aggregate_used_percent`
capability is an average of used percent of all FlexGroup's
aggregates.

The `utilization` capability is not calculated to FlexGroup pools,
it is always set to default value.

"}, {'created': '2021-03-05 22:07:09.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Implement FlexGroup pool

Adds the support for FlexGroup pool using the NFS storage mode.

The FlexGroup pool has a different view of aggregate capabilites,
changing them by a list of elements, instead of an element. They
are: `netapp_aggregate`, `netapp_raid_type`, `netapp_disk_type`
and `netapp_hybrid_aggregate`. The `netapp_aggregate_used_percent`
capability is an average of used percent of all FlexGroup's
aggregates.

The `utilization` capability is not calculated to FlexGroup pools,
it is always set to default value.

The driver cannot support consistency group with volumens that are
over FlexGroup pools.

ONTAP does not support FlexClone for file inside a FlexGroup pool,
so the operations of clone volume, create snapshot and create volume
from an image are implemented as the NFS generic driver.

The driver with FlexGroup pools has the snapshot support disabled, requiring
that setting the `nfs_snapshot_supprot` to true on the backend definition.
This config is the same as the NFS generic driver.

The driver image cache relies on FlexClone for file, so it is not applied
for volumes over FlexGroup pools. It can use the core cache image, though.

Implements: blueprint netapp-flexgroup-support
Change-Id: I507083c3e34e5a5cf1db9a3d1f6bef47bd51a9f8
"}, {'created': '2021-03-12 20:51:16.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Implement FlexGroup pool

The driver image cache relies on FlexClone for file, so it is not applied

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Implement FlexGroup pool

Adds the support for FlexGroup pool using the NFS storage mode.

The FlexGroup pool has a different view of aggregate capabilites,
changing them by a list of elements, instead of an element. They
are: `netapp_aggregate`, `netapp_raid_type`, `netapp_disk_type`
and `netapp_hybrid_aggregate`. The `netapp_aggregate_used_percent`
capability is an average of used percent of all FlexGroup's
aggregates.

The `utilization` capability is not calculated to FlexGroup pools,
it is always set to default value.

The driver cannot support consistency group with volumens that are
over FlexGroup pools.

ONTAP does not support FlexClone for file inside a FlexGroup pool,
so the operations of clone volume, create snapshot and create volume
from an image are implemented as the NFS generic driver.

The driver with FlexGroup pools has the snapshot support disabled, requiring
that setting the `nfs_snapshot_supprot` to true on the backend definition.
This config is the same as the NFS generic driver.

The driver image cache relies on FlexClone for file, so it is not applied
for volumes over FlexGroup pools. It can use the core cache image, though.

The QoS minimum is only enabled for FlexGroup pool if all nodes of the
FlexGroup support it.

Implements: blueprint netapp-flexgroup-support
Change-Id: I507083c3e34e5a5cf1db9a3d1f6bef47bd51a9f8

[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-16 18:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-17 08:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Do we really need that if https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/780802 is going to be merged and https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/780860 is already merged?'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-17 21:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We can't bump neutron-lib in requirements without disabling those tests. Once we have n-lib 2.10.0 we'll merge the fixes for those UTs that only work with this n-lib 2.10.0.

Those UTs can't work with new and old n-lib version. And with those tests we won't be able to bump n-lib in releases."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-18 08:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/780860 was merged disabling neutron py36'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-18 08:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Enable neutron plugin for Octavia

This patch cleary enables a `neutron plugin` for the functional test
of `tacker-functional-devstack-multinode-sol-kubernetes` in zuul.

[1] is fixed in the Octavia on the assumption that using a `octavia
create_network_interface_device` function[2] of the Neutron.
According to [1], if using the Octavia, it seems that the
`neutron plugin` needs to be clearly define.

Also currentry the functional test of
`tacker-functional-devstack-multinode-sol-kubernetes` is not became
`-1` status on zuul when zuul's result even is `RETRY_LIMIT` because
 job's voting is `non-vorting`. So this patch changes from
`non-voting` to `voting` in zuul's job results.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/commit/651f095a818c9a30441ed8df9a39cf726b6e3f5d
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/devstack/lib/octavia#L7-L28

Closes-Bug: 1919396
Change-Id: I999a2c7c06528c7470cec2161bdd361a67a8da6f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-07 11:16:46.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Support CNF scale operations based on ETSI NFV

Implements Container based VNF scale operation support with ESTI
NFV-SOL003 v2.6.1 VNF Lifecycle Management. Users can scale the number
of pod replicas managed by controller resources such as Kubernetes
Deployment, StatefulSet, and ReplicaSet.

Other changes:
* Check the vnf_state before scale operation in controller as other
  LCM operations.

Implements: blueprint support-cnf-scale
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-cnf-scale.rst
Change-Id: I739fa60a18323b248bc913f6062ef2138ad2e6ee

commit_message:
Support CNF scale operations based on ETSI NFV

Implements Container based VNF scale operation support with ETSI
NFV-SOL003 v2.6.1 VNF Lifecycle Management. Users can scale the number
of pod replicas managed by controller resources such as Kubernetes
Deployment, StatefulSet, and ReplicaSet.

Other changes:
* Check the vnf_state before scale operation in controller as other
  LCM operations.
* Enable to store multiple flavour to `vnfd_attribute` when
  `Conductor._onboard_vnfd()` method called.
* For FT, sqlalchemy is used, which calls functions in pymysql.py,
  so the dependency module PyMySQL needs to be added.

Implements: blueprint support-cnf-scale
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-cnf-scale.rst
Change-Id: I739fa60a18323b248bc913f6062ef2138ad2e6ee

commit_message:
Collect logs in post when not collected in run phase

Noticed in https://review.opendev.org/780856 when
job times out logs are not collected.
Collected logs can be helpful for debugging the issue
for which job timed out.

Change-Id: I315447073294896b1af6b94db917a11a9dfee506

commit_message:
Delete system role assignments from system_assignment table

This patch ensures to delete the system role assignments from
all the assignment tables in keystone after deleting the role
user has over the system.

This also make sure of deleting stale role assignments before
deleting role for the deployments that are already in this state.

Closes-Bug: #1878938

Change-Id: I4df19c45c870ff3fb78578ca1fb7dd0d35da3c82
(cherry picked from commit c1dcbb05b4488f1fa3e7af4d9171d11702d94119)
(cherry picked from commit b83170a386ba8da2195c7494d04d832ce9b6d7b0)
(cherry picked from commit 6f93063ff95f3c65af106a09281427e411d01850)
(cherry picked from commit 7ac0891375656d156f1a9601e3520052dddb39d0)

commit_message:
Enable TLS for Prometheus

This patchset enabled TLS path for Prometheus when it acts as
a server.  Note that TLS is not directly terminated at Prometheus.
TLS is terminated at apache proxy which in turn route request
to Prometheus.

Change-Id: I0db366b6237a34da2e9a31345d96ae8f63815fa2

commit_message:
Use headless option for cors functional test runner

Some selenium webdrivers (e.g. Chrome, Firefox) support a headless
option so we can expose that as an option for the test runner too.

Use this in an attempt to fix "Error: cannot open display: :99" errors
seen in the gate.

Related-Bug: #1918864
Change-Id: I2a549ce829eb0bc38406575582202e1d8dd1a0e2

[{'created': '2021-03-17 17:23:11.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Move grenade jobs to experimental

Grenade jobs in stable/pike are failing as stable/ocata's devstack
is broken and no fix is available. This patch moves out the grenade
jobs from check and gate jobs to experimental. In this way we are
not wasting resources, but still there is the option to run grenade
jobs in case ocata is somehow fixed.

Change-Id: I8fceeb6dd3ce1a1e888dfe68f4e0910009d506b3
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Move grenade jobs to experimental

Grenade jobs in stable/pike are failing as stable/ocata's devstack
is broken and no fix is available. This patch moves out the grenade
jobs from check and gate jobs to experimental. In this way we are
not wasting resources, but still there is the option to run grenade
jobs in case ocata is somehow fixed.

Change-Id: I8fceeb6dd3ce1a1e888dfe68f4e0910009d506b3

parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)

"}]
commit_message:
Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)
(cherry picked from commit ff23708ef47baa9cb67c0afa30edb1ec5c6da802)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 03:30:26.000000000', 'message': "Add virtualenv requirement to tox.ini

We're getting divergence between local test runs and the gate based
on what version of pip is being used by tox, which depends on what
version of virtualenv (which specifies the versions of pip,
setuptools, and wheel) that tox uses in your local environment.  To
eliminate guesswork, tell tox what version of virtualenv it should
use.  Also specify a minversion of tox that can do this.

Change-Id: I01451ec27d3ad6e759636902e497272a89cf6d16
"}]
commit_message:
Add virtualenv requirement to tox.ini

We're getting divergence between local test runs and the gate based
on what version of pip is being used by tox, which depends on what
version of virtualenv (which specifies the versions of pip,
setuptools, and wheel) that tox uses in your local environment.  To
eliminate guesswork, tell tox what version of virtualenv it should
use.  Also specify a minversion of tox that can do this.

Change-Id: I01451ec27d3ad6e759636902e497272a89cf6d16

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-10 18:43:41.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Increase incremental and max sleep time during device detach

Bug #1894804 outlines how DEVICE_DELETED events were often missing from
QEMU on Focal based OpenStack CI hosts as originally seen in bug
 #1882521. This has eventually been tracked down to some undefined QEMU
behaviour when a new device_del QMP command is received while another is
still being processed, causing the original attempt to be aborted.

We hit this race in slower OpenStack CI envs as n-cpu rather crudely
retries attempts to detach devices using the RetryDecorator from
oslo.service. The default incremental sleep time currently being tight
enough to ensure QEMU is still processing the first device_del request
on these slower CI hosts when n-cpu asks libvirt to retry the detach,
sending another device_del to QEMU hitting the above behaviour.

Additionally we have also seen the following check being hit when
testing with QEMU >= v5.0.0. This check now rejects overlapping
device_del requests in QEMU rather than aborting the original:

https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/cce8944cc9efab47d4bf29cfffb3470371c3541b

This change aims to avoid this situation entirely by raising the default
incremental sleep time between detach requests from 2 seconds to 10,
leaving enough time for the first attempt to complete. The overall
maximum sleep time is also increased from 30 to 60 seconds.

Future work will aim to entirely remove this retry logic with a libvirt
event driven approach, polling for the the
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED and
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVAL_FAILED events before retrying.

Finally, the cleanup of unused arguments in detach_device_with_retry is
left for a follow up change in order to keep this initial change small
enough to quickly backport.

Closes-Bug: #1882521
Related-Bug: #1894804
Change-Id: Ib9ed7069cef5b73033351f7a78a3fb566753970d
(cherry picked from commit dd1e6d4b0cee465fd89744e306fcd25228b3f7cc)

commit_message:
libvirt: Increase incremental and max sleep time during device detach

Bug #1894804 outlines how DEVICE_DELETED events were often missing from
QEMU on Focal based OpenStack CI hosts as originally seen in bug
 #1882521. This has eventually been tracked down to some undefined QEMU
behaviour when a new device_del QMP command is received while another is
still being processed, causing the original attempt to be aborted.

We hit this race in slower OpenStack CI envs as n-cpu rather crudely
retries attempts to detach devices using the RetryDecorator from
oslo.service. The default incremental sleep time currently being tight
enough to ensure QEMU is still processing the first device_del request
on these slower CI hosts when n-cpu asks libvirt to retry the detach,
sending another device_del to QEMU hitting the above behaviour.

Additionally we have also seen the following check being hit when
testing with QEMU >= v5.0.0. This check now rejects overlapping
device_del requests in QEMU rather than aborting the original:

https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/cce8944cc9efab47d4bf29cfffb3470371c3541b

This change aims to avoid this situation entirely by raising the default
incremental sleep time between detach requests from 2 seconds to 10,
leaving enough time for the first attempt to complete. The overall
maximum sleep time is also increased from 30 to 60 seconds.

Future work will aim to entirely remove this retry logic with a libvirt
event driven approach, polling for the the
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED and
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVAL_FAILED events before retrying.

Finally, the cleanup of unused arguments in detach_device_with_retry is
left for a follow up change in order to keep this initial change small
enough to quickly backport.

Closes-Bug: #1882521
Related-Bug: #1894804
Change-Id: Ib9ed7069cef5b73033351f7a78a3fb566753970d
(cherry picked from commit dd1e6d4b0cee465fd89744e306fcd25228b3f7cc)
(cherry picked from commit 4819f694b2e2d5688fdac7e850f1a6c592253d6b)

commit_message:
Set volume type for creating volumes from snapshots/volumes

Horizon will not correctly set the volume type when creating volumes
from snapshots or volumes that do not use the default volume type. This
patch ensures the type of the originating volume is read and set for
the new device.

Change-Id: I1eb427d2fe4f6851968a3cd9c8c3ad17ac3795f2
Closes-Bug: #1885357

commit_message:
Stop barbican servics in unupgraded controllers

This change makes barbican services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgrade controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I7031064b752450bacbb7775c0e357b98210a8929
(cherry picked from commit 6f140b93be8349eddb7e6cd86116ab1b3f34140a)
(cherry picked from commit c996c85caea5ac098c6d57066c144adb05354c49)
(cherry picked from commit 34c96db0e819afc92cf33676010492ba03024371)

commit_message:
Add TLS support to services using memcached

This patch enables TLS connections to memcached in services which
support it. Specifically the settings are consumed by swift's internal
memcached client through puppet-swift; or oslo.cache, through
puppet-ceilometer, puppet-keystone, puppet-nova, puppet-heat
and puppet-oslo.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/772685
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/761605
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/764764
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/764763
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/765100
Change-Id: Ic77ed56c32c7071ce126a1528030094b97894653

commit_message:
Handle cinder_mount_point_base for cinder mounting needs

Adding cinder_mount_point_base parameter, to provide the
mount point for *fs volumes.

Depends-On: Ib724f6e895716847827be48ed08b01a7a312338f
Change-Id: I3f9004fd8abffefe8cfeee9011ed0e323652fdd1
(cherry picked from commit a2dbbaedabf81ac8dd5438eee3857c4a29b95f1a)
(cherry picked from commit 1234d16497d26c1e5f1ac249f9800358820a9dec)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 20:18:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add ports filtering support to XtremIO Cinder driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/776264
Closes-Bug: #1915800
Change-Id: Ib689f08e414f3a10d18ed34932f8a314be7a7344
'}, {'created': '2021-02-18 12:51:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add ports filtering support to XtremIO Cinder driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/776264
Related-Bug: #1915800
Change-Id: Ib689f08e414f3a10d18ed34932f8a314be7a7344
'}]
commit_message:
Add ports filtering support to XtremIO Cinder driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/776264
Related-Bug: #1915800
Change-Id: Ib689f08e414f3a10d18ed34932f8a314be7a7344

commit_message:
Stop octavia servics in unupgraded controllers

This change makes octavia services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgrade controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I51855841c269ec593933288af4135f5d06a139fe
(cherry picked from commit b3d7836952404bf989507c908f46217a1996939a)
(cherry picked from commit bbf25f9377b603511dee3e3e9bc3f4fbda998266)
(cherry picked from commit 9740d89f15da279f239eea4a7e81ac762200a5e9)

commit_message:
NFS: Fix for groups and cloning

Recently we merged change I43036837274a7c8dba612db53b34a6ce2cfb2f07
which adds format info support for *fs type volumes.
This seems to cause issues when volume has groups or we are cloning
from a bootable volume.
This patch disables the format info support for volumes with groups
and fixes the issue with cloning.

Change-Id: I41ffedfa1abd0708c84494a0aaaa3815810102b8

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

We can't distribute libraries inside Horizon's source code like this, or they won't be able to package it for Debian and Fedora. We have to have the libraries packaged separately, so that they can be updated system-wide when needed."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-07-25 03:47:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

More detail information on thirdparty JS libraries is described at https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/packaging.html. As Radomir commented we cannot have embedded copy in the horizon repo. Another note is we don't maintain minified files. The source repository should contain code before minified."}, {'account_id': 30474, 'date': '2019-07-26 15:51:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-07-29 14:14:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

When I test this patch in my local environment and perform below operation it doesn't show me the desired output
and also behavior is not consistent as well :
1. The 'volume' quota for my project is 10.
2. I have 9 volumes displayed in my volume table.
3. Now I have to go any volume detail page and delete that volume
and after successful deletion of this volume it redirects me to volume index page
but 'checkbox' in the table is missing and also there is no option to 'create volume' in the table.
Sometimes it shows 'Quota Exceeded' but I have created only 9 volumes and the quota is not exceeded for
my project. 
Please find the screenshot for more information https://ibb.co/4sbWg0H , https://ibb.co/KxZK3MN
The same thing happens with Instance table.

It's worth to fix all these scenarios in this patch."}, {'account_id': 30474, 'date': '2019-08-13 08:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

commit_message:
Reorder the install guide to focus on the easy path

Move the advanced installation with playbooks in a new file.
Also add the information on what to do after the commands succeed:
link to the ironic docs, mention the generated files from testenv.

Change-Id: Ic974e6681ff0cee4adf8317365e49c4987502872

commit_message:
Update vgpu spec content

As we use `gpu_devices` as configure group[1] in the code implement,
so need update the spec corresponding.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cyborg/+/764450

Change-Id: Icbaa0a8ab0288a2072d152e294a92f36777e304c

commit_message:
Remove extraneous data

There is data in our Kustomize documents
which is purely extraneous. Images and
conf data do not need to be specified
unless we are overriding. spec.url is
just not used in helmrepository.yaml.

Change-Id: I2d7498a92e08a1d9f894306034232ec22cc6fe23

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 02:37:52.000000000', 'message': "Make force_delete configurable in task CreateAndAttachVolume

It seems like CreateAndAttachVolume.run() can't pass force_delete to func _delete_server(),
while kwargs was deprecated and been replaced by create_vm_params, now make force_delete
configurable in task CreateAndAttachVolume

Related-Bug: #1908701
Change-Id: I963028bba874fbaea93983ccca1d7cd651c974a5
"}]
commit_message:
Make force_delete configurable in task CreateAndAttachVolume

It seems like CreateAndAttachVolume.run() can't pass force_delete to func _delete_server(),
while kwargs was deprecated and been replaced by create_vm_params, now make force_delete
configurable in task CreateAndAttachVolume

Related-Bug: #1908701
Change-Id: I963028bba874fbaea93983ccca1d7cd651c974a5

Change-Id: I297ff7f3c8e725c24c7f7687786c784f61f5d4e2
'}]
commit_message:
Add default_availability_zone for VM creation

Add the LAUNCH_INSTANCE_DEFAULTS.default_availability_zone settings in
VM creation dashboard in order to let administrator select a default
availability zone instead of a random one when many are available.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I297ff7f3c8e725c24c7f7687786c784f61f5d4e2

commit_message:
API v2.44, added 'ou' field to security service

Added 'ou' field to security service field. Also, 'description'
field was added to display in both project and admin module.
Options to update dns_ip, ou, server, domain, password and
user fields were added as well. As this options are available
for command line interface.

Partial-Bug: #1823078
Change-Id: I03c0cb01cc04745e67d94a45e3f7570c1609ede0

subject: Shrinking: Add an active age
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-01 06:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-01 06:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Aother option means we really need to start using the sharding conf for s-m-s-r.

This is still WIP. Just plumbed the option through all the module level functions. Looks a bit ugly, need to play with this some more, but wanted to get it off my machine as it's getting to the end of the day."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-01 10:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

On a root container we could have an additional check on the cleaving contexts, which I think boils down to 'do not shrink anything if this container is still reporting sharding progress in recon'. That would prevent shrinking if *any* replica is still sharding.

Unfortunately we don't have any visibility at the root of the sharding progress of shards, so the per-shard range checking here is best bet.

The worst case is a really big container being sharded and that taking many sharder cycles for most replicas but goes quickly for one replica. The cleaving context on root containers would take care of that, but not on sharding shards.

I wonder if we should be conservative about the default time (i.e. much longer that 2 days), with doc for ops that if you start to see more small shards than you like then you can reduce this time, but be aware if you have slowly sharding containers."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-02 05:22:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK been looking into different possibilities.

1. created_age (rather the timeout). This is mostly how this patch currently stands. Problem is, on
large containers who knows what a good default is. So feels like just adding a sleep to the problem.. not always the best solution.

2. Use cleave contexts. I have code that does this, but this only works when the root container is cleaving. So only gives fixes the problem for sharding root containers. I can't think of an easy way to add the same thing to sharding shards.

  - There were some other interesting tidbits. If there is a small primary that shards quickly then it could shard and still be the only context in place when the check is done. Of course this would be completed so doesn't actaully fix the problem, just narrows it's scope. I got around this by having a stict mode that said their needed to be more then one context in the done state, but that would make single replica containers have issues (but I don't think we really care about that).
  - I wanted to use something like the replica count to make sure we could check that there was more then 1, but that doesn't work because we don't want to ring in s-m-s-rs.
  - So I looked at what we could use in just the broker. Went down the rabble hole of looking at syncs and check if it's replicated with anyone else etc.. but the simple fact is replication could have happened in the CREATED state, so again this isn't an indication of anything.

3. Make the last sharding replica change SRs to ACTIVE. So if things are active we know they are done.

 - CLEAVED state is pretty much the same as ACTIVE. Ie it does listings etc. Getting to the code that gets the stats, we just need the container db_state to be in SHARDED (which they would be) which just leaves the broker.get_shard_usage() code that only collects stats from SHARD_STATS_STATES. 
 
   SHARD_STATS_STATES = [ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHARDING,
                         ShardRange.SHRINKING]

 - But CLEAVED is in the listing states, so we trust it for that, I wonder if we should just start trusting it for more up to date stats too?
 
  - This seems feasible, so am going to continue playing with a patch that leaves everything in CLEAVED until sharding had been completed by all primaries. Then see what else happens. it means if we see something in CLEAVED state we know the statemachine is still SHARDING somewhere, or at least thinks it is. And we then should be able to safely say anything in ACTIVE can be shrunk.
 - Although I wonder if this means we might need to think about an audit for things that get stuck in CLEAVED."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-16 06:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-16 20:35:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I think I need to understand the previous patch better to be able to evaluate this one.

Stepping back from the detail, our goal is to be defensive about shrinking an under-populated shard which is only under-populated because it was created and cleaved from a replica that didn't have all the object rows...

We already know the time that the shard range was FOUND i.e. state_timestamp. What if we simply say 'don't shrink until X hours after the state_timestamp'? The risk is that the FOUND ranges aren't enabled promptly, so sharding starts after X-1 hours, the small replica completes and becomes a shrink candidate before the big replicas complete.

What if we knew when the shard range went to ACTIVE, t_active, and wait for X hours after that before shrinking? Now, at t_active + X we can be more confident that sharding was enabled more than X hours before, so hope that X hours was sufficient for the big replicas to shard after the small shard completed, but there's still a risk: we have to guess what X should be.

What if we knew the time at which *all* replicas completed sharding, t_complete? well, we do, that's the time we stop reporting progress in the recon cache, based on cleave contexts, but we only know that at the container, not at the root.

Can we communicate t_complete from the shard to container? Brainstorming...can we update state_timestamp *offset* with t_complete?? But ignore the offset in merge_shards. So we just use the offset to piggyback t_complete to the root.

Then, at the root, before shrinking we need shard range state to be active, and state_timestamp offset to be non-zero, and t_now  > (state_timestamp + offset) + X. (X could now be smaller, it's no longer guess work how long to wait."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-18 00:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Starting putting active_age dicussions in this etherpad: https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/swift-shrinking-active-age'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 06:20:48.000000000', 'message': "Shrinking: Add a created timeout

It is possible that a replica of a container has very few objects and shards
very quickly, creating active shard ranges that temporarily appear to be
under-populated.

We don't want this to become candidates for shrinking. So this patch
adds a new option `shrinking_created_timeout` which indicates how long
newly created shard is safe from becoming a shrinking candidate.

This is the first version and is still WIP, where I'm just attempting to bolt
on the option. This area of the code has been in constant flux over the last
few weeks, so just starting to play with how it'll look.
Because we are using so many module level functions for shrinking it's getting
a little ugly to plumb a new timeout throughout all the calls. Will
continue trying to clean it up.

Change-Id: I23e3a31c7b1ebfffdbdb51f340a54ec47977abd4
"}, {'created': '2021-03-16 06:04:16.000000000', 'message': "Shrinking: Add an active age

It is possible that a replica of a container has very few objects and shards
very quickly, creating active shard ranges that temporarily appear to be
under-populated.

We don't want this to become candidates for shrinking. So this patch
adds a new option `shrinking_active_age` which indicates how long
newly active shard is safe from becoming a shrinking candidate.

Change-Id: I23e3a31c7b1ebfffdbdb51f340a54ec47977abd4
"}]
commit_message:
Shrinking: Add an active age

It is possible that a replica of a container has very few objects and shards
very quickly, creating active shard ranges that temporarily appear to be
under-populated.

We don't want this to become candidates for shrinking. So this patch
adds a new option `shrinking_active_age` which indicates how long
newly active shard is safe from becoming a shrinking candidate.

Change-Id: I23e3a31c7b1ebfffdbdb51f340a54ec47977abd4

[{'created': '2021-03-15 07:36:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix provider driver quota handling

When provider drivers registered a load balancer object delete,
the driver agent was not decrementing the project quota.
This patch corrects that by decrementing the proper quota
when a DELETED status is received from the provider driver.

Change-Id: I7d705c9f4f0217c6fbe332f45b15892bf1d4a90b
Story: 2008268
Task: 41133
(cherry picked from commit fc8ee42dfccfd4b0735185896c30b0899daa4c55)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix provider driver quota handling

When provider drivers registered a load balancer object delete,
the driver agent was not decrementing the project quota.
This patch corrects that by decrementing the proper quota
when a DELETED status is received from the provider driver.

Change-Id: I7d705c9f4f0217c6fbe332f45b15892bf1d4a90b
Story: 2008268
Task: 41133
(cherry picked from commit fc8ee42dfccfd4b0735185896c30b0899daa4c55)

commit_message:
Fix share server lookup

We were missing a join on the share network
subnets table to be able to affect a lookup
by share network ID.

Change-Id: Id121ba942c7840a7cd7574f08a524fd4dbe06f64

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 15:51:42.000000000', 'message': 'Always constraint dependencies in tox

For most of our tox jobs we use the usedevelop, which means that tox
will do a pip install -e on our source code on its own.

This means that first it will install deps (which has the constraints)
and then cinder without constraints, since they are defined in deps, and
will pull cinder dependencies ignoring the constraints.

This patch changes how we install dependencies for ALL tox jobs, and
will make sure that they are always properly constrained by changing our
install_command to include the -c option.

Change-Id: Ic9a6ac412a334710eb5e45935cd301ca80a5edb9
'}, {'created': '2021-03-16 16:14:32.000000000', 'message': 'Always constraint dependencies in tox

For most of our tox jobs we use the usedevelop, which means that tox
will do a pip install -e on our source code on its own.

This means that first it will install deps (which has the constraints)
and then cinder without constraints, since they are defined in deps, and
will pull cinder dependencies ignoring the constraints.

This patch changes how we install dependencies for all tox jobs except
the lower-constraints one, and will make sure that they are always
properly constrained by changing our install_command to include the -c
option.

Change-Id: Ic9a6ac412a334710eb5e45935cd301ca80a5edb9
'}]
commit_message:
Always constraint dependencies in tox

For most of our tox jobs we use the usedevelop, which means that tox
will do a pip install -e on our source code on its own.

This means that first it will install deps (which has the constraints)
and then cinder without constraints, since they are defined in deps, and
will pull cinder dependencies ignoring the constraints.

This patch changes how we install dependencies for all tox jobs except
the lower-constraints one, and will make sure that they are always
properly constrained by changing our install_command to include the -c
option.

Change-Id: Ic9a6ac412a334710eb5e45935cd301ca80a5edb9

commit_message:
Flip nl02-04.openstack.org to nl02-04.opendev.org

Once these new servers are up and running in a happy idle state we are
clear to flip the configs around so the new focal servers take over node
provisioning duties. This change makes that happen.

Change-Id: I6ad57218805e28b555e1e3a0dc959ee4f00428cc

subject: Harden manage negative tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 19262, 'name': 'Liron Kuchlani', 'email': 'lkuchlan@redhat.com', 'username': 'lkuchlan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30025, 'name': 'Vida Haririan', 'display_name': 'Vida Haririan', 'email': 'vhariria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vhari'}]

[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-03-12 18:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-03-12 19:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-03-12 19:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 30025, 'date': '2021-03-16 15:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Changes checked out in local env. Pls clarify the need for this change in addition to using random st etc. names. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-03-16 17:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Changes checked out in local env. Pls clarify the need for this change in addition to using random st etc. names. Thanks.

Thanks for the question Vida. I've stated why the change is needed in the commit message - here's a bit more context: Manila's manage API checks for "duplicates" by checking if the export path of the share being managed is already present in the database for a given host (and share_server_id) [1]

The manage tests being altered in this change are executed multiple times, once for each protocol [2]
We've seen failures when these run in parallel. [3] The problem with this is the failure isn't deterministic - IF the tests run in parallel, and two tests present the same host and same export path at the same time, the manage API fails in a different way than these negative tests expect - and that's what this patch addresses - it removes the potential overlap by randomizing the fake data. The intent of the test case is preserved by this trickery.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/e8810b2019c00fdfa3d80680b862a5d635a1591e/manila/share/api.py#L807-L822
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/9efbc94e963613a617631d27917ba278429566f5/manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_share_manage_negative.py#L349-L366
[3] https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_267/763462/4/check/manila-tempest-plugin-dummy-no-dhss/26734a8/testr_results.html'}, {'account_id': 30025, 'date': '2021-03-16 20:12:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2021-03-17 09:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks Goutham!'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-03-17 12:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Was just waiting for Zuul.  LGTM still.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-03-17 22:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, thanks Goutham :)'}]

We attempt to manage a share with a fake/invalid
path in some tests and expect asynchronous
failures. So as long as there's only one of these
fake/invalid exports known to manila at a time,
there's no issue. However, when tests are run in

Change-Id: Ic1ed8c559221417347eeb71441ed8e941d70b8f1
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

path in some tests and expect asynchronous
failures. So as long as there's only one of these

there's no issue. However, when tests are run in
parallel, we see failures because manila validates
that the export path provided isn't known so far.

Change-Id: Ic1ed8c559221417347eeb71441ed8e941d70b8f1
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Harden manage negative tests

We attempt to manage a share with a fake/invalid
path in some tests and expect asynchronous
failures. So as long as there's only one of these
fake/invalid exports known to manila at a time,
there's no issue. However, when tests are run in
parallel, we see failures because manila validates
that the export path provided isn't known so far.

Change-Id: Ic1ed8c559221417347eeb71441ed8e941d70b8f1
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-12 20:08:26.000000000', 'message': "stack.sh doesn't support shared nova instance path

In cases where the nova instances directory is an (nfs) shared directory
and nova instances path is located somewhere under nova state path,
running stack.sh for a multinode setup and for a compute node results
in an error message when stack.sh tries to cleanup.

This fix unmounts and remounts the nfs directory as needed during the
cleanup.

Change-Id: I644fc45072e94f53dfe548c92a67ee05f08ba7d9
Closes-Bug: #1649389
"}, {'created': '2017-01-04 19:33:30.000000000', 'message': "stack.sh doesn't support shared nova instance path

these cases, we do not want to clean out the directory.

commit_message:
stack.sh doesn't support shared nova instance path

Nova's instances directory may be a shared directory (ie nfs), in
these cases, we do not want to clean out the directory.

This patch introduces the parameter SHARED_INSTANCE_DIR. This value can
be set to True or False (defaults to False). If set to True, nova instances
directory is treated as shared and will not be deleted; otherwise, it will be
deleted when stack.sh is invoked.

Change-Id: I644fc45072e94f53dfe548c92a67ee05f08ba7d9
Closes-Bug: #1649389

[{'created': '2021-03-17 10:41:57.000000000', 'message': "Update model_query_scope_is_project to work properly with new policies

In case when enforce_new_defaults is set to True in config, Neutron
shouldn't check context.is_admin flag to check if query should or
shouldn't be scoped to just one tenant as user with PROJECT_ADMIN role
will have is_admin flag set to True but such user shouldn't get e.g.
networks which belongs to other tenants and aren't shared in any way.

So that patch improves neutron_lib.db.utils.model_query_scope_is_project
function so it works in different way in case when enforce_new_defaults
is set to True or False. In case when new defaults should be enforced
only SYSTEM_SCOPE tokens and advanced_services can make queries which
are not scoped to single tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1919386
Change-Id: I7760413a562e5d1a86709fc5e2d0df405a6aed30

commit_message:
Update model_query_scope_is_project to work properly with new policies

In case when enforce_new_defaults is set to True in config, Neutron
shouldn't check context.is_admin flag to check if query should or
shouldn't be scoped to just one tenant as user with PROJECT_ADMIN role
will have is_admin flag set to True but such user shouldn't get e.g.
networks which belongs to other tenants and aren't shared in any way.

So that patch improves neutron_lib.db.utils.model_query_scope_is_project
function so it works in different way in case when enforce_new_defaults
is set to True or False. In case when new defaults should be enforced
only SYSTEM_SCOPE tokens and advanced_services can make queries which
are not scoped to single tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1919386
Change-Id: I7760413a562e5d1a86709fc5e2d0df405a6aed30

I think we should probably adapt the prepare_networking to have two different behavior, and have native implementation of ovs/lxb instead of mixing the two.

So I think we have a new var (or re-use an existing var) to know what to configure for networking. (bootstrap_host_scenario won't work, but we could set a fact based on this)

Anyway, with that we could have something like prepare_networking_{{ networking_mechanism }} that would point to the linuxbridge or ovs configuration.

Alternatively set a new axis, but that could become hard to manage.

In the meantime, we should go ahead with this when it works."}, {'account_id': 26729, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:06:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I think we should probably adapt the prepare_networking to have two

you're definitely right. i wasn't sure what to expect within the zuul environment, so i started with the implementation with the least offset from the existing AIO scenarios. We could even consider implementing all bridges within ovs.

I was already implementing an prepare_networking_ovs template, but things went sideways during my tests. i can take another look at this next time i have little slack time.

commit_message:
Added test_create_access_rule_cephx_admin_user testcase

This test case validates the fix to CVE-2020-27781.

The test will create a share and allow access to "admin" user.
This step should return success, but the access rule for
"admin" will be set to "error".

Related-Bug: #1904015
Depends-On: I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d
Change-Id: I01157147e749ae6068e9878bffe322cb3993fb60

commit_message:
Remove extra bash process in frr container

Before the change:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# podman exec -it frr sh -c 'ps -ef'
UID          PID    PPID  C STIME TTY          TIME CMD
frr            1       0  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 dumb-init --single-child -- kolla_start
frr            7       1  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 bash -c $* -- eval /usr/lib/frr/frr start && /bin/sleep infinity
frr           16       1  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/watchfrr -d -F traditional zebra bgpd staticd bfdd
frr           40       1  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/zebra -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1 --vrfwnetns
frr           49       1  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/bgpd -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1
frr           58       1  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/staticd -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1
frr           63       1  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/bfdd -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1
frr           67       7  0 20:40 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/coreutils --coreutils-prog-shebang=sleep /bin/sleep infinity

After the change:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# podman exec -it frr sh -c 'ps -ef'
sh-4.4$ ps -ef
UID          PID    PPID  C STIME TTY          TIME CMD
frr            1       0  0 19:29 ?        00:00:00 dumb-init --single-child -- kolla_start
frr            8       1  0 19:29 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/coreutils --coreutils-prog-shebang=sleep /bin/sleep infinity
frr           17       1  0 19:29 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/watchfrr -d -F traditional zebra bgpd staticd bfdd
frr           41       1  0 19:29 ?        00:00:01 /usr/lib/frr/zebra -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1 --vrfwnetns
frr           50       1  0 19:29 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/bgpd -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1
frr           59       1  0 19:29 ?        00:00:00 /usr/lib/frr/staticd -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1
frr           64       1  0 19:29 ?        00:00:13 /usr/lib/frr/bfdd -d -F traditional -A 127.0.0.1

Change-Id: I1fdc8ccb4064fa91df5c0bd4421d691c333e3e30

commit_message:
Make UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeLeapp{ToRemove,ToInstall,CommandOptions} per-role

When specific roles are deployed with custom images, for example CephStorage with
overcloud-minimal, then the LeappCommandOptions and/or the list of packages to
be removed/installed is not the same across all roles.

This change makes four parameters to be customized on a per-role basis:
UpgradeInitCommand
UpgradeLeappToRemove
UpgradeLeappToInstall
UpgradeLeappCommandOptions

Related-Bug: 1915067
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1936419
Change-Id: Ifd373f7aba6d98baa843b141de8a2266eaa71a0b
(cherry picked from commit 155fe9454b907553a351e724da3b5ef3ce8dcb48)
(cherry picked from commit dbad3a079b7c04066008b6ef9cd38cdaa0b80056)
(cherry picked from commit 284629a8741cdeba3becadffa95afe10fde36c14)

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Sphinx requirements also fixed to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I543337fc3d6b6815de9b0bffe10ba09cda6b1821

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-22 18:43:39.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints job

Lower-constraints is not a requirement of the OpenStack Python PTI
[0] and there currently is a discussion on the mailing list [1]
about dropping the test, with the oslo team already having done
so [2].

The new dependency resolver in pip fails due to incompatible
dependency versions in our lower-constraints file, meaning that
we were never providing any real guarantees with it.

To unblock the CI, I am disabling lower-constraints job for now,
with the option to reenable it in case we fix the constraints,
and based on the outcome of the mailing list discussions and
consensus.

[0]. https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html
[1]. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html
[2]. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019659.html

(cherry picked from commit 62c3d8eeb63ddc0f6b7f1505ed9a8b393a80e548)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Lower-constraints is not a requirement of the OpenStack Python PTI
[0] and there currently is a discussion on the mailing list [1]
about dropping the test, with the oslo team already having done
so [2].

The new dependency resolver in pip fails due to incompatible
dependency versions in our lower-constraints file, meaning that
we were never providing any real guarantees with it.

To unblock the CI, I am disabling lower-constraints job for now,
with the option to reenable it in case we fix the constraints,
and based on the outcome of the mailing list discussions and
consensus.

[0]. https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html
[1]. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html
[2]. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019659.html

Change-Id: I47e747058891596e7717848a0b0bc10f0a235b2f
(cherry picked from commit d6610594d1b766a8ee3ac65182b951f2a3d431f7)
(cherry picked from commit 42faeb277b6eb4b4a772f516a6e2b547f2b2a2b4)
(cherry picked from commit 62c3d8eeb63ddc0f6b7f1505ed9a8b393a80e548)

commit_message:
Add import system configuration method

set_virtual_boot_device is also using the import system configuration
action, but its usage is very specific, with retries and rebooting. To
keep it simple, this adds import_system_configuration, which is
asynchronous and returns a TaskMonitor.

Additionally, this changes the case of the header field names used by
the asynchronous.http_call method to make them work with unit tests.
While the requests package can handle real header field names case-
insensitively, when they are mocked in unit tests, case needs to match.

Story: 2003594
Task: 41576
Change-Id: I3b5e620e7b1939a029bd59b4578c0f52c8789598

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Sphinx requirements also fixed to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I69fde94a9a5b57ab131b56320a0d2ed2f8596729

  Upstream removed Ubuntu repositories.

  Train/Stein only

* Bifrost: pin IPA builder to 2.4.0

  Train & earlier

  IPA builder master branch now requires diskimage-builder 3.4.0, but
  Python 2 is supported only up to DIB 2.38.

  This change works around the issue by pinning IPA builder to 2.4.0,

commit_message:
Fix several issues (Train)

* sensu: drop Ubuntu support

  Upstream removed Ubuntu repositories.

  Train/Stein only

* Bifrost: pin IPA builder to 2.4.0

  Train & earlier

  IPA builder master branch now requires diskimage-builder 3.4.0, but
  Python 2 is supported only up to DIB 2.38.

  This change works around the issue by pinning IPA builder to 2.4.0,
  which has a Python 2 compatible dependency on DIB.

Change-Id: Ice125e101a689fd3df9d1cd9a093a026f9747a3e

commit_message:
Disable mariadb mysql history client logging

Environment variable MYSQL_HISTFILE is added to mariadb container
to disable storing client mysql history to ~/.mysql_history file.

Change-Id: Ie95bc1f830fbf34d30c73de07513299115d8e8c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 09:44:04.000000000', 'message': "Correctly handle missing RabbitMQ queues

Currently, setting the '[oslo_messaging] direct_mandatory_flag' config
option to 'True' (the default) will result in a 'MessageUndeliverable'
exception being raised when sending a reply if a RabbitMQ queue is
missing [1]. It was the responsibility of the application to handle
this exception, however, many applications are not doing so. This has
resulted in a number of bug reports.

Start handling this error condition, using a retry loop to attempt to
resend the message and work around any temporary glitches. Since
attempting to send a reply will will no longer raise an exception,
there is little benefit in retaining the '[oslo_messaging]
direct_mandatory_flag' config option: users setting this to False will
simply not benefit from the retry logic and improved logging added
here. This option is already deprecated though and will be fully
removed in a future release.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/channels.html

Change-Id: Id5cddbefbe24ef100f1cc522f44430df77d217cb
Closes-Bug: #1905965
(cherry picked from commit 4937949dffecdf8863a7876e5a6b0b18e811c3ac)

commit_message:
Correctly handle missing RabbitMQ queues

Currently, setting the '[oslo_messaging] direct_mandatory_flag' config
option to 'True' (the default) will result in a 'MessageUndeliverable'
exception being raised when sending a reply if a RabbitMQ queue is
missing [1]. It was the responsibility of the application to handle
this exception, however, many applications are not doing so. This has
resulted in a number of bug reports.

Start handling this error condition, using a retry loop to attempt to
resend the message and work around any temporary glitches. Since
attempting to send a reply will will no longer raise an exception,
there is little benefit in retaining the '[oslo_messaging]
direct_mandatory_flag' config option: users setting this to False will
simply not benefit from the retry logic and improved logging added
here. This option is already deprecated though and will be fully
removed in a future release.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/channels.html

Change-Id: Id5cddbefbe24ef100f1cc522f44430df77d217cb
Closes-Bug: #1905965
(cherry picked from commit 4937949dffecdf8863a7876e5a6b0b18e811c3ac)
(cherry picked from commit 391ce7fc69adc8d713d8ca64e76d901eb3e65df1)
(cherry picked from commit 36b5e06c92337cd04d1c8ae4840dbc224faeaa9f)

commit_message:
Add Octavia use of the rsyslog image

Octavia is adding a container to collect logs from inside the
amphora instances. This patch adds Octavia to the list of services
leveraging the existing rsyslog container.

Change-Id: I3ce6808379790e2e4d96027d5f92384249c8c783
(cherry picked from commit 32c96fe430feddfbf353d076eda36f6cfcdbfd1a)

Previously nova-live-migration was failing on stable/pike with [1]:

 ceph-mon: created monfs at /var/lib/ceph/mon/ceph-ubuntu-xenial-limestone-regionone-0023532833 for 
mon.ubuntu-xenial-limestone-regionone-0023532833
 Created symlink from /etc/systemd/system/ceph-mon.target.wants/ceph-mon@ubuntu-xenial-limestone-regionone-0023532833.service to /lib/systemd/system/ceph-mon@.service.
 Error EINVAL: bad entity name
 + /home/zuul/workspace/devstack-gate/functions.sh:tsfilter:L103:   return 22
 + /home/zuul/workspace/devstack-gate/functions.sh:call_hook_if_defined:L83:   local ret_val=22
 + /home/zuul/workspace/devstack-gate/functions.sh:call_hook_if_defined:L84:   sudo mv /home/zuul/workspace/devstack-gate-post_test_hook.txt /opt/stack/logs/
 + /home/zuul/workspace/devstack-gate/functions.sh:call_hook_if_defined:L85:   set +o pipefail

and with this patch it passes.

Also, elod pointed out in #openstack-nova that the previous nova-live-migration runs show evidence of installing the ceph octopus release [2]:

 Get:16 https://download.ceph.com/debian-octopus xenial InRelease [8392 B]

So... this is a clean backport from stable/queens, fixes the job(s) by pinning to the ceph nautilus release, and LGTM

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2761e9cc3092430f9d0cdef47421543a/log/job-output.txt#4472
[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2761e9cc3092430f9d0cdef47421543a/log/job-output.txt#4264'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-17 16:52:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM in order to get the nova-live-migration job passing, as discussed it might be time to drop grenade as we can't fix Ocata."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 13:58:53.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5

(cherry picked from commit 5aa7f3b4e6241e21c69dc103bb7be847b500429c)
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
(cherry picked from commit ff570d1b4e9b9777405ae75cc09eae2ce255bf19)
(cherry picked from commit 436e8172f65193e177a4a12780f752dbc7e88b39)
(cherry picked from commit 238c83a2f778a9c2f0abbe318dda97b715926565)
(cherry picked from commit 5aa7f3b4e6241e21c69dc103bb7be847b500429c)

This patch changes the default behaviour to disable the manipulation of
iptables and disabling bridge networking.

commit_message:
Disable Docker iptables and bridge networking by default

In I165199fc98fb98f227f2a20284e1bab03ef65b5b and
Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173 we provided flags to disable
Docker's control of iptables and bridge networking respectively. The
original behaviour was maintained for backwards compatibility, to allow
the patches to be backported.

This patch changes the default behaviour to disable the manipulation of
iptables and disabling bridge networking.

Related-Bug: #1849275
Related-Bug: #1848249

Change-Id: I4e8206f13a847ff79e06c36d22068597458b6c3d

This patch configures Octavia to enable amphora log offloading
to the Octavia rsyslog container if the OctaviaOffloadAllLogs

commit_message:
Allow octavia container image version to be parameterized.

We are working on a testing stable OOO deployments against arbitrary
versions of octavia (master for the time being).

Note: This "sort of works". The puppet configuration step fails as it
appears to use the puppet version in the container image - not the one
installed on the host. It was expected that the puppet would still be
whatever the branch-under-test version was and therfore would match the
tht's. Unfortunately, doesn't seem to be the cast atm

Change-Id: I4d17b0f05f9d58380952dc5d0e60e807113860b9

issues.

commit_message:
Make image metadef tests admin-only

Test the image metadef API with admin credentials, which is really
how they should be deployed anyway. Glance is moving to make this the
default policy, so tempest needs to do the same.

Related-Bug: #1916926
Change-Id: Ie284e87236191f91f388fb1530db9881cca338b8

commit_message:
Make some metadef operations admin-only

This restricts all metadef resource manipulation to admin-only, but
still allow users to see everything. There are multiple low-grade
security issues with the metadef API, detailed in the related bug.
Restricting resource manipulation to admin-only solves most of these
concerns.

SecurityImpact
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/780108
Change-Id: I333c58e73c202c1f523030e54e03f2868459b595
Related-Bug: #1916926

Change-Id: I8b559084ac424a868a3a3b387fc51bf056dbd3df
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Specify IPv6 CIDR in tempest-slow-py3

This is a copy of a neutron patch [1] which specifies the CIDR used by
the public network in the tempest-slow-py3 job.

The original bug [2] was fixed in tempest [3] but since devstack pins
TEMPEST_BRANCH=26.0.0 for stable/stein, we must do a one-off fix
in-tree to fix our job.

Related-Bug: #1914037

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/777389
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1914037
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774764

Change-Id: I8b559084ac424a868a3a3b387fc51bf056dbd3df

subject: pci: Add vDPA vnic to PCI request mapping and filtering
messages:
[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-03 02:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-04 21:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-08 21:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-08 21:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

Okay, I agree that this makes the previous patch a lot more palatable. If you could reorder things, I think we have a winner here'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(10 comments)

Fixed my own nits'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-11 02:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

so i have quickly retested this for different lifecycle operations after stephen helped me reorder this properaly.

boot,start,stop,pause,resume,reboot(hard/soft),rebuild, snapshot, same host resize, shelve and interface attach all work.

suspend fails because we dont remove the vdpa devices like we do for normal sriov before calling manages save(simple to fix)
live-migartion cannot work since qemu does not support it.
unshelve works but hits https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1851545 for the same reasons as normal sriov ports so unshleve does not work.
interface detach failed because qemu could not find the device in the live domain.
we correctly clean up the port on ovs and remove it but i think we should block this for now.
im not sure if this is actuly a qemu bug, libvirt bug or something else.

cold migration is untested but since same host resize works including claiming a differnt vdpa device i suspect it shoudl work. similarly evacuate is untested but since it share a lot of code with rebuild it likely would work but until its tested it should be blocked.

i currently have not deployed a multi node env which is why cold migrate, resize to difffernt hsot and evacuate are not test.
follow up patches will block the broken/not yet supported action and ill adress tehm 1 by one individually similar to cyborg life cycle operations or port numa.


at this point in the seriose the feature is effectivly complete for a large number of lifecycle operations but there are number of other things missing. 1 doc for the above stating whcih lifecycle operation work and which are pending similar to https://docs.openstack.org/api-guide/compute/port_with_resource_request.html, a release note for vdpa support.

you also ethither need a pathced libvirt which does the memory locking/lock limit adjustment for you or you have to use hw:realtime or the mlock patch that follows this to resolve the dma issue.

its unlikely that all of the outstanidn issues will get addressed before FF 
so we have a choice we coudl merge a porthion of the series up to this point.
we could hold the entire serise till next cycle, or we cold merge the first 3 patches
which are all enabling patches but would give us options downstream if we need to backprot this feature since the object chnage is the only thing we cant backport downstream.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

commit_message:
pci: Add vDPA vnic to PCI request mapping and filtering

This change extend the vnic type to PCI request dev type mapping to
support the vDPA vnic type.

This change extends the PCI stats module to filter out VDPA 'dev_type'
pools if its not explicitly requested.

This change explicitly filters out the vDPA dev_type from the pci alias
schema since that is not supported.

Blueprint: libvirt-vdpa-support
Change-Id: I91dd7993395f693c7d26c1caa44fa365f5cbec12

commit_message:
Add new functional test case for ext-port config option deprecation

Add reference to to the new test case that valdiates whether the charm
goes in blocked state when data-port and ext-port are specified at the
same time.

Pursuing this effort in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/+/781141 instead. Thanks, Slawek!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 19:13:59.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Configure a neutron tempest job to use secure RBAC

This commits adds a neutron tempest job to configure neutron to enforce
the new secure RBAC policies, including support for system and project
users (system-admin, system-reader, project-member, project-reader).

This isn't going to perform exhaustive protection testing of neutron
RBAC policies, but we can use it as a guide for dianosing issues with
the default policies in integrated scenarios (e.g., service-to-service
communication), or deployment issues assuming the old authorization
model.

We can continue to pursue full protection testing via a devstack/tempest
plugin, unit tests, or functional tests. This is a parallel effort to
increase confidence in a wide change across OpenStack to increase the
usability and introduce authorization consistency.

Change-Id: I50203caab0023450b5939d4be7c1af4bd70a6f05
"}, {'created': '2021-03-10 19:19:15.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Configure a neutron tempest job to use secure RBAC

commit_message:
DNM: Configure a neutron tempest job to use secure RBAC

This commits adds a neutron tempest job to configure neutron to enforce
the new secure RBAC policies, including support for system and project
users (system-admin, system-reader, project-member, project-reader).

This isn't going to perform exhaustive protection testing of neutron
RBAC policies, but we can use it as a guide for dianosing issues with
the default policies in integrated scenarios (e.g., service-to-service
communication), or deployment issues assuming the old authorization
model.

We can continue to pursue full protection testing via a devstack/tempest
plugin, unit tests, or functional tests. This is a parallel effort to
increase confidence in a wide change across OpenStack to increase the
usability and introduce authorization consistency.

Change-Id: I50203caab0023450b5939d4be7c1af4bd70a6f05

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-30 17:40:20.000000000', 'message': "[SVF] Set volume IOPS based on volume size

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Adding support to set volume IOPS based on
the value 'iops_per_gb' and volume size and updating in volume metadata
for volume actions like creation, update, resize and retype to avoid
retype of volume for changing the throttling value.

closes bug: #1905988

Change-Id: I07fec25c1790089563f1baf6f43a67f0dacf77a7

Change-Id: I07fec25c1790089563f1baf6f43a67f0dacf77a7
"}]
commit_message:
[SVF] Set volume IOPS based on volume size

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Adding support to set volume IOPS based on
the value 'iops_per_gb' and volume size and updating in volume metadata
for volume actions like creation, update, resize and retype to avoid
retype of volume for changing the throttling value.

closes bug: #1905988

Change-Id: I07fec25c1790089563f1baf6f43a67f0dacf77a7

commit_message:
Expose [workaround]/ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup

This exposes the nova workaround to remove the instance directory on
clean up when using rbd.

[{'created': '2021-03-16 19:36:14.000000000', 'message': 'instance view flavors: Load all readable flavors for instance context

The default behavior of api.nova.flavor_list is to set is_public=True.
This shows only flavors that belong to the current project or
are public cloud-wide. This is needlessly restrictive; since this
list is used for showing instance flavors (and not for creating or
resizing new instances) we may as well learn about as many flavors
as we can.

Bug: 1919369
Change-Id: I76ee0ba2066df8f000d3fd1149cffcd971cf5eef
'}]
commit_message:
instance view flavors: Load all readable flavors for instance context

The default behavior of api.nova.flavor_list is to set is_public=True.
This shows only flavors that belong to the current project or
are public cloud-wide. This is needlessly restrictive; since this
list is used for showing instance flavors (and not for creating or
resizing new instances) we may as well learn about as many flavors
as we can.

Bug: 1919369
Change-Id: I76ee0ba2066df8f000d3fd1149cffcd971cf5eef

commit_message:
Add QoS Suport for Pure Storage

Add back-end QoS support for Pure Storage.
Two parameters are supported:
maxIOPS - maximum IOPS per volume - range 100 -100M
maxBWS - maximum I/O bandwidth in MB/s - range 1 - 524288

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint pure-backend-qos

Change-Id: I7f548b1aa1285499b5835fc2ebba3b6e55d8fb15

commit_message:
Stop barbican servics in unupgraded controllers

This change makes barbican services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgrade controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I7031064b752450bacbb7775c0e357b98210a8929
(cherry picked from commit 6f140b93be8349eddb7e6cd86116ab1b3f34140a)
(cherry picked from commit c996c85caea5ac098c6d57066c144adb05354c49)

I've marked the referenced bug as also affecting charms.openstack so this change should Close-Bug to finish that target."}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-03-17 16:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-03-17 16:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 02:22:00.000000000', 'message': "Use application_name by default for creating pools

Charms consuming Ceph storage typically follow the convention that
pools are named for the application rather than the service name. Most
charms also allow for the pool name to be defined via a config option.
Charms which inherit from the BaseOpenStackCephCharm class will not
follow this typical behavior as the pool created is based on the charm
name.

This change updates the create_pool function to allow for a concrete
charm to optionally provide the name of the pool to be created,
defaulting to the application_name if one is not provided. This is a
change in behavior as the previous behavior was to use the charm
class's name property. Reviewing all known charms which inherit
from/mixin the BaseOpenStackCephCharm reveals that Gnocchi is the only
user of the create_pool method.

As such, it stands to reason that a change in behavior is safe in this
context since the charm class's name for gnocchi was set to the
'gnocchi' which is also the typical application name.

Change-Id: I1756ff4e1362fbc7584551249c583f8d3cb0c8dc
Partial-Bug: #1918821

commit_message:
Use application_name by default for creating pools

Charms consuming Ceph storage typically follow the convention that
pools are named for the application rather than the service name. Most
charms also allow for the pool name to be defined via a config option.
Charms which inherit from the BaseOpenStackCephCharm class will not
follow this typical behavior as the pool created is based on the charm
name.

This change updates the create_pool function to allow for a concrete
charm to optionally provide the name of the pool to be created,
defaulting to the application_name if one is not provided. This is a
change in behavior as the previous behavior was to use the charm
class's name property. Reviewing all known charms which inherit
from/mixin the BaseOpenStackCephCharm reveals that Gnocchi is the only
user of the create_pool method.

As such, it stands to reason that a change in behavior is safe in this
context since the charm class's name for gnocchi was set to the
'gnocchi' which is also the typical application name.

Change-Id: I1756ff4e1362fbc7584551249c583f8d3cb0c8dc
Closes-Bug: #1918821

commit_message:
Add support for custom grafana dashboards

Allow users to import custom grafana dashboards.
Dashboards as JSON files should be placed into
"{{ node_custom_config }}/grafana/dashboards/" folder.

Change-Id: Id0f83b8d08541b3b74649f097b10c9450201b426

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-21 20:06:45.000000000', 'message': '[docker] Added a new flag docker_disable_bridge

Docker is using 172.17.0.0/16 by default for bridge networking on docker0, and
this might cause problems for tenant networks.

This change introduces a flag to disable Docker bridge networking.

Change-Id: Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173
Closes-Bug: #1848249
'}, {'created': '2019-10-21 20:12:55.000000000', 'message': '[docker] Added a new flag docker_disable_bridge

docker0, and this might cause routing problems for operator networks.

This change introduces docker_disable_default_network to disable the
bridge networking by putting "bridge: none"[1] to daemon.json

For better defaults, this feature will be enabled by default at
Victoria.

commit_message:
[docker] Added a new flag to disable default network

Docker is using 172.17.0.0/16 by default for bridge networking on
docker0, and this might cause routing problems for operator networks.

This change introduces docker_disable_default_network to disable the
bridge networking by putting "bridge: none"[1] to daemon.json

Bridge networking does not work without iptables, so we set the default
for docker_disable_default_network to
docker_disable_default_iptables_rules.

For better defaults, this feature will be enabled by default in
Wallaby.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/

Change-Id: Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173
Closes-Bug: #1848249
Related-Bug: #1849275

commit_message:
Install nmap on the Redhat 8 and Debian

Nmap provides ncat tool which is required e.g. by
neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_port_forwarding tests.

Closes-bug: #1918597
Change-Id: I2e5b677bedfbb33518b3b655a49eaffb065f0534

commit_message:
don't use the same CIDR in octavia_amp_network_cidr and init-run-once

Currently kolla-ansible uses the same CIDR in init-run-once script
and for octavia_amp_network_cidr.

Change-Id: I5ab24fbf9be4acbd691f13d33908aa44d2b4d496

commit_message:
Don't require heat client for generate_passwords

To support using ephemeral heat, don't require a heat client in the
generate_passwords function. Reading the existing values from the
environment is now not required when using ephemeral heat.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id47d6ff94edfb607eb3611aa4cd306c3de450fb4

[doc] Add initial system-scoped text to secure-rbac

I never got around to adding in an initial pass on system scoped
interaction and use with secure rbac. This change adds a high level
overview to help explain the context.

Change-Id: I4dca32c882f484e75378aca8bb043ebd078a13cf
