commit_message:
Add iRMC Driver Support to DevStack Code

This commit adds logic
  * to determine whether irmc hardware type is enabled
  * (if enabled) to install python package python-scciclient & snmp
into DevStack code to support construction of Ironic environment
with iRMC supported Fujitsu server through DevStack.

Story: 2008722
Task: 42066
Change-Id: Ie50d8e4b43cdbfd8cd46333a75de20015e67829e

Blocking for now, pending discussion with Dmitry. Seems this partially works as is now which means this is not what we want to do, but we need to all get on the same page first.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-10 16:45:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

As much as I like the new version better (and agree we should align it), it's technically a breaking API change without a microversion, right? We at least need to discuss it..

Very unfortunately, the current version works: http://paste.openstack.org/show/803437/ (the redfish implementaiton is partly broken, I needed to comment out the disk bits)"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:25:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1
> 
> As much as I like the new version better (and agree we should align it), it's technically a breaking API change without a microversion, right? We at least need to discuss it..

For me the arguments for not incrementing the microversion is that this API has always been documented as specified, not as implemented:

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/#indicators-management

And given the redfish implementation needs changes to be useful, we could have some confidence that nobody has attempted to use this API in the wild yet.

But yes, for correctness the microversion should be bumped, I'm happy to go with the consensus."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:34:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> For me the arguments for not incrementing the microversion is that this API has always been documented as specified, not as implemented

This, unfortunately, is not a compelling argument, since potential users could discover how the API actually works (the way I did yesterday - by poking it).

> And given the redfish implementation needs changes to be useful, we could have some confidence that nobody has attempted to use this API in the wild yet.

Not 100% since there could be downstream fixes or drivers, but I'm fine to go with this argument nonetheless. Could you maybe start a mailing list thread to notify the wider community about the situation?

> But yes, for correctness the microversion should be bumped

Yes. Ideally, if we can somehow keep the old crazy API working in older microversions, we won't even need any consensus."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-03-15 12:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> And given the redfish implementation needs changes to be useful, we could have some confidence that nobody has attempted to use this API in the wild yet.

Actually.. when we fix the redfish implementation, we can backport the fix, making the old API usable on ussuri/victoria. We cannot backport this change though.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-15 15:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag removed: ironic-week-prio'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-16 14:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

Removing block, I chatted with Steve and he is going to work on making a microversion based revision to the endpoint which we can pickup during the Xena development cycle. Marking wf-1.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-03-17 16:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-18 21:50:16.000000000', 'message': 'Align the indicators API with the spec

The expose-hardware-indicators spec[1] describes 3 API endpoints:
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>
GET/PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<ind_ident>

What was implemented was a little bit different:
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators
GET/PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<ind_ident>@<component>

This change brings the implementation back to the spec and what was
subsequently documented[2]. The indicators API will now return a 404
if the requested API version is not new enough.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/15.0/expose-hardware-indicators.html#rest-api-impact
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/#indicators-management

Change-Id: Idcf0ec5cbf04dddf28fba6b4dc523121cd223ee5
Story: 2005342
Task: 30291

commit_message:
Align the indicators API with the spec

The expose-hardware-indicators spec[1] describes 3 API endpoints:
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>
GET/PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<ind_ident>

What was implemented was a little bit different:
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators
GET/PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<ind_ident>@<component>

This change brings the implementation back to the spec and what was
subsequently documented[2]. The indicators API will now return a 404
if the requested API version is not new enough.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/15.0/expose-hardware-indicators.html#rest-api-impact
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/#indicators-management

Change-Id: Idcf0ec5cbf04dddf28fba6b4dc523121cd223ee5
Story: 2005342
Task: 30291

commit_message:
Designate rndc configuration

Distribute rndc key generation across worker nodes.

Note: this uses a single key for all hosts, but that might change in the
future. Not sure what that would look like though.

Change-Id: I3383c19f80e70553ae71e644a01dda0f250d19da

[{'created': '2021-03-16 03:37:41.000000000', 'message': "Temporary fix for docs job

The docs job is failing because the most recent SQLAlchemy release
(1.4.0) has removed a function we are still using (even though it
was deprecated in 0.9 -- yep, this is our fault).  We can get the
docs job running for now by using older SQLAlchemy until the
cinder sqlalchemy db api code is fixed.  (Something is constraining
SQLAlchemy to 1.3.23 in the unit tests, but it's only a matter of
time until they break too.)

Change-Id: Ibd61b84f23b6d3023af107f6e3cc4d3b445025bf
Related-bug: #1832164

Change-Id: Ibd61b84f23b6d3023af107f6e3cc4d3b445025bf
Related-bug: #1832164
"}, {'created': '2021-03-16 15:35:48.000000000', 'message': 'Temporary fix for docs job

The docs job is failing because it is grabbing the most recent
SQLAlchemy release (1.4.0), which has removed a function we are
still using (even though it was deprecated in 0.9 -- yep, this
is our fault).

Try to avoid this by specifying SQLAlchemy in doc/req.txt and
hoping the upper-constraints will prevent pip from installing
an unconstrained version of SQLAlchemy.  This will also keep the
requirements job happy (which it is not if we have <1.4.0 in
doc/req.txt).

Change-Id: Ibd61b84f23b6d3023af107f6e3cc4d3b445025bf
Related-bug: #1832164
'}]
commit_message:
Temporary fix for docs job

The docs job is failing because it is grabbing the most recent
SQLAlchemy release (1.4.0), which has removed a function we are
still using (even though it was deprecated in 0.9 -- yep, this
is our fault).

Try to avoid this by specifying SQLAlchemy in doc/req.txt and
hoping the upper-constraints will prevent pip from installing
an unconstrained version of SQLAlchemy.  This will also keep the
requirements job happy (which it is not if we have <1.4.0 in
doc/req.txt).

Change-Id: Ibd61b84f23b6d3023af107f6e3cc4d3b445025bf
Related-bug: #1832164

These configs will allow us to bring up the nodepool-launcher service on
new focal nodepool launcher nodes in an idle state. Once we are happy
with them in the idle state we will land the next change which flips the

commit_message:
Add idle configs for nl02-04.opendev.org

These configs will allow us to bring up the nodepool-launcher service on
new focal nodepool launcher nodes in an idle state. Once we are happy
with them in the idle state we will land the next change which flips the
old hosts to idle and puts these new servers in production.

Change-Id: I0d0a30c49c1336b33dd969b039544e10d98dad0e

Fix tox -e pep8

pycodestyle 2.7.0 causes flake8 to break unless
using a sufficiently new version of flake8.

Change-Id: I01bdb2d2bd74a8b236b7e71471759e1a8fd59511

commit_message:
Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)

Validate status for external stack resource

Allow validate status for external stack resource. If status under
FAILED, IN_PROGRESS, or DELETE_COMPLETE, will raise
StackValidationFailed.
Story: #1764947

Change-Id: Ie6626d1b2edd3464a2c774f768d39c850605393c

commit_message:
Further updates to irrelevant-files across templates

As part of [1] this further updates the irrelevant-files definitions
so that multinode jobs are not run for changes in standalone, ovb,
undercloud or upgrade specific featuresets.

Also adds missing upgrades-jobs-templates to undercloud jobs
irrelevant-files and multinode-jobs template to upgrade jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: Ib40ce6df06cfad7de7ab3845c1e471c3383583a7

[{'created': '2021-03-15 22:55:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix systemd notify unit test on macos

MacOS does not support the abstract socket addressing [1] used by
test_systemd_notify, so the test previously failed on MacOS. This
patch changes the test to bind the socket to a pathname instead.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/unix.7.html

Change-Id: Ibb77995cc4fcd95bfbfbf0095a4b7f166c436eb4
'}, {'created': '2021-03-16 11:13:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix systemd notify unit test on macos

MacOS does not support the abstract socket addressing [1] used by
test_systemd_notify, so the test previously failed on MacOS. With this
patch the test using an abstract address is only attempted on linux
platforms. An additional test is added for all platforms that binds
the socket to a filesystem path.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/unix.7.html

Change-Id: Ibb77995cc4fcd95bfbfbf0095a4b7f166c436eb4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix systemd notify unit test on macos

MacOS does not support the abstract socket addressing [1] used by
test_systemd_notify, so the test previously failed on MacOS. With this
patch the test using an abstract address is only attempted on linux
platforms. An additional test is added for all platforms that binds
the socket to a filesystem path.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/unix.7.html

Change-Id: Ibb77995cc4fcd95bfbfbf0095a4b7f166c436eb4

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

commit_message:
Create OSA-specific tempest resources

This patch is part of a set that aims to break out tempest
resource creation from the role, and introduces the
tempest_default_role_resources var. When true, default role
resources are created. When false, deployer-specific resources
must be created prior to executing os-tempest-install.yml or
including the os_tempest role in other playbooks.

With this patch, OSA-specific tempest resources are created
rather than role defaults.

Change-Id: Idd7f4863442a5f686adadc67dbdea452fb57654c

[{'created': '2021-03-09 20:50:26.000000000', 'message': "Updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service

When having sriov configured in mlnx interfaces and we are using MLNX
ofed, it will install openibd and in reboot case we'll have a race between
sriov_config service and that openibd service which loads mlx drivers,
sometimes it causes failures in starting sriov_config service.
So updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service if it's
present, if not as in default case, systemd ignores it.

Closes-Bug: #1918255
Change-Id: I047e3c40815b71de10e6641c1d39b29de563d8d2
(cherry picked from commit 012b58ccc1623945c4428e82eec80b2f3f22d6b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service

When having sriov configured in mlnx interfaces and we are using MLNX
ofed, it will install openibd and in reboot case we'll have a race between
sriov_config service and that openibd service which loads mlx drivers,
sometimes it causes failures in starting sriov_config service.
So updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service if it's
present, if not as in default case, systemd ignores it.

Closes-Bug: #1918255
Change-Id: I047e3c40815b71de10e6641c1d39b29de563d8d2
(cherry picked from commit 012b58ccc1623945c4428e82eec80b2f3f22d6b7)

Updated from OpenStack Ansible Tests

Change-Id: If59bdebf0e46e81be8ae58f2dee1a5ede56c39a6

subject: Drop baymodel_chk_2 constraints for old DB migration
messages:
[{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-16 15:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-16 15:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is kind of a ugly hack, not sure what creates the baymodel_chk_2 constraint either. But something like this is needed to support MySQL 8.0

This is an issue in stable/victoria as well which is the default version for Ubuntu Focal.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-16 15:20:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Need feedback on how we should solve this in the best way, this probably isn't the best way."}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2020-11-16 15:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can we drop all the bay and baymodel stuff instead?

Order should be:
*Client
*Server
*DB'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-16 18:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah dropping it would work as well, problem is this happens in Victoria so not sure how we can solve it in a backportable way.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-16 18:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-01-11 20:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-01-12 13:33:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-01-12 14:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The only other way around it is I think creating a new "base schema" and removing old migrations right?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2021-01-12 17:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> The only other way around it is I think creating a new "base schema" and removing old migrations right?

AFAIK yes, these are the only two options. magnum story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008488

Didn't realize that this was an option, I'll give it a go.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2021-01-22 16:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This happened to me creating a fresh DB with magnum-db-manager upgrade.

So, not only a problem with migrations'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2021-01-22 16:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> This happened to me creating a fresh DB with magnum-db-manager upgrade.
> 
> So, not only a problem with migrations

A new DB runs all migrations. No problem for devstack on bionic. focal is broken.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2021-01-25 10:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This patch worked for me on a modified stable/train branch
http://paste.openstack.org/show/801920/'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2021-01-25 14:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

How about the following approach?

Using create_constraint=False, it doesn't create any additional constraints. See story  https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008488 for more details.

https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/migration_14.html#enum-and-boolean-datatypes-no-longer-default-to-create-constraint
from https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699
from https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008488




diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/27ad304554e2_adding_magnum_service_functionality.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/27ad304554e2_adding_magnum_service_functionality.py
index 1e8e5088..378358e9 100644
--- a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/27ad304554e2_adding_magnum_service_functionality.py
+++ b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/27ad304554e2_adding_magnum_service_functionality.py
@@ -35,14 +35,14 @@ def upgrade():
         sa.Column('report_count', sa.Integer(), nullable=False),
         sa.Column('host', sa.String(length=255), nullable=True),
         sa.Column('binary', sa.String(length=255), nullable=True),
-        sa.Column('disabled', sa.Boolean(), nullable=True),
+        sa.Column('disabled', sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False), nullable=True),
         sa.Column('disabled_reason', sa.String(length=255), nullable=True),
         # 'last_seen_up' has different purpose than 'updated_at'.
         # 'updated_at' refers to any modification of the entry, which can
         # be administrative too, whereas 'last_seen_up' is more related to
         # magnum_service. Modeled after nova/servicegroup
         sa.Column('last_seen_up', sa.DateTime(), nullable=True),
-        sa.Column('forced_down', sa.Boolean(), nullable=True),
+        sa.Column('forced_down', sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False), nullable=True),
         sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint('id'),
         sa.UniqueConstraint('host', 'binary',
                             name='uniq_magnum_service0host0binary')
diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/2ae93c9c6191_add_public_column_to_baymodel_table.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/2ae93c9c6191_add_public_column_to_baymodel_table.py
index 14054fa1..7ad3cfb8 100644
--- a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/2ae93c9c6191_add_public_column_to_baymodel_table.py
+++ b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/2ae93c9c6191_add_public_column_to_baymodel_table.py
@@ -29,4 +29,4 @@ import sqlalchemy as sa  # noqa: E402
 
 
 def upgrade():
-    op.add_column('baymodel', sa.Column('public', sa.Boolean(), default=False))
+    op.add_column('baymodel', sa.Column('public', sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False), default=False))
diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/461d798132c7_change_cluster_to_support_nodegroups.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/461d798132c7_change_cluster_to_support_nodegroups.py
index e6920319..7f96dff6 100644
--- a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/461d798132c7_change_cluster_to_support_nodegroups.py
+++ b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/461d798132c7_change_cluster_to_support_nodegroups.py
@@ -60,7 +60,7 @@ def upgrade():
         sa.Column('max_node_count', sa.Integer, nullable=True),
         sa.Column('min_node_count', sa.Integer, nullable=True),
         sa.Column('role', String(length=255), nullable=True),
-        sa.Column('is_default', sa.Boolean())
+        sa.Column('is_default', sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False))
     )
 
     connection = op.get_bind()
diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/47380964133d_add_network_subnet_fip_to_cluster.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/47380964133d_add_network_subnet_fip_to_cluster.py

@@ -36,5 +36,5 @@ def upgrade():
                   String(255, mysql_ndb_type=TINYTEXT),
                   nullable=True))
     op.add_column('cluster', sa.Column('floating_ip_enabled',
-                  sa.Boolean(),
+                  sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False),
                   default=False))
diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/4e263f236334_add_registry_enabled.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/4e263f236334_add_registry_enabled.py

@@ -27,4 +27,4 @@ import sqlalchemy as sa  # noqa: E402

     op.add_column('baymodel', sa.Column('registry_enabled',
-                  sa.Boolean(), default=False))
+                  sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False), default=False))
diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/5ad410481b88_rename_insecure.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/5ad410481b88_rename_insecure.py

@@ -28,4 +28,4 @@ import sqlalchemy as sa  # noqa: E402
 def upgrade():
     op.alter_column('baymodel', 'insecure',
                     new_column_name='tls_disabled',
-                    existing_type=sa.Boolean())
+                    existing_type=sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False))

                   default=False))
diff --git a/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/95096e2334ee_add_master_lb_enabled_to_cluster.py b/magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/95096e2334ee_add_master_lb_enabled_to_cluster.py

-                  sa.Column('master_lb_enabled', sa.Boolean(), default=False))

     connection = op.get_bind()
     connection.execute(

> I like this. My only concern is consistency. Existing installations would end up with different constraints compared to new installations. Right?

actually the opposite üòä stable branches have the same issue with mysql8

with mysql8 and https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/magnum/+/762861/4
26 constraints

with sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False) and mysql8
16 constraints

with stable/train and mysql8:
needs the patch since it creates the constraints
25 constraints with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/magnum/+/762861/4
16 constraints with train and sa.Boolean(create_constraint=False)

with stable/train and mysql5.6:
16 constraints

to have the same constraints with mysql5 we should use create_constraint=False

commit_message:
Drop baymodel_chk_2 constraints for old DB migration

Magnum cannot be used with MySQL 8.0 because it tries
to rename a column used by a constraint.

See the error in this paste [1] that occurs when trying
to deploy Magnum on Ubuntu Focal (20.04) where MySQL
now defaults to 8.0

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/800060/

Change-Id: I72dd274150c17b75fd8b86dc62fa269a27f41bce

commit_message:
Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)
(cherry picked from commit ff23708ef47baa9cb67c0afa30edb1ec5c6da802)
(cherry picked from commit e77d34f037559fee522ac8811e07b3416f94e26e)

commit_message:
Fix up the principal name in ovn-dbs-pacemaker-puppet

Via Ib868465c20d97c62cbcb214bfc62d949bd6efc62 this got erroneously
renamed to ovn_controller:
git show e329ca915ebf | grep ovn_dbs |grep template
-    template: "ovn_dbs/%{hiera('fqdn_NETWORK')}"

Let's restore that to its previous name.

Change-Id: I70fadf7921b424f956f78f0b727a0c12efbe2bfe

commit_message:
Revert "Use ussuri branch for tinyipa check job for ussuri"

This reverts commit 166840a3fdd3221c5b3c9973b68cd03c6a7862fc.

Reason for revert: ipa-builder needs to be pinned at 2.2.0 but the override-checkout to ussuri blocks that

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ic1b8b532adec2c46373d3a0a3cea8387bff7817a

subject: Include the nova::glance class in more common place
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-01-26 13:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-01-26 14:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-01-26 14:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Martin

IIUC some parameters like endpoint_override or num_retries can be used in nova-api layer so I think it's better to include this class in the base class instead of nova::compute.
(Please correct me if I'm wrong about this)

Also note that I'm now migrating glance/verify_glance_signatures to nova::glance, and this parameter is used by both nova-api and nova-compute.

Another option would be to load this class in both nova::api and nova::compute but I feel adding this to the base class is more simple, since the parameters of nova::glance doesn't have very sensitive information."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-01-26 14:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-01-26 14:59:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> @Martin
> 
> IIUC some parameters like endpoint_override or num_retries can be used in nova-api layer so I think it's better to include this class in the base class instead of nova::compute.
> (Please correct me if I'm wrong about this)
> 
> Also note that I'm now migrating glance/verify_glance_signatures to nova::glance, and this parameter is used by both nova-api and nova-compute.
> 
> Another option would be to load this class in both nova::api and nova::compute but I feel adding this to the base class is more simple, since the parameters of nova::glance doesn't have very sensitive information.

yes that makes sense, especially when we move other parameters to the new class.
Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-01-27 17:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-01-27 21:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-15 12:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-15 16:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-03-17 08:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Pin neutron, keystone and cinder tempest plugins to py2 compatible versions where needed

On the OSA Train branch, Centos-7 deploys with python2 and the other
operating systems use python3. Debian stable (stretch) uses python
3.5.

This patch pins the tempest plugin versions to ones which support
python2.7 and 3.5 or later.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/780562
Change-Id: I4c9793aaeca46e2e0b7528de8fa0dc222803debb

commit_message:
Fix VolumesActions api tests, volume should not be shared

This class use a shared cinder volume and modify the status
The volume called by multiple testcase, each one change the volume
state and the volume cleaned in class level .

Change the cinder volume to testcase level, before we enter to
testcase setUp called and created a dedicated volume per testcase.

Change-Id: I72529bc5c4fc0f77273ab15419bec4018b0edd52

subject: Sharding: Moving to active state sets state_timestamp
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-16 06:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-16 06:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This is just an idea of how we could do it. Other attempts like using CleavingContexts for only setting ACTIVE on last primary sets sharding state leaves us open to stale cleaving context issues and because shrinking is root driven only really works on root conatiners not sharding shards.

This approach allows us to simply update the state_timestamp when we mark SR as active. It deals with state_timestamp forcing unwanted updates (from a turned off server or split brain) by also using another timestamp we store.. the epoch. Which tends to get set on all existing other uses when we set the state_timestamp.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-16 06:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-17 12:02:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(7 comments)

we're probably going to need to do voice chat üòä

maybe the next patch will make it clearer, but if I understand this will move the state_timestamp when the SR's are made ACTIVE, so that gives us a more accurate time when each shard was sharded, but that time could still be 'early' if it is set on a fast-sharding-replica?"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 06:04:16.000000000', 'message': "Sharding: Moving to active state sets state_timestamp

Be need to be able to know when a shard has moved into the ACTIVE state,
currently there isn't an easy way to figure that for root and sharding
shards. We do have a state_timestamp, but it's used when we need to push
something backwards in the state machine.

But turns out everytime we use that we also set an epoch. Except for
when we set ACITIVE of root containers when they're eligible acceptors.
But in that case, a root already has an epoch. Epoch's are related the
toe filename of the database, however, only the Timestamp.normal value
is used for this. This means we can use timestamp offsets to indicate an
epoch update in the root for collapsing.

What does this mean, it means we can start using epochs to make sure
late ACTIVE state changes (from a node that was down) can't break
something that has since moved back or forward in the state machine.

Change-Id: If71bba48769e9f5b6c51e0d6ccf86d6abee41600
"}]
commit_message:
Sharding: Moving to active state sets state_timestamp

Be need to be able to know when a shard has moved into the ACTIVE state,
currently there isn't an easy way to figure that for root and sharding
shards. We do have a state_timestamp, but it's used when we need to push
something backwards in the state machine.

But turns out everytime we use that we also set an epoch. Except for
when we set ACITIVE of root containers when they're eligible acceptors.
But in that case, a root already has an epoch. Epoch's are related the
toe filename of the database, however, only the Timestamp.normal value
is used for this. This means we can use timestamp offsets to indicate an
epoch update in the root for collapsing.

What does this mean, it means we can start using epochs to make sure
late ACTIVE state changes (from a node that was down) can't break
something that has since moved back or forward in the state machine.

Change-Id: If71bba48769e9f5b6c51e0d6ccf86d6abee41600

commit_message:
Fix provider driver quota handling

When provider drivers registered a load balancer object delete,
the driver agent was not decrementing the project quota.
This patch corrects that by decrementing the proper quota
when a DELETED status is received from the provider driver.

Conflicts:
    octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/driver_agent/test_driver_updater.py

Change-Id: I7d705c9f4f0217c6fbe332f45b15892bf1d4a90b
Story: 2008268
Task: 41133

commit_message:
Clean port forwarding cache when router is DOWN

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will
skip all objects processing when router is UP again, because
the cache is hitting.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Idd65f1eda020ada9a76c39904efa8d55680d9e6b
Closes-bug: #1917393
(cherry picked from commit 058214670820be6f40e8ab05c0e1dbe8dc389abc)

commit_message:
Fix provider driver quota handling

When provider drivers registered a load balancer object delete,
the driver agent was not decrementing the project quota.
This patch corrects that by decrementing the proper quota
when a DELETED status is received from the provider driver.

Conflicts:
    octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/driver_agent/test_driver_updater.py

Change-Id: I7d705c9f4f0217c6fbe332f45b15892bf1d4a90b

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will

commit_message:
Clean port forwarding cache when router is DOWN

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will
skip all objects processing when router is UP again, because
the cache is hitting.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Idd65f1eda020ada9a76c39904efa8d55680d9e6b
Closes-bug: #1917393
(cherry picked from commit 058214670820be6f40e8ab05c0e1dbe8dc389abc)

commit_message:
Hidden property `personality` and mark it as invalid

``personality`` property of ``OS::Nova::Server`` is now Hidden.
Heat will not support it now. Please use ``user_data``
or ``metadata`` instead.

Change-Id: I95005f25134aa8fb44c3029d22c12bfd32bc0676
Task: #27678

subject: Use -dev version for galaxy in git repo
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 19:28:04.000000000', 'message': 'Use -dev version for galaxy in git repo

When installing collections from git[1] the version should be
higher than the released one, but lower than next release can be.
Use "-dev" for set version between two releases in git repo, so
installing from git won't require --force.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/user_guide/
collections_using.html#installing-a-collection-from-a-git-repository
Change-Id: I86f292fde0cb6eaa75908794fe0c997e4bca7aee
'}]
commit_message:
Use -dev version for galaxy in git repo

When installing collections from git[1] the version should be
higher than the released one, but lower than next release can be.
Use "-dev" for set version between two releases in git repo, so
installing from git won't require --force.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/user_guide/
collections_using.html#installing-a-collection-from-a-git-repository
Change-Id: I86f292fde0cb6eaa75908794fe0c997e4bca7aee

Deprecate the mandatory flag

It will not be possible to deactivate this functionality anymore.

commit_message:
Use single NovaLibvirtNetwork to configure instance console components

Nova vnc configuration right now uses NovaVncProxyNetwork,
NovaLibvirtNetwork and NovaApiNetwork to configure the different
components (novnc proxy, nova-compute and libvirt) for vnc.
If one of the networks get changed from internal_api, the service
configuration between libvirt, nova-compute and novnc proxy gets
inconsistent and the console is broken.
This changed to just use NovaLibvirtNetwork for configuring the vnc
endpoints and removes NovaVncProxyNetwork completely.

Change-Id: Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2
Closes-Bug: #1917719

commit_message:
Add deployed_port template

Add a new deployed_port template which will replace
the current neutron port templates when ports are
managed outside of the heat stack.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports

Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I8224deceba331d9fbca64c151b27430530a18528

commit_message:
Update setuptools to match version in upper-constraints

Required to prevent a conflict when setting up a virtualenv which
defaults to the latest version of pip, which has a stricter
resolver.

Change-Id: Ibed47425143125aa6aca990969dd36811b9d144b

[devstack] Stop polluting masakarimonitors src dir

commit_message:
ETSI-NFV SOL 001 translation: AffinityRule

The current heat-translator supports several conversions of
resources defined in ETSI NFV-SOL 001[1].
This patch supports the conversion of new resource types.
Specifically, the following types related to
'PlacementConstraints'.
- tosca.groups.nfv.PlacementGroup
- tosca.policies.nfv.AffinityRule
- tosca.policies.nfv.AntiAffinityRule

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/001/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL001v020601p.pdf

Co-Authored-By: Hiroo Kitamura hiroo.kitamura@ntt-at.co.jp
Implements: blueprint support-placement-constraints
Change-Id: Ic22a6183ee0d7c8357063bdafbb1a11c1a6efa3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 02:07:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix processing related to required properties

In the current UT testcase and yaml, there are several cases where
the required property of policy is insufficient or the definition
part is incorrect.
In addition, there is a bug in the code that has the translation
logic under 'translator/hot/tosca/'.
This patch fixes these translation logic codes, testcase and yaml.

Among the fixed yaml files, the following has a line feed code of CRLF,
so it has been modified to LF.

* translator/tests/data/autoscaling/tosca_cluster_autoscaling.yaml
* translator/tests/data/custom_types/senlin_cluster_policies.yaml
* translator/tests/data/nfv/test_tosca_nfv_autoscaling_with_params.yaml

In addition, NOTE description is added for
'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_policies_monitoring.py',
which is one of the translation logic codes.

Closes-Bug: #1903233
Change-Id: Ib9dec61007db5d354eaca86000ab3bcf6744a838
"}, {'created': '2021-03-10 02:58:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix processing related to required properties

In the current UT testcase and yaml, there are several cases where
the required property of policy is insufficient or the definition
part is incorrect.
In addition, there is a bug in the code that has the translation
logic under 'translator/hot/tosca/'.
This patch fixes these translation logic codes, testcase and yaml.

Among the fixed yaml files, the following has a line feed code of CRLF,
so it has been modified to LF.

* translator/tests/data/autoscaling/tosca_cluster_autoscaling.yaml
* translator/tests/data/custom_types/senlin_cluster_policies.yaml
* translator/tests/data/nfv/test_tosca_nfv_autoscaling_with_params.yaml

In addition, NOTE description is added for
'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_policies_monitoring.py',
which is one of the translation logic codes.

Closes-Bug: #1918360
Change-Id: Ib9dec61007db5d354eaca86000ab3bcf6744a838
"}]
commit_message:
Fix processing related to required properties

In the current UT testcase and yaml, there are several cases where
the required property of policy is insufficient or the definition
part is incorrect.
In addition, there is a bug in the code that has the translation
logic under 'translator/hot/tosca/'.
This patch fixes these translation logic codes, testcase and yaml.

Among the fixed yaml files, the following has a line feed code of CRLF,
so it has been modified to LF.

* translator/tests/data/autoscaling/tosca_cluster_autoscaling.yaml
* translator/tests/data/custom_types/senlin_cluster_policies.yaml
* translator/tests/data/nfv/test_tosca_nfv_autoscaling_with_params.yaml

In addition, NOTE description is added for
'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_policies_monitoring.py',
which is one of the translation logic codes.

Closes-Bug: #1918360
Change-Id: Ib9dec61007db5d354eaca86000ab3bcf6744a838

subject: swift-manage-shard-ranges: check for internal gaps
messages: [{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-17 05:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-17 05:49:28.000000000', 'message': 'swift-manage-shard-ranges: check for internal gaps

Currently the ShardRangeList.includes method only checks the lower and
upper of the list, which means it can only check for gaps at the start
and end of a list. But fails to check for any gaps internal to the list.

We already have a find_missing_ranges helper method that searches for
gaps, so move it into utils and start using it to give us better gap
checking.

Change-Id: I5f0a32325791e91b80ee4541e3e92ceb452a7661
'}]
commit_message:
swift-manage-shard-ranges: check for internal gaps

Currently the ShardRangeList.includes method only checks the lower and
upper of the list, which means it can only check for gaps at the start
and end of a list. But fails to check for any gaps internal to the list.

We already have a find_missing_ranges helper method that searches for
gaps, so move it into utils and start using it to give us better gap
checking.

Change-Id: I5f0a32325791e91b80ee4541e3e92ceb452a7661

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-01 10:29:10.000000000', 'message': "PowerFlex driver manage volume snapshot improvements

PowerFlex driver does not use openstack volume id as its volume name (or
part of its volume name) due to length limitation. It converts the
cinder uuid to an internal name less than 32 chars and maps this name to
an internal id which is a 16-byte hexdecmimal number. Most PowerFlex
volume operations require the internal id, like volume/snapshot manage.

There're 2 conversions:
1. flex_utils.id_to_base64: Openstack cinder volume/snapshot uuid ->
PowerFlex volume name
2. queryIdByKey: PowerFlex volume name -> PowerFlex internal id.

Since all this happens inside PowerFlex driver, there's no way for
tempest to know the PowerFlex internal name or id, thus tempest
volume/snapshot manage cases fail.

This change is to make PowerFlex accept 3 types of source-id so that
PowerFlex volume/snapshot manage is more user-friendly.
1. Openstack volume/snapshot uuid
2. PowerFlex internal name
3. PowerFlex internal id

Change-Id: I7b99982a5e10271f89e3f9c545bb493eae8f477a
Closes-Bug: #1906380

commit_message:
[PowerFlex] manage volume snapshot improvements

PowerFlex driver does not use openstack volume id as its volume name (or
part of its volume name) due to length limitation. It converts the
cinder uuid to an internal name less than 32 chars and maps this name to
an internal id which is a 16-byte hexadecimal number. Most PowerFlex
volume operations require the internal id, like volume/snapshot manage.

There're 2 conversions:
1. flex_utils.id_to_base64: Openstack cinder volume/snapshot uuid ->
PowerFlex volume name
2. queryIdByKey: PowerFlex volume name -> PowerFlex internal id.

Since all this happens inside PowerFlex driver, there's no way for
tempest to know the PowerFlex internal name or id, thus tempest
volume/snapshot manage cases fail.

This change is to make PowerFlex accept 3 types of source-id so that
PowerFlex volume/snapshot manage is more user-friendly.
1. Openstack volume/snapshot uuid
2. PowerFlex internal name
3. PowerFlex internal id

Change-Id: I7b99982a5e10271f89e3f9c545bb493eae8f477a
Closes-Bug: #1906380

commit_message:
Assign all aggregates to reserved_host

This patch fixes the code that assignes aggregates to the reserved_host.
The existing code only assigned a aggregate that first matched failed
compute host name.
By this fix, all aggregates that ware assigned to the failed host can
be assigned to the reserved_host.

Closes-Bug: #1856164
Change-Id: I8a727e3c50b71a5ad52d58d0ba3bde4f09446748

subject: Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy
messages: [{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-03-16 14:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-16 15:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-16 15:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 14:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
(cherry picked from commit c8a828aab297500176d2f9e9e0b05d47d60e4645)
(cherry picked from commit a6c7ba02a969fa82473b2f670b1e8d98baf70b59)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
(cherry picked from commit c8a828aab297500176d2f9e9e0b05d47d60e4645)
(cherry picked from commit a6c7ba02a969fa82473b2f670b1e8d98baf70b59)

commit_message:
Upgrade Prometheus to v2.25 change/Remove deprecated flags

The flag storage.tsdb.retention is deprecated and generates warnings
on startup storage.tsdb.retention.time is the new flag.

storage.tsdb.wal-compression is now set as the default in v2.20
and above and is no longer needed

Change-Id: I66f861a354a3cdde69a712ca5fd8a1d1a1eca60a

commit_message:
Add security add/update services for in-use share networks

This change adds two new commands to the client:
- 'share-network-security-service-update'
- 'share-network-security-service-update-check'
- 'share-network-security-service-add-check'
- 'share-network-reset-state'

Partially Implements: bp add-security-service-in-use-share-networks
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andre Beltrami <debeltrami@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

Depends-On: Id121ba942c7840a7cd7574f08a524fd4dbe06f64
Change-Id: Ib7b67b4c0ce9b16e1ee4a8291cb48c0b1c7ca367

commit_message:
[IBM DS8000]: Fix compatability issue in get_host

get_host" checks for "os_type" and sets host type for DS8000, "os_type"
returned from python2.7 is "linux2" and from python3 is "linux". This
will lead the get_host to set the wrong host type.

Modified get_host to include "linux" in "os_type" check and removed the
"OShost" tag for host name.

Closes-Bug: #1903648
Change-Id: Ibafecf204465132d64d28102acbcc311079b65f8

'}, {'created': '2021-03-15 14:58:46.000000000', 'message': 'API to force manual cleaning without booting IPA

Adds a new argument disable_ramdisk to the manual cleaning API.
Only steps that are marked with requires_ramdisk=False can be
run in this mode. Cleaning prepare/tear down is not done.

Some steps (like redfish BIOS) currently require IPA to detect

commit_message:
API to force manual cleaning without booting IPA

Adds a new argument disable_ramdisk to the manual cleaning API.
Only steps that are marked with requires_ramdisk=False can be
run in this mode. Cleaning prepare/tear down is not done.

Some steps (like redfish BIOS) currently require IPA to detect
a successful reboot. They are not marked with requires_ramdisk
just yet.

Change-Id: Icacac871603bd48536188813647bc669c574de2a
Story: #2008491
Task: #41540

commit_message:
Make UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeLeapp{ToRemove,ToInstall,CommandOptions} per-role

When specific roles are deployed with custom images, for example CephStorage with
overcloud-minimal, then the LeappCommandOptions and/or the list of packages to
be removed/installed is not the same across all roles.

This change makes four parameters to be customized on a per-role basis:
UpgradeInitCommand
UpgradeLeappToRemove
UpgradeLeappToInstall
UpgradeLeappCommandOptions

Related-Bug: 1915067
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1936419
Change-Id: Ifd373f7aba6d98baa843b141de8a2266eaa71a0b
(cherry picked from commit 155fe9454b907553a351e724da3b5ef3ce8dcb48)

subject: py36: Fix syslog fallback to UDP
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-16 17:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-16 22:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 17:57:47.000000000', 'message': 'py36: Fix syslog fallback to UDP

With py2 the SysLogHandler would raise an error if it could not
connect to the configured log_address socket. This prompted the
utils.get_logger() method to fallback to using UDP. With py3 an error
is not raised [1], so the fallback never happens. In that scenario,
exceptions are raised when swift services are started and attempt to
log.

This patch modifies get_logger() to test if the log_address is a socket
before instantiating a SysLogHandler and fallback to UDP if not a socket.

[1] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/master/Lib/logging/handlers.py#L833-L842

Change-Id: Ic099fdc3925bf99f8528c7aa763b651c19df1322
'}]
commit_message:
py36: Fix syslog fallback to UDP

With py2 the SysLogHandler would raise an error if it could not
connect to the configured log_address socket. This prompted the
utils.get_logger() method to fallback to using UDP. With py3 an error
is not raised [1], so the fallback never happens. In that scenario,
exceptions are raised when swift services are started and attempt to
log.

This patch modifies get_logger() to test if the log_address is a socket
before instantiating a SysLogHandler and fallback to UDP if not a socket.

[1] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/master/Lib/logging/handlers.py#L833-L842

Change-Id: Ic099fdc3925bf99f8528c7aa763b651c19df1322

subject: Don't specify --os-cloud undercloud (ephemeral heat)
messages:
[{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-01-08 19:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-01-13 12:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-01-27 21:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-03 01:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-10 01:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-02-23 23:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-02-24 19:47:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

we've been steadily tracking away from relying on the stackrc file and using the clouds config instead in all of our CLI usage. Is there a reason that the playbooks don't work with ephemeral heat in this regard?"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-25 12:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-16 16:39:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> we've been steadily tracking away from relying on the stackrc file and using the clouds config instead in all of our CLI usage. Is there a reason that the playbooks don't work with ephemeral heat in this regard?

Yes, the clouds.yaml, and stackrc assume a full keystone environment. They both configure openstack sdk auth in a way that it will try and use keystone.

We don't want that requirement when using ephemeral Heat. Not only does Heat not need to talk to keystone, but the clients doen't either (heatclient/tripleoclient) don't either.

This is how I'm handling that when we instantiate the client for ephemeral Heat:

https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/master/tripleoclient/utils.py#L2623-L2631

When we get to within the ansible tasks, we need to then rely on the env vars, and not a clouds config yaml. The alternative would be to write out a clouds config yaml specifically configured for using ephemeral heat, then specify that clouds config with --os-cloud.

The downside of that is then the ansible would have to be if/then around a heat-type conditional.

if heat_type==installed:
  use --os-cloud undercloud
elif heat_type==pod:
  use --os-cloud undercloud-ephemeral-heat

That was the original road I was going down, but using the env vars allowed be to remove the conditional. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-03-16 17:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-16 19:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Don't specify --os-cloud undercloud (ephemeral heat)

It is not necessary to specify --os-cloud undercloud when running
openstackclient commands as the stackrc file is expected to already be
sourced.

Also, by removing the --os-cloud argument it allows the playbooks to
work when using an ephemeral Heat instance with the same command,
instead of having to use a different command depending on what type of
Heat is used.

Implements: blueprint ephemeral-heat-overcloud
Change-Id: I1e8b5e58d4464900abc7f3234e7520c44d7cb0c0

can we keep -external.yaml in /cephadm/ and rename it in cephadm-external.yaml?

this would follow the pattern we had for ceph-ansible instead of trying to use a single environment file with a generic name for ceph; in fact I would probably remove environments/storage-environment.yaml and environments/storage-environment-external.yaml

this I guess will force changes in some CI jobs but is less confusing for real users

alternatively, if we want to have a "generic" environment file to enable ceph and switch that from ceph-ansible to cephadm, we should probably add some environments/ceph.yaml too'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-15 19:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> can we keep -external.yaml in /cephadm/ and rename it in cephadm-external.yaml?

But this client configuration has nothing to do with cephadm. 

> this would follow the pattern we had for ceph-ansible

Because we used to use ceph-ansible to configure clients. 

> instead of trying to use a single environment file with a generic name for ceph; 

But external ceph configuration is a tripleo thing now. I think trying to lump this into either directory would create confusion about what is configuring the client.

> in fact I would probably remove environments/storage-environment.yaml and environments/storage-environment-external.yaml

Yes, we should remove those too. 

> this I guess will force changes in some CI jobs but is less confusing for real users

What upstream CI jobs use external ceph? I guess you mean downstream jobs. However, they're going to have to stop using ceph-ansible because it's gone.

> alternatively, if we want to have a "generic" environment file to enable ceph and switch that from ceph-ansible to cephadm, we should probably add some environments/ceph.yaml too

I don't see why. cephadm and ceph-ansible have directories because they have multiple environment files for multiple configurations. They interface with external tools.

External ceph now has nothing to do with either cephadm or ceph-ansible.

We have to do the change (because ceph-ansible is no longer doing external ceph config) so let's give it a reasonable path.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-03-16 14:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

okay I think the two "storage-environment" files might be confusing then, we can remove those in another change'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-16 15:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-16 15:30:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Add external-ceph environment file

External ceph configuration is done with tripleo
using the tripleo_ceph_client ansible role.
This change adds a new, generic environment file
that can be included in the overcloud deploy when
services using an external Ceph cluster are configured.

Change-Id: I86650396218d27250150456b023a9d3e392c2e5f

commit_message:
Use centos-8 stream source image - overcloud images

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/780654
moves all centos-8 jobs to run with centos-8 stream nodesets.

When image build jobs run, this review sets the source image
to centos-8 stream.

Enable fast-diff, which requires exclusive-lock
and object-map.

exclusive-lock when CEPH_ISCSI is enabled, but this
code would not work reliably, since it was doing

commit_message:
Set rbd default features in ceph.conf

The typical Cinder deployment should have
more than just "layering" enabled.

Enable fast-diff, which requires exclusive-lock
and object-map.

Previously, there was code that tried to enable
exclusive-lock when CEPH_ISCSI is enabled, but this
code would not work reliably, since it was doing
addition instead of bitwise-or.  Just remove it
since exclusive-lock will be enabled by default.

Change-Id: Idad98cfebf5e3b265316f2b6a3c201b472faa32c

commit_message:
Specify router name to allow co-located routers

We were getting "Error: It appears that a router instance named '' has been
previously configured in this host. If that instance no longer exists, use the
--force option to overwrite it." when co-locating mysql-routers. Specify the
name of the mysql-router to allow co-location.

Closes-Bug: #1918726
Change-Id: I65c2730dcb5ffb240bf57c9e0b0cb1a1735a4525

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-03-16 17:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-16 19:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Small nit. Address in a follow-up if you can, please üòä'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 15:52:26.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Deprecate `live_migration_tunnelled`

We are well above the required MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION and MIN_QEMU_VERSION
(4.4.0 and 2.11.0, respectively) to get QEMU-native TLS[1] support by
default.

So we can now deprecate (and later remove) the support for "tunnelled
live migration", which has two inherent limitations: (a) it cannot
handle live migration of disks in a non-shared storage setup (a.k.a.
"block migration"); and (b) it has a huge performance overhead and
latency, because it burns more CPU and memory bandwidth due to increased
number of data copies, on both source and destination hosts.

Both the above limitations are addressed by the QEMU-native TLS support
`live_migration_with_native_tls`, which is the recommended approach for
securing all live migration streams (guest RAM, device state, and
disks).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.html

Change-Id: I34fd5a4788a2ad4380d9a57b84512fa94a6f9c37
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Deprecate `live_migration_tunnelled`

We are well above the required MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION and MIN_QEMU_VERSION
(4.4.0 and 2.11.0, respectively) to get QEMU-native TLS[1] support by
default.

So we can now deprecate (and later remove) the support for "tunnelled
live migration", which has two inherent limitations: (a) it cannot
handle live migration of disks in a non-shared storage setup (a.k.a.
"block migration"); and (b) it has a huge performance overhead and
latency, because it burns more CPU and memory bandwidth due to increased
number of data copies, on both source and destination hosts.

Both the above limitations are addressed by the QEMU-native TLS support
`live_migration_with_native_tls`, which is the recommended approach for
securing all live migration streams (guest RAM, device state, and
disks).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.html

Change-Id: I34fd5a4788a2ad4380d9a57b84512fa94a6f9c37
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-05-06 21:12:08.000000000', 'message': 'Skip hostname check when running in a container

To facilitate tripleo deploy running in a conatiner, the hostname check
is skipped if the "container" environment variable set. This environment
variable is set automatically by container runtimes.

The hostname check is not a useful preflight check when running tripleo
deploy in a container, and further, the hostnamectl command can't be
used since the process running inside the container is not running under
systemd.

Change-Id: I4466ae1ce3fdd209a5281338b29287f43abdfd3a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-05-07 01:12:03.000000000', 'message': 'Skip hostname check when running in a container

is skipped if the "container" environment variable set. This environment
variable is set automatically by container runtimes.

The hostname check is not a useful preflight check when running tripleo
deploy in a container, and further, the hostnamectl command can't be
used since the process running inside the container is not running under
systemd.

blueprint tripleo-deploy-multinode
Change-Id: I4466ae1ce3fdd209a5281338b29287f43abdfd3a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Skip hostname check when running in a container

To facilitate tripleo deploy running in a conatiner, the hostname check
is skipped if the "container" environment variable set. This environment
variable is set automatically by container runtimes.

The hostname check is not a useful preflight check when running tripleo
deploy in a container, and further, the hostnamectl command can't be
used since the process running inside the container is not running under
systemd.

blueprint tripleo-deploy-multinode
Change-Id: I4466ae1ce3fdd209a5281338b29287f43abdfd3a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Flip nl01.openstack.org to nl01.opendev.org

This flips the active control of the rax providers from
nl01.openstack.org to nl01.opendev.org. This change should only be
landed once we are happy with the deployment of a new nl01.opendev.org
instance.

Change-Id: Idc838c3cb2d631ef684f733b564f7d4713fc3a41

commit_message:
Bump erlang version

Packagecloud repo has dropped previous erlang repo causing CentOS 7
CI to fail. We bump debian erlang version for consistency as well.

CentOS 7 jobs are set non-voting to resolve circular dependency
wich has been raised with [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/+/779696

Change-Id: I5f70542a4632e602b2cd783c61aa074e3c8e0d57

commit_message:
Add support for nova custom provider inventories

Nova supports to configure resource provider inventory and traits using a
standardized YAML file format starting victoria release [1]. This introduces
CustomProviderInventories role parameter to configure the custom provider yaml.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/managing-resource-providers.html

Depends-On: If12d7f5a8c331e051eb543f88187c31e676f3b62
Depends-On: I509eec3bf37368640ae8a3df8271b769d29f70c4
Change-Id: I25ea828397fcc968d07b0d5e87bdc9445ac690e2

Shouldn't this depend only on the ovn-octavia-provider change?

Seems some SCTP tests failed:

[Fail] [sig-network] NetworkPolicy [Feature:SCTPConnectivity][LinuxOnly][Disruptive] NetworkPolicy between server and client using SCTP [BeforeEach] should support a 'default-deny' policy [Feature:NetworkPolicy] 
[Fail] [sig-network] NetworkPolicy [Feature:SCTPConnectivity][LinuxOnly][Disruptive] NetworkPolicy between server and client using SCTP [BeforeEach] should enforce policy based on Ports [Feature:NetworkPolicy] 
[Fail] [sig-network] NetworkPolicy [Feature:SCTPConnectivity][LinuxOnly][Disruptive] NetworkPolicy between server and client using SCTP [BeforeEach] should enforce policy to allow traffic only from a pod in a different namespace based on PodSelector and NamespaceSelector [Feature:NetworkPolicy]"}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-03 13:36:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Shouldn't this depend only on the ovn-octavia-provider change?
> 
> Seems some SCTP tests failed:
> 
> [Fail] [sig-network] NetworkPolicy [Feature:SCTPConnectivity][LinuxOnly][Disruptive] NetworkPolicy between server and client using SCTP [BeforeEach] should support a 'default-deny' policy [Feature:NetworkPolicy] 
> [Fail] [sig-network] NetworkPolicy [Feature:SCTPConnectivity][LinuxOnly][Disruptive] NetworkPolicy between server and client using SCTP [BeforeEach] should enforce policy based on Ports [Feature:NetworkPolicy] 
> [Fail] [sig-network] NetworkPolicy [Feature:SCTPConnectivity][LinuxOnly][Disruptive] NetworkPolicy between server and client using SCTP [BeforeEach] should enforce policy to allow traffic only from a pod in a different namespace based on PodSelector and NamespaceSelector [Feature:NetworkPolicy]


I was not sure if the Octavia patch was necessary.
That's all the SCTP test. Means they all failed."}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-04 16:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-05 16:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-02-05 19:06:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

perhaps the removal of the octavia depends-on could help. Also, in case NP tests pass on your local env it's worth to check what is the difference with the ci."}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-05 22:19:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> perhaps the removal of the octavia depends-on could help. Also, in case NP tests pass on your local env it's worth to check what is the difference with the ci.

Thanks, I will remove that dependency now. What's funny is that the ci failures happen in the 'BeforeEach' that is before the network policy is even applied (that's what I was trying to confirm with the rechecks). So, hopefully removing the octavia depends-on helps."}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-05 22:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-12 08:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-12 09:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Lol, at least the SCTPConnectivity tests all passed.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-17 16:44:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> Lol, at least the SCTPConnectivity tests all passed.

Apparently the SCTPConnectivity tests are disruptive[1] and as such should not be run in parallel with other tests because they can cause them to fail[2]. 
Question is should I run all the tests in Serial which will be really slow or abandon adding the disruptive tests.

[1]  https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/13295e5eddfb7fa2aea4b6f048eb86adc9af92b4/test/e2e/network/network_policy.go#L1729
[2] https://stupefied-goodall-e282f7.netlify.app/contributors/devel/e2e-tests/#kinds-of-tests'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-02-17 17:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hey Tabitha, good finding. So, I believe the SCTP tests should be ran in serial and in another task, after all the other Network Policy tests have finalized.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-17 17:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 08:42:09.000000000', 'message': '[Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

This patch creates the logfile beforehands, and sets the needed rights
on it.

Change-Id: Ica1b5c0a165cc06fac668513114eef2b4ba73f56
Closes-Bug: #1918138
'}]
commit_message:
[Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

This patch creates the logfile beforehands, and sets the needed rights
on it.

Change-Id: Ica1b5c0a165cc06fac668513114eef2b4ba73f56
Closes-Bug: #1918138

[{'created': '2021-03-11 15:22:47.000000000', 'message': 'Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777561
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)
'}]
commit_message:
Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777561
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)

commit_message:
Remove third-party OVS NSH support in favor of built-in support

This patchset removes the ovs_nsh_support variable used to deploy
a custom-compiled release of Open vSwitch with NSH support in favor
of relying on built-in NSH support in recent releases of Open vSwitch[1].

[1] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2017-November/340716.html

Change-Id: If6456d2916982226bbdc5080ec58a47b6fb1ec8d

commit_message:
Remove VFSLocalFS

The fix Iac8496065c8b6212d7edac320659444ab341b513 removed the last user
of VFSLocalFS so this patch remove the class, the related tests and all
the privsep functions that become dead code after this cleanup.

Change-Id: Ia1eb1d93d1f9699a4027b7a07107109ab9a3a29a

commit_message:
WIP: tests: Make mdev stubs work like vDPA

This is slightly cleaner, IMO, and unifies the two approaches.

WIP because I need to get hold of a real mdev-having server to update
the XML snippets. What we have now is a *huge* lie (as opposed to a
small lie).

Change-Id: I57d310a39d877f66bb017c5cd70ae90612289a4f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add tinyipa ussuri jobs

Add definitions for tinyipa ussuri jobs, we need them to point to
ipa-builder with tinycore 10.x as ussuri CI platform is still based on
ubuntu bionic and the kernel would be too old to use tinycore >= 11.x

Add a non-voting job to keep an eye on it

Change-Id: I0cadc636f7ae29dd289e4455c11c1549a02475df

commit_message:
Fix memcached restart on cert renewal

Memcached does not need to be restarted in order to reload new certs,
a single refresh_certs command will do. This fix will preserve cached
items and avoid cache rebuild.

Change-Id: Ida5faaf4685b111b3b07b4499b24d4ba3b6ec459
Depends-On: I18bda6b9219ab42543f83c46be7763f98e4dfd0e
Signed-off-by: Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use stream labels on all centos 8 nodesets

As the last step of the centos-8 transition,
move all centos-8 nodesets to use centos-8
stream labels and deploy centos-8 stream nodes.

Change-Id: I174e7822059a3022089ae06917e7cca9f90cd765

commit_message:
Improve curl download

- Add -f and -S option to see the actual error
- Combined all options at one
- Increased number of retries to 5

Change-Id: Idc399f75f0abdb1ff91e785a738dce256fb6c281
(cherry picked from commit e69df3de39c5764b334cb9752f247934c54a9e44)

commit_message:
Improve curl download

- Add -f and -S option to see the actual error
- Combined all options at one
- Increased number of retries to 5

Change-Id: Idc399f75f0abdb1ff91e785a738dce256fb6c281
(cherry picked from commit e69df3de39c5764b334cb9752f247934c54a9e44)

commit_message:
Assume centos version is at least 8.3

Removing this check allows the same code to work on centos-8 stream
where the version is reported just as '8'.

Change-Id: Icc608500a099f51e5c44cecd1d259ff6315758f7

messages: [{'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-03-09 21:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2021-03-09 21:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30449, 'date': '2021-03-10 00:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2021-03-10 00:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2021-03-16 04:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 21:55:15.000000000', 'message': 'Update glance default policy values

There was an issue with the metadef APIs in glance, detailed in
the latest OSSN[0] that they have the potential to leak resources.

This change updates the default policy for the metadef APIs to
be disabled by default.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0088

Change-Id: I7377b3a2f3784fe7da78bdd7aba146328cc0f406
'}]
commit_message:
Update glance default policy values

There was an issue with the metadef APIs in glance, detailed in
the latest OSSN[0] that they have the potential to leak resources.

This change updates the default policy for the metadef APIs to
be disabled by default.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0088

Change-Id: I7377b3a2f3784fe7da78bdd7aba146328cc0f406

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 python in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I945f20d99bc4449fed5d6510d823b1375b2af22f

commit_message:
Disable Load Balancers panel when Octavia service is not deployed

Currently Load Balancers panel is enabled based on 'network' service
defined in Keystone but it should refer to 'load-balancer' service
which is served by Octavia.

Story: #2008446
Task: #41413
Change-Id: Ia93cb7520ff9c179a27e72719f1fd10524c57acb
(cherry picked from commit 9b10ff4964d125dbd59232c52ca692c5c7fe0044)
(cherry picked from commit f1311fc7ec88d1631ac9131f41fed0953c018769)
(cherry picked from commit b09a3d454efe31e100a5bcdfe0a3e37f06060f77)

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774118
Change-Id: I712f03bd1dc33bd61bedf9ddea1a4ccffbedd53d
(cherry picked from commit d385ca82721cf4b4c5cd087b349d48ac318b4776)

'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 16:37:45.000000000', 'message': "Exposing internal url over the relation.

There are scenarios where a keystone's consumer might want to talk to
keystone over the internal url, exposing this information over the
relation would allow services like openstack-dashboard to implement
a configuration option equivalent to `use-internal-endpoint` provided
by nova-cloud-controller.

Closes-bug: #1812361

commit_message:
Exposing internal url over the relation.

There are scenarios where a keystone's consumer might want to talk to
keystone over the internal url, exposing this information over the
relation would allow services like openstack-dashboard to implement
a configuration option equivalent to `use-internal-endpoint` provided
by nova-cloud-controller.

Closes-bug: #1812361
Change-Id: I129a686ed9d20035894a36500cb64d1798d3f9d2
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Reyes <felipe.reyes@canonical.com>

[{'created': '2021-03-07 21:22:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for CephDynamicSpec and CephSpecPath

If the CephDynamicSpec boolean is true, then the
ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module will create a
Ceph spec file based on the tripleo-ansible-inventory.

If the CephDynamicSpec boolean is false, then the
deployer may place their own Ceph spec file on the
undercloud at CephSpecPath.

Depends-On: I74cb373f1dc94f8a5ef12c0545cfbc0c49abd69b
Change-Id: I3ce3db44706c4b378aa5abc7650ad8478576bf3a

If CephOsdSpec json is set, then it will appear in the

and hosts of the generated Ceph spec will have their

commit_message:
Add CephDynamicSpec, CephSpecPath, CephOsdSpec, CephSpecFqdn

If the CephDynamicSpec boolean is true, then the
ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module will create a
Ceph spec file based on the tripleo-ansible-inventory.

If the CephDynamicSpec boolean is false, then the
deployer may place their own Ceph spec file on the
undercloud at CephSpecPath.

If CephOsdSpec json is set, then it will appear in the
genereated Ceph spec for the 'osd' service_type.

If CephSpecFqdn boolean is true, then the hostname
and hosts of the generated Ceph spec will have their
fully qualified domain name instead of their short
hostname.

Depends-On: I74cb373f1dc94f8a5ef12c0545cfbc0c49abd69b
Change-Id: I3ce3db44706c4b378aa5abc7650ad8478576bf3a

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

lower-constraints job is broken. Requirements are rarely changed
in stable branches and dropping lower-constrants job from stable
branches was discussed in the mailing list. It looks safe to drop
it in stable branches. Octavia already dropped lower-constraints
job in stable branches and this change follows it.

Conflicts:
	lower-constraints.txt
	tox.ini
	zuul.d/projects.yaml

Change-Id: I86579c7359c6a44871aa154a1563050b1024ac63
(cherry picked from commit 6f2ef772b041249f92f5a3f3c6fbfa9cc332a91c)
(cherry picked from commit d0b91fdbd27abea4df476a622dcacd2d3c258237)

commit_message:
Use git hash instead of release to build ipmitool

ipmitool has not had a stable release since a while.
To keep it up to date we clone its repo, pin it to a git commit hash and
compile it from there.
This will also help to avoid patching the code before the compilation as
the changes will be included already in the cloned code.

Change-Id: Ic3c1c0ceace1559d04288b12ab52e343abe56392

commit_message:
Expose [workaround]/ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup

This exposes the nova workaround to remove the instance directory on
clean up when using rbd.

Change-Id: Iea47828c8022955cf0f91b891d43eff34a905174
(cherry picked from commit 6178fbf0331b7bb1531365f578c56912d67fccb0)

commit_message:
Add new options to PKCS#11 backend

This patch adds support for a couple of new new options in the
PCKS#11 backends.  Namely 'token_labels' and 'os_locking_ok'.

Change-Id: Iba7013dd6e1b1e4650b25cd4dd8dc1f355ceb538

commit_message:
Schedule networks to new segments if needed

In case when subnet in segment X was created before hosts from
that segment was mapped in the Neutron DB, network wasn't scheduled
to the DHCP agents in that new segment.
Now DHCP scheduler is triggered in such case.

Closes-bug: #1917811
Change-Id: Ic9e64aa4ecdc3d56f00c26204ad931b810db7599

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I4f0db0ab31e9d394d7f741aff88b53bc9129daa1
