commit_message:
Replace user with openssh_keypair

On Fedora 33 user: doesn't create id_rsa.pub, so next task fails as

TASK [Slurp pub key]
fatal: [test]: FAILED! => {
    "changed": false
}

MSG:

file not found: /home/sgolovat/.ssh/id_rsa.pub

This patch replaces user: with openssh_keypair: to have more control
over ssh key pair creation

Change-Id: I6b303c13957f905aae0a04ea99cf53ceb9684de2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 16:32:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie30b36ef675454185fe899879c7f257c8fc121bb
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie30b36ef675454185fe899879c7f257c8fc121bb

Add Python3 xena unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for xena.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

I followed the discussion in the mailing list and my understanding is same. I belive it is safe.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-16 06:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please hold this for a while. I just found out that neutron periodic job with neutron-lib from master is failing. I need to check why it's like that."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-16 07:31:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Please hold this for a while. I just found out that neutron periodic job with neutron-lib from master is failing. I need to check why it's like that.

I opened bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1919280 but according to my discussion with Rodolfo, it seems that we are good to go here and we will need to adjust unit tests in Neutron when we will bump minimum neutron-lib version there. Those UT are not written in the best way and that's why they are failing. Current neutron-lib behavior is correct."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 08:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Slawek: Please can +1 to confirm that you're ready to go. Thanks"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-16 10:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 10:49:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-03-16 11:58:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mostly looks OK to me, I have only one question regarding the version bump:
- requirements.txt is modified, so don't we need a minor version bump here?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 13:19:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Mostly looks OK to me, I have only one question regarding the version bump:
> - requirements.txt is modified, so don't we need a minor version bump here?

Yes exact thank you for your diligent review"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 13:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please can you propose a minor version as Elod suggested.
Requirements have been updated

https://releases.openstack.org/reference/reviewer_guide.html#requirements-changes'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-16 13:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-16 13:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-16 13:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-03-16 13:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks! LGTM.'}]

commit_message:
Release new neutron-lib version

It contains important fix related to the secure-rbac personas and how
they are handled in the Neutron.

Change-Id: I6d1cbc54f36ee34b51420b1c2ed534b0eea53afb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 16:32:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I76ab7dd5a35be764813a3fdddca69ade9d585bd9
'}]
commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I76ab7dd5a35be764813a3fdddca69ade9d585bd9

commit_message:
switch to CentOS 8 Stream

We use official CentOS 8 Stream image as a base.

So far Stream does not have own SIG repos
RDO Wallaby packages will be built against Stream

Kolla CI jobs are renamed to centos8s. Kolla-Ansible ones will follow
in later patch.

Change-Id: Ibb23c9d0caf115fcbba7bd322ecebe8d80b6821a

commit_message:
Fix port id vs uuid in ValidateInterfacesHook

follow-up to Icd3de82877c6a53d32b4c9fd3e500d3cd9d7fb17

Use id attribute instead of uuid. This caused an exception when an unexpected
port was being deleted.

Story: 2008698
Task: 42007
Change-Id: Ib4978f5e3e4f1b64faa1bfae3cdcf46199bb2f21
(cherry picked from commit 22853a74b5f30c0047a1ffab039f983e2563a335)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-25 10:21:29.000000000', 'message': 'Cancel consumer if queue down

Previously, we have switched to use default exchanges
to avoid excessive amounts of exchange not found messages.
But it does not actually solve the problem because
reply_* queue is already gone and agent will not receive callbacks.

after some debugging, I found under some circumstances
seems rabbitmq consumer does not receive basic cancel
signal when queue is already gone. This might due to
rabbitmq try to restart consumer when queue is down
(for example when split brain). In such cases,
it might be better to fail early.

by reading the code, seems like x-cancel-on-ha-failover
is not dedicated to mirror queues only, https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1894,
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1926.

By failing early, in my own test setup,
I could solve a certain case of exchange not found problem.

Change-Id: I2ae53340783e4044dab58035bc0992dc08145b53
Related-bug: #1789177
(cherry picked from commit 196fa877a90d7eb0f82ec9e1c194eef3f98fc0b1)
(cherry picked from commit 0a432c7fb107d04f7a41199fe9a8c4fbd344d009)

commit_message:
Cancel consumer if queue down

Previously, we have switched to use default exchanges
to avoid excessive amounts of exchange not found messages.
But it does not actually solve the problem because
reply_* queue is already gone and agent will not receive callbacks.

after some debugging, I found under some circumstances
seems rabbitmq consumer does not receive basic cancel
signal when queue is already gone. This might due to
rabbitmq try to restart consumer when queue is down
(for example when split brain). In such cases,
it might be better to fail early.

by reading the code, seems like x-cancel-on-ha-failover
is not dedicated to mirror queues only, https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1894,
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1926.

By failing early, in my own test setup,
I could solve a certain case of exchange not found problem.

Skipping functional failover's tests on stable/train.

Conflicts:
- oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

(NOTE) hberaud: 56fc332608028ba4c671255e8bd9223a0bae762d is less older
than these changes and it have been merged before on train. Conflicts
are due to option type switch on `direct_mandatory_flag`.

Changes:
- oslo_messaging/tests/functional/test_rabbitmq.py

(NOTE) hberaud: Skipping functional tests to avoid a SIGTERM issue with
pifpaf [1] until the pifpaf version are updated in requirements [2].
This was decided during one of our previous meeting [3].

[1] https://github.com/jd/pifpaf/pull/124
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/753239o
(3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2020/oslo.2020-11-16-15.00.log.html#l-28

Change-Id: I2ae53340783e4044dab58035bc0992dc08145b53
Related-bug: #1789177
(cherry picked from commit 196fa877a90d7eb0f82ec9e1c194eef3f98fc0b1)
(cherry picked from commit 0a432c7fb107d04f7a41199fe9a8c4fbd344d009)

There might be a usecase where config_overrides should be considered as

commit_message:
Allow use overrides as single source of content

There might be a usecase where config_overrides should be considered as
the only source of the content - without template and even
source file. Thus we default source to the empty dict which makes possible
to avoid explicitly defining empty content when none is present.

Change-Id: I8a1fc130191bc3c381ceed183a11e16a32c789a5

commit_message:
Ironic cycle highlights for Wallaby

Note: Originally this had links, but due to openstack doc processes,
plus release tooling processes, and a lack of context,
this resulted in objections due to 404'ed links that would work in
about a week and a half, where as if we tried to link to the unreleased
doc, it would be gone and not work in week and a half.

After checking with Kendall, we determined that since only Ironic was
really doing this, we would remove the links for now, and they can be
added back in later.

`UEFI Partition Image handling <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic-python-agent/wallaby.html#relnotes-6-5-0-bug-fixes>`_
`NVMe Secure Erase <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic-python-agent/wallaby.html#new-features>`_
`per-instance deployment driver interface overrides <https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/standalone.html#overriding-a-hardware-interface>`_
`deploy time "deploy_steps" <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-ironicclient/wallaby.html#new-features>`_w

Change-Id: I92a42f83a67da008ec37f66791a7b859ef20b32c

commit_message:
Allocation support for project scoped RBAC

Adds policy scope based RBAC handling for the allocations
endpoing which enables admins to create allocations if
they have baremetal nodes which are available to them.

Change-Id: I60e273afaf344fded9bdb8c4c8e143efc9971fc1

[{'created': '2021-03-10 13:56:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix parameters for puppet-memcached-6.0.0

Rename listen_addr to listen; drop notls_listen_addr and
notls_listen_port from version 5.0.0, as they never made it
in into puppet-memcached-6.0.0.

Change-Id: I18bda6b9219ab42543f83c46be7763f98e4dfd0e
Signed-off-by: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Co-authored-By: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parameters for puppet-memcached-6.0.0

Rename listen_addr to listen; drop notls_listen_addr and
notls_listen_port from version 5.0.0, as they never made it
in into puppet-memcached-6.0.0.

Change-Id: I18bda6b9219ab42543f83c46be7763f98e4dfd0e
Signed-off-by: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Co-authored-By: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

Update version of tox to 3.9.0 to support inline comments in tox.ini
Import pep8 test requirements directly in tox.ini and do not import all
the test-requirements
Update version of hacking
Fix import orders in various modules

commit_message:
Apply pep8 import order style

Update version of tox to 3.9.0 to support inline comments in tox.ini
Import pep8 test requirements directly in tox.ini and do not import all
the test-requirements
Update version of hacking
Fix import orders in various modules

Leave filter for imports in tests/ for the time being

Change-Id: Ia625036d1f50ae97880ef70335804228320a9c6d

zosci caught a legit failure unfortunately on groovy-victoria: at the end of the test, the 3 juju nodes are considered online in the cluster but corosync sees a mysterious offline node named `node1`. Investigating.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-05 09:26:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32:

On a new unit we usually wait ~2 minutes for `crm node list` to show our hostname. The juju logs show that it unfortunately didn't happen in time: when we gave up `crm node list` was showing `node1` instead of our hostname. pacemaker.log shows that it took it 37 more seconds to mark node1 as down and our hostname as up. This then led to the charm taking other actions too early. Juju log:

2021-03-05 00:00:01 ERROR juju-log Pacemaker is down. Please manually start it. Pacemaker or Corosync are still down after waiting for 12 retries. Last output: node1(1): member

Note that this error message is somewhat misleading: pacemaker and corosync aren't down, they are just not showing the expected node.

Two things to do here IMHO: 1. increasing the timeout with an inline explanation, and 2. improving these log messages.

Working on it."}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-05 13:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-05 13:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:50:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Workflow-1

cases and brings the charm in a wrong state at
deployment.

commit_message:
Adjust quorum after node removal

Add an `update-ring` action for that purpose.
Also print more on various pacemaker failures.
Also removed some dead code.

Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/369
Change-Id: I35c0c9ce67fd459b9c3099346705d43d76bbdfe4
Closes-Bug: #1400481
Related-Bug: #1874719
Co-Authored-By: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Reyes <felipe.reyes@canonical.com>

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/cinder on branch master.  The error was:

  Configuration item has more than one key.  Each zuul.yaml
  configuration file must be a list of dictionaries with a
  single key, for example:
  
  - job:
      name: foo
  
  - project:
      name: bar
  
  Ensure that every item in the list is a dictionary with only
  one key (in this example, 'job' and 'project').  This error
  may be caused by insufficient indentation of the keys under
  the configuration item ('name' in this example).
  
  The incorrect values are around:
  
  job: null
  name: tempest-integrated-storage-rbac
  irrelevant-files:
  - ^(test-|)requirements.txt$

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 14:33:03.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Configure tempest-integrated-storage to use new policy defaults

This commit sets up the temepst-integrated-storage job to use the new
default policies implementing project-member and project-reader
personas.

This isn't going to execute exhaustive authorization testing or negative
testing for RBAC policies, but we can at least use it as a guide in
dianosing integration issues if any pop up (e.g., service-to-service
API calls, persona usage in tests, etc.)

We can continue to pursue full protection testing in
cinder_tempest_plugin to increase confidence in each policy change and
how it interacters with each persona, but this is something we can do in
parallel.

Change-Id: I68cf2b2c52bb2614e2053207f82055bdfafd92d0

commit_message:
DNM: Configure tempest-integrated-storage to use new policy defaults

This commit sets up the temepst-integrated-storage job to use the new
default policies implementing project-member and project-reader
personas.

This isn't going to execute exhaustive authorization testing or negative
testing for RBAC policies, but we can at least use it as a guide in
dianosing integration issues if any pop up (e.g., service-to-service
API calls, persona usage in tests, etc.)

We can continue to pursue full protection testing in
cinder_tempest_plugin to increase confidence in each policy change and
how it interacters with each persona, but this is something we can do in
parallel.

Change-Id: I68cf2b2c52bb2614e2053207f82055bdfafd92d0

commit_message:
docs: Document UEFI secure boot feature

Introduce two new guides on UEFI and Secure Boot. In addition, update
the flavors guide to document the secure boot feature (though this doc
should really be removed in near term in favour of the auto-generated
docs, as noted inline).

Note that this change includes our first use of the ':nova:extra-spec:'
cross-reference role and highlights a small bug in that implementation.
This is resolved.

Blueprint: allow-secure-boot-for-qemu-kvm-guests
Change-Id: I4eb370b87ba8d0403c8c0ef038a909313a48d1d6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace "ip route" command in "dvr_local_router"

This is a leftover of the "ip route" command migration to Pyroute2.

A new paremeter, "proto", is added to the IP route add and list
commands. The default protocol used is "static".

Story: #2007686
Task: #41284
Related-Bug: #1492714

Change-Id: I319fd0611d3e8a3a09d6d4e077a17a622f74f51c

commit_message:
libvirt: Wire up 'os_secure_boot' property

The penultimate step in our journey from the secure boot wilderness.
Start configuring the relevant attribute of the guest if and when secure
boot is enabled.

Blueprint: allow-secure-boot-for-qemu-kvm-guests
Change-Id: Ic38ab840f59619bf921e5387cd7a11c88a77b2a5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

This module supports either a tripleo-ansible-inventory or a deployed metalsmith file as input. Here's an example of using the inventory:

 http://paste.openstack.org/show/803300/

Given the above output we should be able to ship without providing an spec files.

 https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/tree/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/files"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-06 21:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 15:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 15:19:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

With this change, if you use the inventory as the source, then it is no longer necessary to use the tripleo roles_data.yaml file. This makes it very easy to call this new module DURING overcloud deployment as seen in the updated roles/tripleo_run_cephadm/tasks/prepare.yml.

Next I'm going to add a molecule test to tripleo_run_cephadm and delete tripleo_run_cephadm/files/."}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 16:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 18:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 18:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 19:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 19:41:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

Molecule testing should now be done. Let's test it from THT.

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/777767/22..23/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/molecule/default/verify.yml"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 19:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 20:37:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 20:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

(1 comment)

The spec generated by this change works in my multinode environment. I just had to not use the FQDN. Prior to PS25 I was getting this error.

'ERROR: hostname \"oc0-controller-0\" does not match expected hostname \"oc0-controller-0.mydomain.tld\"']"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

I saw that [1] Francesco had standalone.localdomain in the standalone spec [1]. If that's really necessary for standalone, then we can make fqdn a boolean option to the module. For now it's just a possible option on the two relevant functions (so it will be easy to add back if we need both options). 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/files/ceph_spec.yaml'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-07 21:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

Testing via THT with https://review.opendev.org/779112'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-08 12:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-08 15:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

My tht patch [1] is testing the new ceph_spec_bootstrap module [2].
Scenario001 failed, though it shows that a spec was created [3] by the module.
It failed [4] with:

  'ERROR: hostname \"standalone.localdomain\" does not match expected hostname \"standalone\"'

So the spec [3] didn't have the FQDN though standalone's hostname was set to it.
I saw the reverse of this in my non-standalone multinode environment:

  'ERROR: hostname \"oc0-controller-0\" does not match expected hostname \"oc0-controller-0.mydomain.tld\"']"], "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []

The spec which produce the error abouve for multinode did have the FQDN though
the multinodes hostname was set to the short name. 

So I need to do the following:

- Add a fqdn boolean flag to [2] which defaults to false
- Add CephSpecFqdn to [1] which is passed to [2] and set it true for 001
- Add CephOsdSpec to [1] and pass it to [2] like this [5] for standalone

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/779112
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/777767
[3] https://8da3341fb8ce4629db4c-5136c092bce7ed70e7e87b6bbcdf5d00.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/779112/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/acc0eb7/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-sqfk1874/cephadm/ceph_spec.yaml
[4] https://8da3341fb8ce4629db4c-5136c092bce7ed70e7e87b6bbcdf5d00.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/779112/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/acc0eb7/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-sqfk1874/cephadm/cephadm_command.log

[5]
CephOsdSpec:
  data_devices:
    paths:
      - /dev/ceph_vg/ceph_lv_data'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-08 20:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-08 20:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-09 02:05:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-03-09 02:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29: Patch Set 28 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-09 10:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-26 16:09:47.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Introduce ceph_spec_bootstrap module

The ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module uses information
about the enabled services, roles, and deployed hosts to
determine what Ceph services should run on what hosts and
generate a valid Ceph spec file.

This allows the desired end state defined in TripleO to be
translated into an end state defined in Ceph orchestrator.
The intention is to use this module when bootstrapping Ceph.
It depends on the the mkspec library (777586).

Change-Id: I74cb373f1dc94f8a5ef12c0545cfbc0c49abd69b
'}, {'created': '2021-02-27 23:59:32.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Introduce ceph_spec_bootstrap module

The ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module uses information
about the enabled services, roles, and deployed hosts to
determine what Ceph services should run on what hosts and
generate a valid Ceph spec file.

This allows the desired end state defined in TripleO to be
translated into an end state defined in Ceph orchestrator.
The intention is to use this module when bootstrapping Ceph.
It depends on the the mkspec library (777586).

Change-Id: I74cb373f1dc94f8a5ef12c0545cfbc0c49abd69b
'}, {'created': '2021-02-28 16:16:06.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Introduce ceph_spec_bootstrap module

The ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module uses information
about the enabled services, roles, and deployed hosts to
determine what Ceph services should run on what hosts and
generate a valid Ceph spec file.

This allows the desired end state defined in TripleO to be
translated into an end state defined in Ceph orchestrator.

'}, {'created': '2021-02-28 18:24:30.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Introduce ceph_spec_bootstrap module

'}, {'created': '2021-03-07 19:49:08.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce ceph_spec_bootstrap module

The ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module uses information
about the enabled services, roles, and deployed hosts to
determine what Ceph services should run on what hosts and
generate a valid Ceph spec file.

This allows the desired end state defined in TripleO to be
translated into an end state defined in Ceph orchestrator.
The intention is to use this module when bootstrapping Ceph.

This change removes files/ceph_spec.yaml, which is a spec
file for TripleO standalone deployments in THT scenario001.
This file will now be created dynamically by the new module.

Also, fix linter issues in playbooks/cephadm.yml.

commit_message:
Introduce ceph_spec_bootstrap module

The ceph_spec_bootstrap Ansible module uses information
about the enabled services, roles, and deployed hosts to
determine what Ceph services should run on what hosts and
generate a valid Ceph spec file.

This allows the desired end state defined in TripleO to be
translated into an end state defined in Ceph orchestrator.
The intention is to use this module when bootstrapping Ceph.

This change removes files/ceph_spec.yaml, which is a spec
file for TripleO standalone deployments in THT scenario001.
This file will now be created dynamically by the new module.

Also, fix spelling error in ceph-admin-user-playbook.yml.

Change-Id: I74cb373f1dc94f8a5ef12c0545cfbc0c49abd69b

commit_message:
Prevent multinodes running on changes to standalone featureset

As part of [1] this adds the standalone featuresets 052/056/062
(standalone/upgrade/scen10), to the multinode_ignored. This will
prevent the unnecessary situation seen in [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce
[2] https://i.imgur.com/O8lhcOW.png

Change-Id: I8c28353f9c199800826adacaef1653a0d867025d

commit_message:
tests: Remove duplicated 'start_compute' helper

This had a TODO to move it into the base class. This actually happened
in change I79a16a0a62c6060cd3062174ce68fd8cbde9f3fc which means we can
now drop this duplicated efforts.

Change-Id: I553e96b9a90cf29b54ce276476d64900356e70b8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Report secure boot support to scheduler

The final step. We now start reporting this trait to the scheduler,
allowing instances requesting secure boot to be scheduled here.

Blueprint: allow-secure-boot-for-qemu-kvm-guests
Change-Id: I171d47d72ebc81d1c905eb9130378dfef9a55ce5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for system-scoped tokens

Since Ussuri, nova can be configured with new policy
defaults. These defaults enforce the need to use system-scoped
tokens for admin operations like listing hypervisors.
The new os_system_scope configuration allows masakari to
request a system-scoped token using keystoneauth1 to query nova.

Implements: blueprint support-nova-system-scope-policies
Change-Id: I5f5b3f05358c28d60cfd05bc62a388f9087d75ac

The merge_configs action plugin is updated with an option to control
whether whitespace should be used around equal signs. The default

This is to avoid issues with the zkCleanup.sh script which expects no

commit_message:
Remove whitespace around equal signs in zookeeper.cfg

The merge_configs action plugin is updated with an option to control
whether whitespace should be used around equal signs. The default
remains to use whitespace: only zookeeper.cfg doesn't use them.

This is to avoid issues with the zkCleanup.sh script which expects no
whitespace. The ZooKeeper documentation also uses no whitespace in
configuration file examples.

Change-Id: Ia082a1c002cc4e8b04f7696fdee827b747c6d13f
Closes-Bug: #1917490
(cherry picked from commit 2b723ead051b7f722ad61db1bb65a07259817719)

commit_message:
Do not use ironic::config::ironic_config

This change replaces the usage of ironic_config with the specific
puppet-ironic parameter we are implementing.
This change should be merged first before we merge the implementation
in puppet-ironic because this is blocking CI of puppet-ironic with
the parameter implementation.

Change-Id: I2e641ef961719ec30a59d7c51985fbec33fd259b
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/766100/

commit_message:
Add ports filtering support to Dell EMC XtremIO driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Change-Id: I2a521118598de336148a56c1d5352107ece80721
Closes-Bug: #1915800

commit_message:
Ensure we have the needed facts before using them

Also prevent loading every single facts in order to avoid long delays.
Loading only "distribution" seems to make it fast enough to be unseen.

Change-Id: I1d4cb94685b06c8d670b54ec61decd19cfe5a165

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-13 03:19:49.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

This code has been removed from master after plan removal.

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85
(cherry picked from commit 6575dd1caf82b3ffcd24b7f4f4fecd70c512c01d)
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

This code has been removed from master after plan removal.

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85
(cherry picked from commit 6575dd1caf82b3ffcd24b7f4f4fecd70c512c01d)

commit_message:
Add anti-affinity-policy config option

This new option allows an operator decide if anti-affinity is set to
hint Nova of where to schedule the load balancers when the topology is
ACTIVE_STANDBY.

By default anti-affinity-policy is set to 'auto' which will set the
policy to soft-anti-affinity when the topology is set to ACTIVE_STANDBY
otherwise enable_anti_affinity is set to False.

Change-Id: I593a2784f12eb8abee2ec48aede27bdc745e5ede
Closes-Bug: #1813263

commit_message:
Change paths for bootloader files in iso element

This PR updates locations for files used by the bootloader depending on
the target operating system built. The current logic does not take into
account latest versions of operating systems and makes it impossible to
build ISOs against those.

With this change it is possible to correctly build CentOS 8, Ubuntu
18.04 and Ubuntu 20.04 images.

Closes-Bug: #1916913
Change-Id: I3ed0041640f539e82805d03ba26fe46217f3ac3c

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Install tempest by packages

Now Ubuntu provides packages for tempest and its plugins, thus we don't
need to install it from source.

Change-Id: I46ac94b274f502a579dcbe0df3e563c02630a364
(cherry picked from commit cc72f2d8312521ff1b2f8fbd6257a18a46a3e0bb)

commit_message:
Fix the conflict status with hacking.

The conflict is caused by:
    The user requested flake8 3.8.3 (from /home/zuul/.cache/pre-commit/repozi7hytk7)
    hacking 3.0.1 depends on flake8<3.8.0 and >=3.6.0

Install the latest version of hacking to fix the conflict error with the
pre-commit hook.

Change-Id: If1c54502e6e10751fd722694aa5429a08f376798

Add new relation in README

There was a new relation introduced in the 4.1 release.

All the Trilio charm READMEs will need to be updated for
MySQL8 soon.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-21 09:40:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix response of versions "v1/" show API

If you request to show details of versions "v1/" API it returns 404
ResourceNotFound.

This patch fixes this issue by updating the v1 version correctly
as "v1.0" in versions controller which helps wsgi layer to find
the resource(controller) correctly. This way it returns the details
of version "v1" correctly instead of ResourceNotFound.

v1 show API response:

{"version": {"status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2016-07-01T11:33:21Z",
"links": [{"href": "http://<host-ip>:15868/v1/", "rel": "self"},
{"href": "http://docs.openstack.org/", "type": "text/html",
"rel": "describedby"}], "min_version": "1.0", "version": "1.0",
"media-types": [{"base": "application/json",
"type": "application/vnd.openstack.masakari+json;version=1"}],
"id": "v1.0"}}

APIImpact: versions "v1/" show API will return 200 OK now instead
of 404 ResourceNotFound.
Closes-Bug: #1685145
Change-Id: If3943060b5d09bd153b6401d34c7d10d3dc864fe

commit_message:
Fix response of microversions API

If you request to show details of versions "v1/" API it returns 404
ResourceNotFound.

This patch fixes this issue by updating the v1 version correctly
as "v1.0" in versions controller which helps wsgi layer to find
the resource(controller) correctly. This way it returns the details
of version "v1" correctly instead of ResourceNotFound.

v1 show API response:

{"version": {"status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2016-07-01T11:33:21Z",
"links": [{"href": "http://<host-ip>:15868/v1/", "rel": "self"},
{"href": "http://docs.openstack.org/", "type": "text/html",
"rel": "describedby"}], "min_version": "1.0", "version": "1.0",
"media-types": [{"base": "application/json",
"type": "application/vnd.openstack.masakari+json;version=1"}],
"id": "v1.0"}}

This patch fixes the reported supported microversion as well
to avoid clients failing due to requesting too new version
(LP#1882516). It has to be fixed to pass tests.

APIImpact - versions "v1/" show API will return 200 OK now instead
of 404 ResourceNotFound.

Closes-Bug: #1685145
Closes-Bug: #1882516
Co-Authored-By: Jegor van Opdorp <jegor@leaf.cloud>
Co-Authored-By: suzhengwei <sugar-2008@163.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rados≈Çaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If3943060b5d09bd153b6401d34c7d10d3dc864fe

commit_message:
Use 'ip addr replace' in OVN code

Instead of doing a flush/add, use replace like the ML2/OVS
code does. Should have the same behavior of not failing if
the address is already present.

Change-Id: If9d8a848b079ccb8c0c9b8e6fb708107aa0d46c7

commit_message:
Update the python search path for extra qdrouter modules

The latest release of qdrouterd on focal has changed where the
internal python modules are installed.  This patch updates the tox
tests python path configuration.

Change-Id: Icb53ee17af01580d899f388f69be9560e23675e0

subject: Add doc/requirements
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-07 09:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-07 09:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-03 04:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-03-11 05:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-03-16 06:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 09:42:37.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: If98d562d8f52ff6ce3739eaea17b5007be243a8f
"}, {'created': '2021-01-07 09:43:57.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: If98d562d8f52ff6ce3739eaea17b5007be243a8f
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: If98d562d8f52ff6ce3739eaea17b5007be243a8f

commit_message:
Use first IP address for interface

It is possible than an interface has multiple IP addresses, for
simplicity of this change, use the first one so that the service
can start.

We can look later into improving it to accept some sort of index
for the IP address.

Change-Id: Ie856f54331d689a51bfd6de45db5820b765797ef

commit_message:
Add legacy fact setting

When we disable inject facts by default, there were some additional
roles that we missed (ipaclient).  We can just set the legacy facts to
prevent issues with missing distribution var updates.

Change-Id: Ib488a6573c035fc8288a4b24461af56d40416c5d
Related-Bug: #1919064

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-08 13:42:17.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)
(cherry picked from commit a2a6ddab59e60ba977ac85b9881530ae3b5bb0c7)
(cherry picked from commit ace7eb7d6f10c534858051abaf33b24137fd5669)

commit_message:
Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-base-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-conductor-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-vnc-proxy-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/774415
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)
(cherry picked from commit a2a6ddab59e60ba977ac85b9881530ae3b5bb0c7)

commit_message:
Stop including nova::metadata on computes

I5da1e67684f8317eec8c499c3534977e00a63098 include nova::metadata on computes
however this includes nova::db which we must not do on computes.
Push the fix up to puppet-nova and nova.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/774478
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/774476
Related-bug: #1871482
Related-bug: #1903908
Related-bug: #1832537

[{'created': '2021-03-02 19:11:42.000000000', 'message': 'New test case: test_list_all_projects_recordsets

Create two recordsets using 2 different clients.
Retrieve a list of recordsets for all projects and make sure that
received recordsets are associated with two projects only.

Change-Id: If7e7cd20ad50e94195ae12a75a2186ceb4b38425
'}, {'created': '2021-03-03 20:45:20.000000000', 'message': 'Test cases: "Lists all recordsets owned by a project in Designate"

1) test_list_all_recordsets_for_project
   "x-auth-token" - Token used to identify the user from keystone
2) test_list_all_projects_recordsets.
   "x-auth-all-projects" - If enabled this will show results from
   all projects in Designate.
3) test_user_to_impersonate_another_project
   "x-auth-sudo-project-id" - This allows a user to impersonate
    another project.

Change-Id: If7e7cd20ad50e94195ae12a75a2186ceb4b38425

commit_message:
Testing "Lists all recordsets owned by a project in Designate" API

1) test_list_all_recordsets_for_project
   "x-auth-token" - Token used to identify the user from keystone
2) test_list_all_projects_recordsets.
   "x-auth-all-projects" - If enabled this will show results from
   all projects in Designate.
3) test_list_recordsets_impersonate_project
   "x-auth-sudo-project-id" - This allows a user to impersonate
    another project.

Change-Id: If7e7cd20ad50e94195ae12a75a2186ceb4b38425

[{'created': '2021-03-10 22:48:04.000000000', 'message': 'Pin a few Java configuration values to 8-13

The newer versions of ElasticSearch use Java 15 which has dropped
some of those options, we can keep backwards compatibility by
pinning to certain versions[1].

[1]: https://discuss.elastic.co/t/elasticsearch-wont-start-after-7-9-1-to-7-9-2-upgrade/249878/2

Change-Id: Iaa29bc202d9eb9c5eda3040b38596f0524a0c453
'}]
commit_message:
Pin a few Java configuration values to 8-13

The newer versions of ElasticSearch use Java 15 which has dropped
some of those options, we can keep backwards compatibility by
pinning to certain versions[1].

[1]: https://discuss.elastic.co/t/elasticsearch-wont-start-after-7-9-1-to-7-9-2-upgrade/249878/2

Change-Id: Iaa29bc202d9eb9c5eda3040b38596f0524a0c453

commit_message:
Switch iLO and iRMC to the new secure boot framework

No longer explicit handle secure boot in PXE/iPXE derivatives since it's
now handled there.

Change-Id: I13b1d53578285b7171bfadb53bb2a7f69e7b53e3
Story: #2008270
Task: #41567

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-15 09:52:22.000000000', 'message': 'Handle race-condition with device-mapper

When using lvm, it is possible that mkfs is run before the newly
created logical volume is showing up in /dev/mapper.

We handle this by sleeping up to a minute, if the device is missing.

Fixes-bug: #1919140
Change-Id: I06114b75b808feea5a63aeb10b07907219254f7b
'}]
commit_message:
Handle race-condition with device-mapper

When using lvm, it is possible that mkfs is run before the newly
created logical volume is showing up in /dev/mapper.

We handle this by sleeping up to a minute, if the device is missing.

Fixes-bug: #1919140
Change-Id: I06114b75b808feea5a63aeb10b07907219254f7b

commit_message:
Deprecate the install_cinder_client parameter

Nowadays the python-cinderclient package is supposed to be installed
automatically when nova packages are installed because of package
dependencies, thus we don't need to install it explicitly.

Change-Id: Ic3b764ede243923be631a97da95ba9f2f2f6111b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-28 00:26:25.000000000', 'message': "WIP: s3api: Allow CORS preflight requests

Unfortunately, we can't identify the user, so we can't map to an
account, so we can't respect whatever CORS metadata might be set on the
container.

Change-Id: I985143bf03125a05792e79bc5e5f83722d6431b3
"}, {'created': '2020-02-28 06:02:26.000000000', 'message': "WIP: s3api: Allow CORS preflight requests

Unfortunately, we can't identify the user, so we can't map to an
account, so we can't respect whatever CORS metadata might be set on the
container.

As a result, the allowed origins must be configured cluster-wide. Add a
new config option, cors_preflight_allow_origin, for that; default it to
blank (ie, deny preflights from all origins), but allow things like *.

TODO:
  * Handle multiple origins more like we do in the proxy base
    controller, so we don't leak information about what other origins
    are allowed.
  * Use something better than * for allow-headers.
  * Tests.

Change-Id: I985143bf03125a05792e79bc5e5f83722d6431b3
"}, {'created': '2020-02-28 18:18:02.000000000', 'message': "WIP: s3api: Allow CORS preflight requests

Unfortunately, we can't identify the user, so we can't map to an
account, so we can't respect whatever CORS metadata might be set on the
container.

As a result, the allowed origins must be configured cluster-wide. Add a
new config option, cors_preflight_allow_origin, for that; default it to
blank (ie, deny preflights from all origins), but allow either a
comma-separated list of origins or * (to allow all origins).

TODO: Add tests

commit_message:
s3api: Allow CORS preflight requests

Unfortunately, we can't identify the user, so we can't map to an
account, so we can't respect whatever CORS metadata might be set on the
container.

As a result, the allowed origins must be configured cluster-wide. Add a
new config option, cors_preflight_allow_origin, for that; default it
to blank (ie, deny preflights from all origins, preserving existing
behavior), but allow either a comma-separated list of origins or
* (to allow all origins).

Change-Id: I985143bf03125a05792e79bc5e5f83722d6431b3
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

commit_message:
Do not reset tempest version in CI

In CI jobs we fetch the specific version of tempest and use the files
cloned already, so we don't need to reset its version explicitly.

Change-Id: I0bae1f8e304e7f879fa3975f69067ff3864fd4ba
(cherry picked from commit 3ac64d4f459481cfffbc408f4ff516eeebeef70e)

commit_message:
parameter was covering covering `type` built in

Simple renaming of the parameter in order to avoid confusion
with a rather commonly used built-in `type`.

New name has added benefit of being slightly more precise.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ide35634a4a3b8fa29a677d096f66b172fa1fc9f3

commit_message:
Fix get_microversion to respect SSL settings

Rewrite get_microversion to use cinderclient and
api_versions._get_server_version_range. That allow it takes
OPENSTACK_SSL_* settings into account.
Also simplifying client construction to reuse auth utils.

Change-Id: I77caa8b2ff1dfafe3c13570249ead53d119e8e6a
Closes-Bug: #1815635

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-13 03:18:41.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

This code has been removed from master after plan removal.

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85
(cherry picked from commit fdb49b002b317a52f79347a568173f8a54c511bb)
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

This code has been removed from master after plan removal.

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85
(cherry picked from commit fdb49b002b317a52f79347a568173f8a54c511bb)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I46bb467824a448a3ee67bd371b3a0750ae3533eb

(2 comments)

Code looks good.  Some comments about the tests noted inline.

Please add a release note.  You don't have to go into too much detail, just something about for NFS based backends, cinder now stores the format of the backing file (raw or qcow2) in the volume admin metadata and includes the format in the connection_info returned in the Attachments API.  Previously cinder tried to introspect the format, and under some circumstances, an incorrect format would be deduced.  Explicitly storing the format will avoid this issue.  (Maybe include a link to the spec.)"}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-03-05 21:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-03-05 21:44:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Code looks good.  Some comments about the tests noted inline.
> 
> Please add a release note.  You don't have to go into too much detail, just something about for 
NFS based backends, cinder now stores the format of the backing file (raw or qcow2) in the volume admin metadata and includes the format in the connection_info returned in the Attachments API.  Previously cinder tried to introspect the format, and under some circumstances, an incorrect format would be deduced.  Explicitly storing the format will avoid this issue.  (Maybe include a link to the spec.)
Done

Thanks Brian for the review. I've added tests for operations with format and without format."}, {'account_id': 32418, 'date': '2021-03-05 21:52:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Support format info in fs type drivers

This feature adds format info in filesystem type
drivers with the following changes:
1) Store format info in admin_metadata while creating/cloning
volumes
2) Use format info while extending volumes
3) Modify volume format when performing snapshot delete
(blockRebase) operation on attached volume.
4) Return format in connection_info

blueprint add-support-store-volume-format-info

Change-Id: I43036837274a7c8dba612db53b34a6ce2cfb2f07

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Install neutron-tempest-plugin from source

It seems the current latest version of neutron-tempest-plugin available
in pip is not compatible with the latest tempest. Let's install it
from source so that we can always install the version compatible with
tempest.

Note:
Added version pin for stable backports.

Change-Id: I57f84757a229feb4e7d94ec912d723bf02392c88
(cherry picked from commit 7b8b11a8cfe98e6b2f08c3edc6b9b9222edeb937)

commit_message:
Do not reset tempest version in CI

In CI jobs we fetch the specific version of tempest and use the files
cloned already, so we don't need to reset its version explicitly.

Change-Id: I0bae1f8e304e7f879fa3975f69067ff3864fd4ba

commit_message:
libvirt: Add guest generation for vDPA

Add the ability to generate the libvirt interface XML for a neutron port
with a vnic_type of vdpa.

Blueprint: libvirt-vdpa-support
Change-Id: I2c7b183fcb01f3cb67cb1c8b8bea7aaf5ce424f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 08:17:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add monitor interval for ovn dbs

Add parameter for configuring the ovn dbs monitor interval. Under load,
this can create extra stress and since the timeout has already been
bumped. It makes sense to bump this interval to a higher value as a
trade off between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Change-Id: I0572f02f1bb8e099ce7647bc2f2f9b095a9c390c
(cherry picked from commit 61c61c89ed6e9c7d8502a17e681b6648c9930c6e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add monitor interval for ovn dbs

Add parameter for configuring the ovn dbs monitor interval. Under load,
this can create extra stress and since the timeout has already been
bumped. It makes sense to bump this interval to a higher value as a
trade off between detecting a failure and stressing the service.

Change-Id: I0572f02f1bb8e099ce7647bc2f2f9b095a9c390c
(cherry picked from commit 61c61c89ed6e9c7d8502a17e681b6648c9930c6e)

commit_message:
WIP: Create config-download developer documentation.

This explains how and where TripleO developers can contribute
to config-download as part of using Ansible for the deployment.

Change-Id: If71e34fc8edd2475a4b314ba0ad6d2ba0aa80028

Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2021-02-22 11:44:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add parameter NovaSchedulerQueryPlacementForRoutedNetworkAggregates

Add parameter NovaSchedulerQueryPlacementForRoutedNetworkAggregates
that allows the scheduler to look at the nova aggregates related
to requested routed network segments.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/776922
Change-Id: I7a2f8154f1f02ce8f57d370ff1baecf79f5300b2
'}]
commit_message:
Add parameter NovaSchedulerQueryPlacementForRoutedNetworkAggregates

Add parameter NovaSchedulerQueryPlacementForRoutedNetworkAggregates
that allows the scheduler to look at the nova aggregates related
to requested routed network segments.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/776922
Change-Id: I7a2f8154f1f02ce8f57d370ff1baecf79f5300b2

[{'created': '2021-02-09 02:21:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update tripleo launch heat for HeatPodLauncher

Updates the "openstack tripleo launch heat" command to support launching
ephemeral Heat with any of the now supported options: native, container,
or pod. The command also can be used to start the Heat process and reuse
an existing environment with --heat-dir.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update tripleo launch heat for HeatPodLauncher

Updates the "openstack tripleo launch heat" command to support launching
ephemeral Heat with any of the now supported options: native, container,
or pod. The command also can be used to start the Heat process and reuse
an existing environment with --heat-dir.

Change-Id: Ie665bc518751343fd4824f10c6efa6b5ca1c991d
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove tempest container support from tht

Since tempest container is no longer tested in CI and is
replaced with os_tempest ansible-role.

An user can use and install tempest from rpm which is
supported as earlier.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/776654

Related-Bug: #1916875

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifefebdffe0c27b8e1e88a41a6deeb3792c3194f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 09:31:42.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure tripleo ansible inventory file update is atomic

Multiple python-tripleoclient commands can run concurrently
and all attempt to update the same inventory file in
~/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml. Make the update atomic to
ensure the inventory file is always complete/valid.

(cherry picked from commit 8e082f45ddfb8f29bd02feb1c9fd1ace4e9ec6dd)

(squashing commits as the 1st patch is failing in the stein gate without
the fix from the 2nd patch)

Ensure atomic inventory file rename runs on the same mountpoint

Linux rename system call is only supported on the same mountpoint [1].
/tmp is often a tmpfs mount, so instead generate the temp inventory file in
the same directory as the target inventory file.

[1] See EXDEV in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/rename.2.html

Closes-bug: #1892008
(cherry picked from commit 662b0acd91266d28bf3b0b7a4c68ba919182c56a)

Change-Id: Ifa41bfcb921496978f82aee4e67fdb419cf9ffc5
(cherry picked from commit c1af9b7ad94ee46dc280cfeb6e1b0678e70773aa)

commit_message:
Ensure tripleo ansible inventory file update is atomic

Multiple python-tripleoclient commands can run concurrently
and all attempt to update the same inventory file in
~/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml. Make the update atomic to
ensure the inventory file is always complete/valid.

(cherry picked from commit 8e082f45ddfb8f29bd02feb1c9fd1ace4e9ec6dd)

(squashing commits as the 1st patch is failing in the stein gate without
the fix from the 2nd patch)

Ensure atomic inventory file rename runs on the same mountpoint

Linux rename system call is only supported on the same mountpoint [1].
/tmp is often a tmpfs mount, so instead generate the temp inventory file in
the same directory as the target inventory file.

[1] See EXDEV in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/rename.2.html

Closes-bug: #1892008

Change-Id: Ifa41bfcb921496978f82aee4e67fdb419cf9ffc5
(cherry picked from commit c1af9b7ad94ee46dc280cfeb6e1b0678e70773aa)

[{'created': '2021-03-11 03:18:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

(cherry picked from commit 6575dd1caf82b3ffcd24b7f4f4fecd70c512c01d)

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),

been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85
(cherry picked from commit 6575dd1caf82b3ffcd24b7f4f4fecd70c512c01d)

commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

This code has been removed from master after plan removal.

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85
(cherry picked from commit 6575dd1caf82b3ffcd24b7f4f4fecd70c512c01d)

commit_message:
Fix avoid deprecation warnings from policy

We received huge amount of warnings during service start.
Most about stop using `deprecated_reason` and `deprecated_since` by
`policy.DocumentedRuleDefault` directly. And should use them under
`policy.DeprecatedRule instead.

This patch apply for above suggestion.
Also bump oslo.policy lower-constraints and requirements to `3.7.0` to alias
policy behavior.

Story: 2008707
Task: 42041

Change-Id: Iefcfc30a051fe25ccc5121c7ddb817e8c271fcb6

commit_message:
WIP: Support multiple snapshot repositories

This change updates the helm-toolkit and elasticsearch charts,
to support the ability to

- specify parameters to the bucket creation command (eg placement target)
- register snapshot repositories in multiple locations

Change-Id: I667231d164717b75724aa2e90c49fb79d98a73cd

commit_message:
Fix port id vs uuid in ValidateInterfacesHook

follow-up to Icd3de82877c6a53d32b4c9fd3e500d3cd9d7fb17

Use id attribute instead of uuid. This caused an exception when an unexpected
port was being deleted.

Story: 2008698
Task: 42007
Change-Id: Ib4978f5e3e4f1b64faa1bfae3cdcf46199bb2f21

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 15:20:39.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-manilaclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-manilaclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, March 11.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.4.0..4f5d596
b5b8bdb Add "--wait" option for force-deleting a share/snapshot/share-instance
9bc7cec Change public share tests
c225f0a [OSC] Implement user messages commands
ca65447 tox miniversion update to 3.1.1
a34aca6 Add profiling support to manilaclient
fc5b6c5 Forbid users to create shares with the name "None"
17e5d63 [OSC] Implement Share Revert Command
c7bcec2 Implement openstack share properties show command
f1abf30 [OSC] Add the option to explicitly set share status
08fb635 Tighten asserts in some wait tests
153aa61 Add a waiter to share extend/shrink
3c65e6f [OSC] Implement Share Export Location Commands
d832baa [OSC] Implement the second part of share snapshots commands
bf3e7cb [OSC] Implement Share Adopt & Abandon Commands
b77a8c1 Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable
07898fa Fixes create share from snapshot in OSC

Signed-off-by: Herv√© Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I55b40d00a58128a652560aba86d0be5712712ad9

commit_message:
Release final python-manilaclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-manilaclient to
get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into
effect.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.4.0..8d71f1e
1bb3287 Correctly pass mTLS certificate/key to HTTPClient
b5b8bdb Add "--wait" option for force-deleting a share/snapshot/share-instance
9bc7cec Change public share tests
c225f0a [OSC] Implement user messages commands
ca65447 tox miniversion update to 3.1.1
a34aca6 Add profiling support to manilaclient
fc5b6c5 Forbid users to create shares with the name "None"
17e5d63 [OSC] Implement Share Revert Command
c7bcec2 Implement openstack share properties show command
f1abf30 [OSC] Add the option to explicitly set share status
08fb635 Tighten asserts in some wait tests
153aa61 Add a waiter to share extend/shrink
3c65e6f [OSC] Implement Share Export Location Commands
d832baa [OSC] Implement the second part of share snapshots commands
6b1a2f3 remove unicode from code
bf3e7cb [OSC] Implement Share Adopt & Abandon Commands
b77a8c1 Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable
07898fa Fixes create share from snapshot in OSC

Signed-off-by: Herv√© Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I55b40d00a58128a652560aba86d0be5712712ad9
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Do not hardcode nova user/group in each manifests

... but refer to nova::params so that we can centralize definition of
nova user and group on host OS.

Change-Id: Ic9027ebbc79702d5405448bfbd5bc4cd869db3fd

commit_message:
Avoid empty dependencies in tox.ini

Specifying only constraints does not work, there must be some real deps.
Add documentation deps since the documented way to use reno is via
`tox -evenv -- reno`.

Change-Id: I68182adbac4eaadc2fbb2c70b27683c5589103bf

commit_message:
Use tinycore 12 to build tinyipa

Tinycore 12.x is out, let's use it to build tinyipa.

- Adapt packages installation lists.
- Use 5.10.3 instead of 5.4.3 in fakeuname to sync with the new kernel.
- Patch ipmitool to fix issue when compiling with gcc version 10.x or
higher.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/777342
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-python-agent/+/778658

Change-Id: I5a213d8409b1288af282dc3110e6e77c89317f31

commit_message:
Fix Ussuri builds due to RDO Virtualization GPG key

Stop importing the RDO virtualization GPG key in the base image. The
centos-release-openstack-ussuri package no longer includes this key.

Closes-Bug: #1919096

Change-Id: Ib3e48cc202ef4ee1e62dc93b33dc9a9b58ace865

commit_message:
Set load_balancer.provider default value to 'amphora'

The 'octavia' provider name is now deprecated in all our stable
branches. The octavia-tempest-plugin configuration can safely default to
'amphora'.

Change-Id: I6a9dbcc94d1f2d2e5261db0bec2fc67e329c1ebb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-27 20:11:21.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Allow egress ICMPv6 only for know addresses

Before that patch it was possible to send ICMPv6 packets like e.g.
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_MLD_QUERY,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_RS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NA

And that could cause some security issues as instance could advertise
that it owns IPv6 address which really don't belong to it.

Now rules in table=71 which allows that traffic are "per mac/ipaddress"
and are allowed only for fixed ips allocated to port and port's
allowed_address_pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1902917
Change-Id: I4749fdc6a6cabd253b971bf4010ff76f5593c59c
(cherry picked from commit 4b5bcff64c4725b37f094dfd2613ec58f723d304)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Allow egress ICMPv6 only for know addresses

Before that patch it was possible to send ICMPv6 packets like e.g.
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_MLD_QUERY,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_RS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NA

And that could cause some security issues as instance could advertise
that it owns IPv6 address which really don't belong to it.

Now rules in table=71 which allows that traffic are "per mac/ipaddress"
and are allowed only for fixed ips allocated to port and port's
allowed_address_pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1902917
Change-Id: I4749fdc6a6cabd253b971bf4010ff76f5593c59c
(cherry picked from commit 4b5bcff64c4725b37f094dfd2613ec58f723d304)

commit_message:
Add security service update support to the container driver

This implementation adds the functionality to add/update security services
to in use share networks using the container driver. The container driver will
also try to setup security services while creating share servers. Currently, the
only supported security service type is LDAP.

Co-Authored-By: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Partially Implements: bp add-security-service-in-use-share-networks
Depends-On: I129a794dfd2d179fa2b9a2fed050459d6f00b0de

Change-Id: Ifb8b9ebe6eb0661844c794ca1a32e35105652f72

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-28 16:01:03.000000000', 'message': 'sharder: only shrink to root if all ranges are involved

Tighten up conditions for shrinking shards to their root container so
that *all* shard ranges must be included in the single compactible
sequence. Previously shard ranges in states that were not eligible for
shrinking (such as CREATED) would not prevent other shards shrinking
to root.

Change-Id: I3da9b59f6744b10853d89b51ae15f05bdd51d02d
'}]
commit_message:
sharder: only shrink to root if all ranges are involved

Tighten up conditions for shrinking shards to their root container so
that *all* shard ranges must be included in the single compactible
sequence. Previously shard ranges in states that were not eligible for
shrinking (such as CREATED) would not prevent other shards shrinking
to root.

Change-Id: I3da9b59f6744b10853d89b51ae15f05bdd51d02d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 16:18:51.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the partial backport of
I902e459093af9b82f9033d58cffcb2a628f5ec39 in stable/queens.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/run_tests.sh

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5

'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the partial backport of
I902e459093af9b82f9033d58cffcb2a628f5ec39 in stable/queens.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/run_tests.sh

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
(cherry picked from commit ff570d1b4e9b9777405ae75cc09eae2ce255bf19)
(cherry picked from commit 436e8172f65193e177a4a12780f752dbc7e88b39)
(cherry picked from commit 238c83a2f778a9c2f0abbe318dda97b715926565)

commit_message:
Add config parameter for cinder mounting needs

This patch is introducing cinder_mount_point_base parameter into
glance::backend::multistore::cinder class, so that operators can
provide the cinder mount point for NFS volumes.

Change-Id: Ib724f6e895716847827be48ed08b01a7a312338f
(cherry picked from commit 46e9319d8e012d2df6b7d8f85f59315db6e95ff2)
(cherry picked from commit 11bd956b9b6ae6e09547bfe14ac02af4ade573ce)
(cherry picked from commit 1bd1615234f261e2df8cda04fd6581230b758e6b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-02 23:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix traceback in scheduler-stats API

There was a traceback being included in the
error message body. This is unhelpful to
end users.

The error message that included the traceback
was for this corner case where the RBAC policy
isn't aligned with the internal "context_is_admin"
policy - an unlikely combination of decisions
that a deployer would make - nevertheless,
this is an opportunity for us to fix this
code path.

Change-Id: I888d684acac2133425f986ec7cef5e4f5cdcc5b6
Closes-Bug: #1917520
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix traceback in scheduler-stats API

There was a traceback being included in the
error message body. This is unhelpful to
end users.

The error message that included the traceback
was for this corner case where the RBAC policy
isn't aligned with the internal "context_is_admin"
policy - an unlikely combination of decisions
that a deployer would make - nevertheless,
this is an opportunity for us to fix this
code path.

Change-Id: I888d684acac2133425f986ec7cef5e4f5cdcc5b6
Closes-Bug: #1917520
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> Has this ever supported mongodb? Also, please don't patch something directly on a stable branch without checking if you can backport something, or push it directly to a stable branch unless it's only related to that version

Takashi pointed me to  https://github.com/openstack/puppet-oslo/blob/master/manifests/db.pp#L159 which is now it's done in the releases after Ussuri. That is why I

a) pushed this directly to stable/ussuri
b) included MongoDB as a valid database driver just like the backported regex.
see: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-designate/+/779809/1/manifests/db.pp#58



Why is your suggestion to move this forward?"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-12 15:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
[Ussuri and before] Add support to specify PostgreSQL database

This change allows using PostgreSQL database as oslo.db backend.

Note:
This issue was already fixed in Victoria and later by the commit
b8d1841876f8a3fbfdaee9605f924cc4dd7e312f  . However this change requires
parameter deprecations, thus we implement this stable-only fix instead
of backporting the change.

Change-Id: I8be3f9e03042e13bf06debc7e79d4f38cac7a72b

commit_message:
Allow creating a Neutron port without fixed ips

Since Newton release, Neutron supports ports without fixed ips[1].
This change introduces a new no_fixed_ips property so that we can
create an unaddressed port from Heat.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/unaddressed-port.html

Story: 2008554
Task: 41685
Change-Id: I6f16905155038db44c7e01dd5d34d65032dca061

commit_message:
Update opesntack_ports to use ansible_facts

Turns out openstack_ports was a fact returned by os_port_facts so we
need to update that as well.

(1 comment)

Looks good! Just had 1 very minor nit.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-08-07 21:59:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(61 comments)

I like the general idea in terms of the base theme and what is attempting to be achieved and desired end state, however I'm very worried that the overall idea has kind of scope creeped far beyond an Minimum Viable Product that can be developed easily. In part as groundwork is being laid that is far beyond the MVP's scale and scope in terms of trying to synchronize base configuration fields contents and persistent data storage. Not to mention conflict handling beyond that. I'm just not sure that makes any sense in a specification document at this time.

The order in which it is being conveyed also is not super friendly to someone who has not read the current document already in its entirety. Having read it once in it's present form, I'm still a little confused about some of the details. It may be a mix of some of what feels like contradiction or constraints and also reiteration. Making some of the suggested ordering changes and removing excess statements will likely help.

I also have some major concerns. For now -1. I look forward to the revision, however my security concerns are functionally a -2 unless a path forward is reached given the variety of security constraints and risks."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-08-08 07:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

A rough review, but had a vague idea on what the spec is going to achieve. AIUI the spec is proposing a mechanism to profiling a vendor specific configuration and apply it to other machines, then use the cleaning process to quickly (but not obvious seen in the spec) do a machine configuration and make it ready for provisioning.
Anyway I think the spec needs an update for clarifying, rewording etc.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-08-09 10:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2020-08-11 07:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Thank you Aija.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-08-13 20:49:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2020-08-17 11:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

Thanks everyone for review comments. I'll respond to them gradually.

For starter, see one comment inline, and for addressing storage security questions would this be direction to go:

1) In Ironic DB there is a new table that stores configuration file metadata (not the files themselves). The metadata is: generated UUID, optional name provided by user to make it easier to distinguish configurations for human and also owner of the configuration file.
2) Add methods to Ironic API to work with these configuration files - List, Create, Update, Delete. Policies of these API methods control access to the files based on owner. Operators do not access the storage directly.
3) In addition, as these configuration files can contain sensitive information, they are stored encrypted at rest.

If this is not OK, can you suggest alternatives to fulfill the requirements. Is there something similar I can take a look?"}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2020-08-20 13:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2020-08-20 14:22:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:
