(1 comment)

Putting into writing feedback from review jam -- I think we should follow existing Ironic models for images with these configuration documents. That means for reads, taking the normal set of image urls (glance://, https://, etc), and for writes, and for writes, seeing how Ironic proposals for snapshots propose handling that, or looking at Nova for an example.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-02-18 06:45:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Putting into writing feedback from review jam -- I think we should follow existing Ironic models for images with these configuration documents. That means for reads, taking the normal set of image urls (glance://, https://, etc), and for writes, and for writes, seeing how Ironic proposals for snapshots propose handling that, or looking at Nova for an example.

Putting a community hat on, having been in these discussions, this really echos what we've wanted. Push the problem to the appropriate services and not try to mask all the mechanics and problems away inside of ironic. This is compounded by the standard cleaning path, but there are open proposals to allow the power actions to be delayed so the originating task can be used until the reboot is required. It looks relatively simple in the code base, but will require some time and someone's employer to prioritize that aspect, as that would remove proposed requirement to save the originator token."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2021-03-10 10:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2021-03-10 11:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

[{'created': '2021-03-10 20:46:16.000000000', 'message': 'Startup nl01.opendev.org idle

This removes min ready settings for labels on nl01.opendev.org to
prevent it from generating extra min ready requests. We also set
max-servers to 0 on its providers so that it essentailly idles.

This is done to ensure the new server can be deployed properly. A
followon change will flip nl01.openstack.org to idle and set min-ready
and max-servers values on nl01.opendev.org to put it into use.

The old server can be removed once it idles.

Change-Id: Icb13ce9153e3d627b187ec8722539f20db51e266
'}]
commit_message:
Startup nl01.opendev.org idle

This removes min ready settings for labels on nl01.opendev.org to
prevent it from generating extra min ready requests. We also set
max-servers to 0 on its providers so that it essentailly idles.

This is done to ensure the new server can be deployed properly. A
followon change will flip nl01.openstack.org to idle and set min-ready
and max-servers values on nl01.opendev.org to put it into use.

The old server can be removed once it idles.

Change-Id: Icb13ce9153e3d627b187ec8722539f20db51e266

This patch will fix broken support of session_persistence and
only add cookie_name when type is APP_COOKIE.

subject: Explicitly support 'requires_python'
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-15 12:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-03-15 15:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-03-15 15:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Per further discussion in IRC, we're unclear why it's complaining about finding the deprecated requires_python (which PBR should never write anyway) instead of python_requires."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-15 17:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/pbr/+/780633'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-15 12:21:08.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly support 'requires_python'

We maintain a list of 'setup.py' arguments that are supported by
setuptools and not distutils. 'python_requires' is one such option [1]
but it was not included in this list. Add it, silencing the following
warning we see in many projects since they dropped support for Python
2.x:

  UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'requires_python'

[1] https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires

Change-Id: I1637892d66ae9ca2829304a57842f84a03d29218
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly support 'requires_python'

We maintain a list of 'setup.py' arguments that are supported by
setuptools and not distutils. 'python_requires' is one such option [1]
but it was not included in this list. Add it, silencing the following
warning we see in many projects since they dropped support for Python
2.x:

  UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'requires_python'

[1] https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires

Change-Id: I1637892d66ae9ca2829304a57842f84a03d29218
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 20:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix functional.test_hosts.test_list

A recent OpenStack SDK change [1] has caused more attributes to be
present in listings.
The logic in the failing test required 1:1 mapping between two
values so it started failing.
I have learnt from the OpenStack SDK (and mordred in particular)
that the contract is to not cease to return attributes but
openstacksdk is free to add as many extra ones as they see fit.
Hence, this changes makes the test more reasonable by following
that contract.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/776205

Change-Id: Ife8b645c41cf681fa30564e75f7757f96c0bfe11
'}]
commit_message:
Fix functional.test_hosts.test_list

A recent OpenStack SDK change [1] has caused more attributes to be
present in listings.
The logic in the failing test required 1:1 mapping between two
values so it started failing.
I have learnt from the OpenStack SDK (and mordred in particular)
that the contract is to not cease to return attributes but
openstacksdk is free to add as many extra ones as they see fit.
Hence, this changes makes the test more reasonable by following
that contract.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/776205

Change-Id: Ife8b645c41cf681fa30564e75f7757f96c0bfe11

subject: Do not set COMPRESS_ENABLED explicitly
messages:
[{'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-02-06 13:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-02-07 07:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-02-07 12:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-02-07 12:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-02-08 06:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Kindly fix the failed unit test cases [1]

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/635159/3/check/openstack-tox-py27/e93a2cc/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-07_12_21_40_085038'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-09 05:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Could you explain why it is not a good idea to set COMPRESS_ENABLED explicitly in test/settings.py?
Any horizon plugin can set COMPRESS_ENABLED explicitly even if horizon.test.settings sets COMPRESS_ENABLED explicility.
In addition, horizon.test.settings is mainly for horizon tests, and I think It makes sense to have COMPRESS_ENABLED settings in horizon.test.settings.

As a summary, I cannot understand what is a problem to have an explicit COMPRESS_ENABLED in horizon.test.settings.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-02-11 09:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Could you please be kind and explain me why is horizon testing compression ?

I could not understand and am So in am in favor of removing it. Because compression is not a "feature" of horizon, but that of django and compressor "app"'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-11 22:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Could you please be kind and explain me why is horizon testing
> compression ?

To my best knowledge, there is no specific reason that horizon.test.settings configures  COMPRESS_ENABLED = True. Perpahs it was copied from openstack_dashboard.test.settings
when openstack_dashboard and horizon were split.

> I could not understand and am So in am in favor of removing it.
> Because compression is not a "feature" of horizon, but that of
> django and compressor "app"

Do you mean that "compress" is completely dropped in horizon.test.settings or do you suggest "COMPRESS_ENABLED = True"? I am confused with your comment. "horizon" (not "openstack_dashboard") does not depend on "compress" feature, so I think you can drop "compress" related settings from horizon.test.settings if you want.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-03-15 17:13:32.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

due to long inactivity. I don't see a reason with this change either."}]

commit_message:
Do not set COMPRESS_ENABLED explicitly

it is always opposite of DEBUG[1].
this also helps keep compressor OFF during test as test do not need
static files

Any plugins needing compression can explicitly enable in its own
local_settings

1 -
https://django-compressor.readthedocs.io/en/stable/settings/#django.conf.settings.COMPRESS_ENABLED

Change-Id: I9f3979da38cca677256799be8eb215a4ea32cf12

commit_message:
Add resources to put iDRAC in known good state

This change adds the iDRACCardService, JobCollection, JobService, and
LCService resources. Those offer actions to reset the iDRAC, get jobs,
delete jobs, and check if iDRAC is ready.

Change-Id: I29ce49c0865a610f2fb10f5072893bbf51b47303
Story: 2007617
Task: 40985

subject: Only add rhel base repos when REG_REPOS is not set
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-03-10 22:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-03-12 05:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-03-15 14:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 22:15:27.000000000', 'message': "Only add rhel base repos when REG_REPOS is not set

For offline (satellite based) installs the base repos won't be
available and the base packages will come from a different named repo
in satellite which will be specified by REG_REPOS.

This change will ensure no base repos are added when REG_REPOS are
specified so offline image builds are possible. All required base
repos need to be added to REG_REPOS when it is used. Documentation[1]
already includes base repos, so this should not be disruptive.

[1] https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_openstack_platform/16.1/html/director_installation_and_usage/creating-whole-disk-images#disk-image-environment-variables

Change-Id: Iafb81d50dffdac40d3b011670200b8da4c3a58f0
"}]
commit_message:
Only add rhel base repos when REG_REPOS is not set

For offline (satellite based) installs the base repos won't be
available and the base packages will come from a different named repo
in satellite which will be specified by REG_REPOS.

This change will ensure no base repos are added when REG_REPOS are
specified so offline image builds are possible. All required base
repos need to be added to REG_REPOS when it is used. Documentation[1]
already includes base repos, so this should not be disruptive.

[1] https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_openstack_platform/16.1/html/director_installation_and_usage/creating-whole-disk-images#disk-image-environment-variables

Change-Id: Iafb81d50dffdac40d3b011670200b8da4c3a58f0

Can you explain the reason for this? Project names are not unique in the presence of multiple domains, so allowing names could result in errors for users in some cases. Also IMHO it's confusing to have a property that's specifically named project_*id* that accepts a name. Presumably there's a good reason that the Neutron API only accepts an ID. > (1 comment)

 > name. Presumably there's a good reason that the Neutron API only
 > accepts an ID. What is the use case where the user needs to specify

The intention of this commit was to allow a translation so that if a network was being setup for tenant1,  then the value ‚Äòtenant1‚Äô could be passed into the template, rather than requiring a UUID lookup outside of heat.
 
resources/openstack/neutron/net.py  already accepted a tenant_id attribute,  this was just meant to simplify things and allow a name."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-12-19 04:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-05-05 10:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add tenant_id property and constraints for neutron router, net and subnet

Support TENANT_ID for neutron net, subnet, router to be a NAME.

This code invokes a Heat translation rule to auto-convert TENANT_ID
value to a UUID if it is a NAME
Note: In Keystone V3 TENANT_ID means a PROJECT_ID.
The underlying neutron calls still require a UUID,
this just makes the HEAT template code simpler and less error prone.

Change-Id: Ib6d9ab8edf9cdcb9efc559e3a55c617968b85e1b
Story: 2003949
Task: 26865

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-07 19:44:29.000000000', 'message': 'Don't run grub2-install for efi block devices

As of grub2 >= 2.02-95 calling grub2-install on an EFI partition will
fail with: "this utility cannot be used for EFI platforms because it
does not support UEFI Secure Boot." In the case of ironic deployments,
ironic-python-agent will call efibootmgr to set the local boot for
subsequent boots.

This version of grub is now in centos8-stream and non-eus repos of
RHEL-8. It is not currently possible to build whole-disk UEFI images on
these distros, and when this package is promoted this will also affect
centos8 and RHEL-8 eus. The grub maintainers made this change because
the generated /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI will never be capable of
booting with Secure Boot.

This change defines a $EFI_BOOT_DIR for every distro element, and uses
that in the bootloader element to generate a grub.cfg file in
/boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR. Using centos as an example, this allows UEFI
to boot /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grubx64.efi. This is the first step to
supporting Secure Boot capable whole disk images, the next step will
be to install the signed shim efi files.

Change-Id: I90925218ff2aa4c4daffcf86e686b6d98d6b0f21
'}, {'created': '2021-03-07 21:56:47.000000000', 'message': 'Don't run grub2-install for efi block devices

As of grub2 >= 2.02-95 calling grub2-install on an EFI partition will
fail with: "this utility cannot be used for EFI platforms because it
does not support UEFI Secure Boot." In the case of ironic deployments,
ironic-python-agent will call efibootmgr to set the local boot for
subsequent boots.

This version of grub is now in centos8-stream and non-eus repos of
RHEL-8. It is not currently possible to build whole-disk UEFI images
on these distros, and when this package is promoted this will also
affect centos8 and RHEL-8 eus. The grub maintainers made this change
because the grub2-install generated /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI
will never be capable of booting with Secure Boot.

This change defines a $EFI_BOOT_DIR for every distro element, and uses
that in the bootloader element to generate a grub.cfg file in
/boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR. This change also installs the shim package,
which installs a copy of the shim bootloader to
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI. Using centos as an example, this
allows UEFI will boot the shim /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI which
then chains to /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grubx64.efi.

This also means that produced images are now Secure Boot capable, and
this has been confirmed locally to work.

Change-Id: I90925218ff2aa4c4daffcf86e686b6d98d6b0f21

'}, {'created': '2021-03-10 20:37:18.000000000', 'message': 'Support secure-boot bootloader where possible

As of grub2 >= 2.02-95 on redhat family distros, calling grub2-install
on an EFI partition will fail with: "this utility cannot be used for
EFI platforms because it does not support UEFI Secure Boot."

This version of grub is now in centos8-stream and non-eus repos of
RHEL-8. It is not currently possible to build whole-disk UEFI images
on these distros, and when this package is promoted this will also
affect centos8 and RHEL-8 eus. The grub maintainers made this change
because the grub2-install generated /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI
will never be capable of booting with Secure Boot.

This change defines a $EFI_BOOT_DIR for every distro element. When
directory /boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR exists a grub.cfg file in will be
generated there. This change also installs the shim package on redhat
family distros, which installs a copy of the shim bootloader to
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI. Using centos as an example, this
allows UEFI to boot the shim /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI which
then chains to /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grubx64.efi.

If /boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR doesn't exist (such as for Ubuntu,
/boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu) the current behaviour of running grub-install to
generate /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI will continue. For distros
such as Ubutnu where packaging does not populate /boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu
with .efi files, secure boot can be added in the future by copying
.efi files to /boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu and copying the shim file to
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI.

Change-Id: I90925218ff2aa4c4daffcf86e686b6d98d6b0f21

allows UEFI to boot the shim /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI which
then chains to /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grubx64.efi.

If /boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR doesn't exist (such as for Ubuntu,
/boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu) the current behaviour of running grub-install to
generate /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI will continue. For distros

commit_message:
Support secure-boot bootloader where possible

As of grub2 >= 2.02-95 on redhat family distros, calling grub2-install
on an EFI partition will fail with: "this utility cannot be used for
EFI platforms because it does not support UEFI Secure Boot."

This version of grub is now in centos8-stream and non-eus repos of
RHEL-8. It is not currently possible to build whole-disk UEFI images
on these distros, and when this package is promoted this will also
affect centos8 and RHEL-8 eus. The grub maintainers made this change
because the grub2-install generated /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI
will never be capable of booting with Secure Boot.

This change defines a $EFI_BOOT_DIR for every distro element. When
directory /boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR exists a grub.cfg file in will be
generated there. This change also installs the shim package on redhat
family distros, which installs a copy of the shim bootloader to
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI. Using centos as an example, this
allows UEFI to boot the shim /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI which
then chains to /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grubx64.efi.

If /boot/efi/$EFI_BOOT_DIR doesn't exist (such as for Ubuntu,
/boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu) the current behaviour of running grub-install to
generate /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI will continue. For distros
such as Ubutnu where packaging does not populate /boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu
with .efi files, secure boot can be added in the future by copying
.efi files to /boot/efi/EFI/ubuntu and copying the shim file to
/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/BOOTX64.EFI.

Change-Id: I90925218ff2aa4c4daffcf86e686b6d98d6b0f21

commit_message:
Handle root as a deployment user better

Currently if you don't specify --deployment-user and for whatever reason
it's run as root (e.g. ansible as root using sudo), the deployment fails
because it attempts to write out to /home/root/. This change updates the
user home root lookup for clouds.yaml and throws a warning about setting
--deployment-user if it's root.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_deploy.py

Closes-Bug: #1918560
Change-Id: I284b374cc5e6d6a147286f0485832258f93f038f
(cherry picked from commit ff56863b261370af213c1ae1a836e87b8b852579)
(cherry picked from commit d57af5e77ee39a9e6ca454d1f915a2f74278628c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-08 13:42:13.000000000', 'message': 'Move cell_v2 discovery off compute hosts

In I12a02f636f31985bc1b71bff5b744d346286a95f cell_v2 discovery was
originally moved from the nova-api container to the
nova-compute|nova-ironic containers in order to run cell
discovery during a scale up where the controllers are omitted
(e.g to exclude the controllers from a maintenance window).

This requires api database credentials on the compute node, which is
forbidden, so it must move back to a nova-api host as a pre-requisite
for removing these credentials in a follow-up patch.

Scale-up while omitting the controllers will no longer work out of the
box. Either a manual cell_v2 discovery can be run after scale up, or an
additional node can be deployed using the NovaManager tripleo role.

Related-bug: #1786961
Related-bug: #1871482
Change-Id: I47b95ad46e2d4e5b1f370a2f840826e87da2d703
(cherry picked from commit 629485dde5d6b96d38688f362362fac45392ece9)
(cherry picked from commit 03697234fd2e8c8d052c331485d304bcb77b1b8b)
(cherry picked from commit 9a8c007daa5d02e20454a39ee453ea6e9f6b0292)
'}]
commit_message:
Move cell_v2 discovery off compute hosts

In I12a02f636f31985bc1b71bff5b744d346286a95f cell_v2 discovery was
originally moved from the nova-api container to the
nova-compute|nova-ironic containers in order to run cell
discovery during a scale up where the controllers are omitted
(e.g to exclude the controllers from a maintenance window).

This requires api database credentials on the compute node, which is
forbidden, so it must move back to a nova-api host as a pre-requisite
for removing these credentials in a follow-up patch.

Scale-up while omitting the controllers will no longer work out of the
box. Either a manual cell_v2 discovery can be run after scale up, or an
additional node can be deployed using the NovaManager tripleo role.

Related-bug: #1786961
Related-bug: #1871482
Change-Id: I47b95ad46e2d4e5b1f370a2f840826e87da2d703
(cherry picked from commit 629485dde5d6b96d38688f362362fac45392ece9)
(cherry picked from commit 03697234fd2e8c8d052c331485d304bcb77b1b8b)
(cherry picked from commit 9a8c007daa5d02e20454a39ee453ea6e9f6b0292)

commit_message:
WIP: relinker: only invalidate hash when link is created

If the relinker visits a partition more than once it may find
pre-existing links in the new partition. There's no need to invalidate
hashes when a link already exists and the object dir hasn't been
changed.

Change-Id: I7c054afe6789b4d8ae64603670e9c4a6315fdcf2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 17:06:18.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Use firmware metadata files to configure instance

We now have the machinery in place to parse QEMU's firmware metadata
files, which means we no longer need to store a hardcoded list of
possible firmware locations nor build upon this to include additional
information like "does this support secure boot". Start using this and
cut out the legacy stuff.

Eventually all of this will be changed yet again in favour of libvirt's
firmware auto-selection functionality, but that needs a little more work
before it's suitable for us [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1906500

Blueprint: allow-secure-boot-for-qemu-kvm-guests
Change-Id: Ie99e43cb0408eae4034d410b9dd204cd39984fd1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Use firmware metadata files to configure instance

We now have the machinery in place to parse QEMU's firmware metadata
files, which means we no longer need to store a hardcoded list of
possible firmware locations nor build upon this to include additional
information like "does this support secure boot". Start using this and
cut out the legacy stuff.

Eventually all of this will be changed yet again in favour of libvirt's
firmware auto-selection functionality, but that needs a little more work
before it's suitable for us [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1906500

Blueprint: allow-secure-boot-for-qemu-kvm-guests
Change-Id: Ie99e43cb0408eae4034d410b9dd204cd39984fd1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add separate policy for updates with no changes

Allow operators to set a different (presumably looser) policy on PATCH
updates that don't make any changes to the stack, but just retrigger a
new update traversal (that will result in e.g. replacing any unhealthy
resources).

Change-Id: Id29e7ec7f6cf127177ea7ab29127b0568afaa18b
Task: 37305

commit_message:
Update Redfish RAID release note

The Redfish RAID release note did not reference the related
story. This patch updates the release note to include a link to
the story.

The formatting of the release note is also updated to respect the
maximum 80 characters per line convention.

Change-Id: Iac0c6fdb116c14a402c0ea86f98f6a72064adbbc
Story: 2003514
Task: 42024

Scenario001 is able to complete the execution using cephadm in place of ceph-ansible [1]
The osd container is now started using the spec [2] and here the logs of osd.0 [3]
Scenario004, however, is able to test ceph-ansible deployments because we pushed the following parameters:
```
ceph_docker_image: ceph-ci/daemon
ceph_docker_image_tag: v4.0.13-stable-4.0-nautilus-centos-7-x86_64
ceph_docker_registry: quay.ceph.io
```
This is expected and works as it used to do.
We're planning to switch scenario004 to cephadm when:

1. RBD job is consolidated
2. the missing components (rgw,manila,ceph dashboard, etc) are properly enabled/configured

[1] https://1f0b3b24dc35c1915d1d-a9316e64b81f2ce5f268bcd5513de1bc.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/767294/42/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/833dd1c/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-a608r2s3/cephadm/cephadm_command.log

Zuul would be all green except for tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone.
The cephadm ansible run did not fail [1][2].
The config-download ansible run did not fail either [3][4].
The failure was during python-tempestconf [5][6]. 
Tempest failed when trying to upload the cirros glance image [7].
The error in the glance log [8][9] refers to cinder volume 8b736096-3c56-460f-a69e-2d54f8eb1795.
Cinder scheduler unable to create volume because "No valid backend was found" [10][11].
No error found in cinder logs when "Starting volume driver RBDDriver" [12][13].

Footnotes which link to specific logs in http://paste.openstack.org/show/802523/'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-02-10 15:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 52:

Temporary abandon to save CI resources. Will restore soon.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-02-10 21:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-02-10 21:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 53: Workflow-1

I think the tempest glance image upload failure [1] is caused by LP 1913449 [2].

- Ceph client installed in tripleo containers becomes octopus (766683) [3]
- Even though 001 was hard coded to nautilus [4] the new clients were in with the cinder bug [2]

So we need recheck this after we get tripleo cinder containers with the fix [5].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/802523/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1913449
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-repos/+/766683
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/773458
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/773694'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-02-11 11:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 54.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-02-11 12:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 55.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-02-11 13:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 55:

The problem here is related to the ssh access. The key is created and properly distributed, but after digging more into this issue I realized it failed to ssh the node due to some permission issues on the created ceph-admin $HOME dir.
Here an example of a working env vs a broken one:

"""
[root@oc0-controller-0 tmp]# ls -ldZ /home/*
drwx------. 4 ceph-admin    ceph-admin    unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0 114 Feb  9 11:08 /home/ceph-admin
drwx------. 6 heat-admin    heat-admin    unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0 156 Feb 10 19:36 /home/heat-admin
drwx------. 2 qemu          qemu          unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0  62 Feb  9 10:20 /home/qemu
drwx------. 7 tripleo-admin tripleo-admin unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0 134 Feb  9 14:02 /home/tripleo-admin


[root@standalone ~]# ls -ldZ /home/*
drwx------. 3    1001    1002 unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0   74 Mar  3 12:33 /home/ceph-admin
drwx------. 2 qemu    qemu    unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0   62 Mar  3 10:44 /home/qemu
drwx------. 9 vagrant vagrant unconfined_u:object_r:user_home_dir_t:s0 4096 Mar  3 11:39 /home/vagrant
"""

Fixing manually the ownership of /home/ceph-admin, everything works as expected.

Now, I'm not sure what changed behind the scenes, but I need to dig more into it and make sure this won't happen.

@marios, @gfidente, @fultonj, thoughts or suggestions?'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-03-03 13:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 60: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Hey Marios,
thanks a lot for the info, I'm going to recheck!
Sorry for your comment regarding CephAnsibleDiskConfig: that parameter is actually still relevant for CephAnsible based deployments, because in that scenario you  can always specify (pass) a list of devices, and that's the reason is not among the list of deprecated parameters.
However, we changed the default to [] because having /dev/vdb wasn't a safe default as you don't know in advance this info from the operator's environment."}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-08 08:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 61:

so does that mean we don't need to change the job for glance to use ceph as the backend?"}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-09 08:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 64:

> Patch Set 64: Code-Review+1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> so i just replied to john's email about this but I see scenario1 is now green here?
> 
> tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/ce93f1819cb54b4191d5892c4efa96d4 : SUCCESS in 1h 47m 24s
> 
> so does that mean we don't need to change the job for glance to use ceph as the backend?

Hey Marios, thanks for taking some time and checking this submission! Yes, even though the job could be changed to rbd for glance, as per our (ceph+cinder people) previous analysis there's no reason for this job to stop working, and that's something we can discuss as a follow-up of the cephadm integration.
In the previous executions we saw all the cinder-volume backends down, and that's why the tempest setup task failed. Cinder is the backend for glance, but it uses ceph as backend, and since the cinder component has no ack of a working ceph cluster, all the backends resulted in the "down" state.
(see the email thread for more details).
Now, as per our last test, sounds like the root cause is related to multiple things:

1. timing: some operations (e.g. pool creation) should be run only when Ceph is up (up means we need mons, mgrs and osds running) [1].

2. CI has only one osd on top of a loop device: this means we need to set the osd_default_pool_size = 1, or the cluster hangs [2] because the default replica is 3 (but only one osd is found)


All these factors are relevant for both scenario001 and scenario004, that's why we added the Dependency on [3], the patch which was supposed to improve 001 and introduce the tripleo-ansible code for 004.
As you can see on the log, that patch can be used here because if no services other than rbd are defined, the rest of the playbook [4] is skipped, so it makes a lot of sense merging that patch (which is green in terms of CI) before this one, which doesn't require additional changes in terms of code.

[1] https://9b86ab5bbc6be76c9905-30f46d6ec556e6b2dd47ea35fedbb1ac.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/767294/64/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/ce93f18/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-oafit7vs/cephadm/cephadm_command.log

[2] https://9b86ab5bbc6be76c9905-30f46d6ec556e6b2dd47ea35fedbb1ac.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/767294/64/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/ce93f18/logs/undercloud/home/ceph-admin/bootstrap_ceph.conf
 
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/773364
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/773364/62/tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cephadm.yml'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-03-09 08:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 64:

commit_message:
Add cephadm deployment and environments branch

During the overcloud deployment phase, some operations should still be
performed on the provisioned Ceph cluster.
When Ceph is TripleO deployed, cephadm doesn't provide any firewall
configuration (‚Äì-skip-firewalld is provided), as well as any HA
configuration for the Ceph Dashboard.
This change introduces a new cephadm/ branch containing all the services
that should be configured in the TripleO context.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I35e57abddc64310a6422174fe191bd328588d7cd
Change-Id: Ie9537471924d1d60f7642699e58e734511b91a2b

commit_message:
Add deployed_vip_port templates

Add a new deployed_vip_port template which will replace
the current neutron port templates when vip ports are
managed outside of the heat stack.

Change-Id: Ia1f7e344ccebb2291f1574fdb69c05f00f4c3dc9
Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia55ee2b45e706b83de7259c9064bf042d3fc503c

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774119
Change-Id: I92552d013db98b972124db901f3f35a326110846
(cherry picked from commit 42d1e8567d7441633ac9770c9301d8c5e5c0acd1)

commit_message:
Add Vitrage template resource

The VitrageTemplate resource is responsible for
adding a Vitrage template. This template can be
used, for example, to execute a Mistral healing
workflow.

Depends-On: If05f0907d8f43f64327c7774170e5b559286fc06
Depends-On: I56560d014a02b5f2ddbc08689d39147fbe4ffca4
Change-Id: Ie862e88ccb82c819b93fa2dbc5f21af61b138046
Story: 2002684
Task: 22504

commit_message:
Add TLS options for swift memcached client

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context
in the swift memcached client.
(see https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/765552)

Change-Id: I4371d49df847236be18f1a33caa8b3f186f5eaf1
(cherry picked from commit 0688c8a576dd71af5a13b1da636de881e9be2224)

subject: Python tests are now run trough stestr.
messages:
[{'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-03-05 16:13:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We should be cautious here; and I'd like to discuss this at our next sync.  What's the story with versioning for pip installed resources?

Do any existing test break while we're in a state of progress between this start and the ultimate goal?

Thanks Jiri!"}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2021-03-05 16:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-03-08 00:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-08 07:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-08 07:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-08 08:09:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> We should be cautious here; and I'd like to discuss this at our next sync.  What's the story with versioning for pip installed resources?
> 
> Do any existing test break while we're in a state of progress between this start and the ultimate goal?
> 
> Thanks Jiri!

I'll elaborate at the sync, but for purpose of clarity:
Setting version of each package ensures that our dependencies behave as they should.
Every packaging system does it. Requirements file is different for tests and the actual package, because tests don't require installation and use of the entire package. In fact it would be detrimental to their purpose, which is to test behavior of individual constructs.

As for the tests breaking. This stage shouldn't, by itself, break any existing tests.
Nor should it cause CI issues. Further changes will alter the existing tests, but still shouldn't break any. At very least I see no reason they should."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-03-08 08:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2021-03-08 12:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-09 08:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-09 10:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 4.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-09 10:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-03-10 10:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Python tests are now run trough stestr.

Number of the environment variables passed to tox envs was
reduced from all, to just one.

This is preparatory step for further test developmet.
Reviews for test infrastructure, refactoring and coverage
will be on branches from this one.

tools/validate_files.py:
	Changed encoding to utf-8 to prevent
	linting error.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idd82aecb7b66433396639ed800a33b109a06e11a

[{'created': '2019-08-05 18:57:07.000000000', 'message': 'Allow turning off max_stacks limit

The limit of 100 is fairly low for a normal production environment.
Allow setting the limit to -1 to turn it off. Also raise
limit to 512 which should be a bit more reasonable as a default.

Change-Id: I9e54b20437875ed88b79414aa4fc17b17cbd305b
Related-Bug: #1221849
'}]
commit_message:
Allow turning off max_stacks limit

The limit of 100 is fairly low for a normal production environment.
Allow setting the limit to -1 to turn it off. Also raise
limit to 512 which should be a bit more reasonable as a default.

Change-Id: I9e54b20437875ed88b79414aa4fc17b17cbd305b
Related-Bug: #1221849

subject: Add segments attribute to OS::Neutron::ProviderNet
messages:
[{'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2020-02-04 18:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:09:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This looks good (test failure is unrelated; the grenade job is borked).

Just one question: is this value expected to be stable (i.e. doesn't really change once the ProviderNet is created, unless you update it) or is it something that continuously varies over time or as other resources are created/updated/deleted?"}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2020-02-07 19:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for your review ! Concerning the segments attribute, it can vary as much as the subnet one, operator can create a new segment in self service with a new subnet in order to create a routed provider network topology : https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-routed-networks.html'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-10 15:57:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The reason I ask is that Heat stores any attribute values that are referenced in outputs or other resources at the time the resource is created or updated. So if e.g. people are expecting to be able to use stack-show to get the list of currently available segments, they are going to be disappointed.

You didn't specify in the story what your use case is. Do you anticipate this attribute being referenced elsewhere in the same template? What for?"}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2020-02-11 07:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 15:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 15:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-03-15 11:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-15 03:08:50.000000000', 'message': '[Train-only] Fix pin of bundler on CentOS7

The change d266e3df36d914f2697d0429b7024a8ae6c8fcc0 pinned bundler
to 2.2.11 but that version is not compabitle with CentOS7.
Because we still have a unit test job on CentOS7 in stable/train
we should pin it to older version on CentOS7.

Change-Id: I4906329aa13e9ca1268319c11c8ac0f704e661f1
'}]
commit_message:
[Train-only] Fix pin of bundler on CentOS7

The change d266e3df36d914f2697d0429b7024a8ae6c8fcc0 pinned bundler
to 2.2.11 but that version is not compabitle with CentOS7.
Because we still have a unit test job on CentOS7 in stable/train
we should pin it to older version on CentOS7.

Change-Id: I4906329aa13e9ca1268319c11c8ac0f704e661f1

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774119
Change-Id: I835641d402e6cbd6650efd0d7a1fb16fb361350e
(cherry picked from commit 7ae8aa377e393c28af1d8d6b0ba059b984da0725)

commit_message:
Use resource_id instead of phy rsrc name in InstanceGroup

* OS::Heat::InstanceGroup
* OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup
* AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup

Story: #2007007
Task: #37870

Change-Id: I7fd223a3bde1c5d2ecd073124a25675567e406d2

[{'created': '2021-03-15 08:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iac4d7bc636362f169fe3f1e09e726051ac07303b

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I589decfa42329da00789cb2021e0a62c911a80ee

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-06 15:56:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix Cinder log parsing

The Cinder API log is currently written to a file called
cinder-wsgi.log, and the WSGI logs to cinder-api.log. Fluentd
then tries to parse the WSGI log as an OpenStack log which
results in 'got incomplete line' errors and prevents proper
ingestion of these logs.

Co-Authored-By: yaoning <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
Closes-Bug: 1916752
Change-Id: I3296dcc4780160cbf88bd18285571276f58bb249
(cherry picked from commit fa5511c75d79d8e258c4fa880d2c7a880b838bde)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Cinder log parsing

The Cinder API log is currently written to a file called
cinder-wsgi.log, and the WSGI logs to cinder-api.log. Fluentd
then tries to parse the WSGI log as an OpenStack log which
results in 'got incomplete line' errors and prevents proper
ingestion of these logs.

Co-Authored-By: yaoning <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
Closes-Bug: 1916752
Change-Id: I3296dcc4780160cbf88bd18285571276f58bb249
(cherry picked from commit fa5511c75d79d8e258c4fa880d2c7a880b838bde)

nova-conductor logs show etcd3gw module not installed, resulting in an error
(but not failure) during instance create:

Could not load 'oslo_cache.etcd3gw': No module named 'etcd3gw':
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'etcd3gw'

This patch adds etcd3gw.

Change-Id: I18ae463a50cc8b6039682fa5f62fb8e2d85419c8
"}]
commit_message:
Add etcd3gw module

nova-conductor logs show etcd3gw module not installed, resulting in an error
(but not failure) during instance create:

Could not load 'oslo_cache.etcd3gw': No module named 'etcd3gw':
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'etcd3gw'

This patch adds etcd3gw.

Change-Id: I18ae463a50cc8b6039682fa5f62fb8e2d85419c8

commit_message:
libvirt: Add vDPA nodedev parsing

Add the ability to look up vDPA nodedevs via their parent VF and
marshal the result into a nodedev object. This requires a new version of
libvirt and QEMU so we must add constants to protect that.

Blueprint: libvirt-vdpa-support
Change-Id: I043880cb81b02488d13c3387d696142545c13395

Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I74cbe956ebc2984572e79c0182ef301f08e2facb

commit_message:
libvirt: Move PCI host device parsing to 'host'

This was previously located in the 'driver' module, but we're going to
need access to it for other functions in the 'host' module in the
future. Move it now, ahead of time.

Blueprint: libvirt-vdpa-support
Change-Id: Idbae429acbe7083ad76462c9bedab1b084e1d854

commit_message:
Prevent neutron-l3-agent restart killing metadata service

The existing handler which prevents keepalived from being killed
during neutron-l3-agent restarts doesn't go far enough at present.

This patch adjusts the processes which are killed to exclude the
haproxy instance which is responsible for proxying the Nova
metadata service.

Change-Id: I407c6662841bec9d3e3208d2e46bd7d1d5db00fb

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic5998308cf6892066b296a9e9455466d12f0d720
